Title: GD Midea FT30-3D AC Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: locate and remove the 14.5 mm phillips 1 screw on the bottom of the fan base .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the 14.5 mm Phillips #1 screw on the bottom of the fan base.

Lines.Text: locate the gray base support release tabs found on either side pictured in the first image .
there are release tabs on each side of the base .
press both release tabs in with the tip of your fingers and pull the gray base support until the tabs are cleared .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the gray base support release tabs found on either side pictured in the first image. There are release tabs on each side of the base. Press both release tabs in with the tip of your fingers and pull the gray base support until the tabs are cleared.

Lines.Text: continue removing the gray base support by pressing your thumb into the circular opening in the base and pulling with your figures on the back side .
'''notice''' that on the internal front tip of the base there is a tab . because of this tab the back end will pivot off at that point .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue removing the gray base support by pressing your thumb into the circular opening in the base and pulling with your figures on the back side. '''Notice''' that on the internal front tip of the base there is a tab. Because of this tab the back end will pivot off at that point.

Lines.Text: after the base has separated more it will be easy to fully remove it . continue pulling the back edge of the gray base support , rotating it around the front tab until it comes off completely .

Steps.Text_raw: After the base has separated more it will be easy to fully remove it. Continue pulling the back edge of the gray base support, rotating it around the front tab until it comes off completely.

Lines.Text: remove the following five 14.5 mm phillips 1 screws found on the bottom .
all of the screws are recessed by 17.5 mm , so ensure your screwdriver can reach that far .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the following five 14.5 mm Phillips #1 screws found on the bottom. All of the screws are recessed by 17.5 mm, so ensure your screwdriver can reach that far.

Lines.Text: once all five screws have been removed the base cover should fall right off with out any effort .
when putting the base cover back on ; be careful to make sure that none of the wires are pinched .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all five screws have been removed the base cover should fall right off with out any effort. When putting the base cover back on; be careful to make sure that none of the wires are pinched.

Lines.Text: remove the two 15 mm phillips screws on the retention plate .
the tan retention plate will fall off once the screws are removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 15 mm Phillips screws on the retention plate. The tan retention plate will fall off once the screws are removed.

Lines.Text: take the 1.5 mm flathead screwdriver , or any thin elongated tool that fits into the semi-circular holes along side the ac power cord white wire . press into the hole gently to release the grip on the wire .
the ac power cord wire should release with ease if done properly .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the 1.5 mm Flathead Screwdriver, or any thin elongated tool that fits into the semi-circular holes along side the AC power cord white wire. Press into the hole gently to release the grip on the wire. The AC power cord wire should release with ease if done properly.

Lines.Text: cut the existing cable tie bundling the other ac power cord , red , orange , gray , and blue wires together .
remove or cut the crimp connector connecting the blue wire and the ac power cord wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the existing cable tie bundling the other AC power cord, red, orange, gray, and blue wires together. Remove or cut the crimp connector connecting the blue wire and the AC power cord wire.

Lines.Text: take the new ac power cord and follow the steps in reverse order .
it will help to use a soldering iron to solder the tip of the wire that gets inserted into the power/speed switch .
you may need a new cable tie and wire terminator with the new power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Take the new AC power cord and follow the steps in reverse order. It will help to use a soldering iron to solder the tip of the wire that gets inserted into the power/speed switch. You may need a new cable tie and wire terminator with the new power cord.

Subject: AC Power Cord

Title: How to Clean the Dyson DC14 Internal Channels

Lines.Text: the channels that become dirty with dust are in the canister of your vacuum .
start with the canister of your vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: The channels that become dirty with dust are in the canister of your vacuum. Start with the canister of your vacuum.

Lines.Text: turn the canister around and locate the latch that secures the outer housing of the canister to the cyclone assembly , and push it upwards .
now , free the cyclone assembly from the clear , plastic canister housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the canister around and locate the latch that secures the outer housing of the canister to the cyclone assembly, and push it upwards. Now, free the cyclone assembly from the clear, plastic canister housing.

Lines.Text: clean the inside of the cyclone assembly out . use a cloth to clean ; the more dust you can clear the less dust will end up in the exhaust of your vacuum .

if you have an air compressor , don't be afraid to use it to blow the dust out of all the nooks and crannies of the cyclone assembly . this is a very sturdy component , and the strong air currents will not damage it .

Steps.Text_raw: Clean the inside of the cyclone assembly out.  Use a cloth to clean; the more dust you can clear the less dust will end up in the exhaust of your vacuum. If you have an air compressor, don't be afraid to use it to blow the dust out of all the nooks and crannies of the cyclone assembly.  This is a very sturdy component, and the strong air currents will not damage it.

Title: Dyson DC14 Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: turn off the vacuum and unplug it from the outlet .
lay the vacuum on its top so that the brush bar faces you .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the vacuum and unplug it from the outlet. Lay the vacuum on its top so that the brush bar faces you.

Lines.Text: using a quarter , turn the three soleplate fasteners 90 degrees to the left .
holding the soleplate on both sides , tilt it down and away from the vacuum .
remove the soleplate from the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a quarter,  turn the three soleplate fasteners 90 degrees to the left. Holding the soleplate on both sides, tilt it down and away from the vacuum. Remove the soleplate from the vacuum.

Lines.Text: turn down the squared tabs on the brushbar so that they face outward .
use a screwdriver to pry the belt up from the brushbar .
be careful not to cut the belt with the screwdriver .
while holding the belt , pull the brushbar to the left and remove it from the vacuum .
you can let go of the belt when it's free from the brushbar . the belt will not retract into the vacuum .
during reassembly , insert the brushbar with the tabs facing outward , then rotate the tabs up to lock the brushbar in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn down the squared tabs on the brushbar so that they face outward. Use a screwdriver to pry the belt up from the brushbar. Be careful not to cut the belt with the screwdriver. While holding the belt, pull the brushbar to the left and remove it from the vacuum. You can let go of the belt when it's free from the brushbar.  The belt will not retract into the vacuum. During reassembly, insert the brushbar with the tabs facing outward, then rotate the tabs up to lock the brushbar in place.

Lines.Text: place vacuum upright , with the canister facing you .
remove the canister , setting the canister aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Place vacuum upright, with the canister facing you. Remove the canister, setting the canister aside.

Lines.Text: insert flathead screwdriver under each latch and pry up gently .
do not try to lift the latches up very far , they could snap off !
open the cover , remove the exhaust filter , and set the filter to the side

Steps.Text_raw: Insert flathead screwdriver under each latch and pry up gently. Do not try to lift the latches up very far, they could snap off! Open the cover, remove the exhaust filter, and set the filter to the side

Lines.Text: place vacuum face down .
remove the u-bend pipe that connects the canister to the telescopic wand .

Steps.Text_raw: Place vacuum face down. Remove the u-bend pipe that connects the canister to the telescopic wand.

Lines.Text: pull the clear hose out of the gasket on the right side of the vacuum under the axle .
pull the hose straight back towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the clear hose out of the gasket on the right side of the vacuum under the axle. Pull the hose straight back towards you.

Lines.Text: remove brush-bar housing by prying the housing out of the clips that hold it .
pull brush-bar housing toward you while keeping vacuum stationary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove brush-bar housing by prying the housing out of the clips that hold it. Pull brush-bar housing toward you while keeping vacuum stationary.

Lines.Text: remove the three t15 torx screws that secure the cover to the brush clutch belt .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three T15 torx screws that secure the cover to the brush clutch belt.

Lines.Text: pull the cover of the brush clutch belt out towards you .
pull belt to the right to remove the belt from the brush clutch axle .
to reassemble your vacuum , pull the belt with your finger towards the axle . ( using a screwdriver , or a similar device , will delay access to the axle . )

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the cover of the brush clutch belt out towards you. Pull belt to the right to remove the belt from the brush clutch axle. To reassemble your vacuum, pull the belt with your finger towards the axle.  (Using a screwdriver, or a similar device, will delay access to the axle.)

Lines.Text: insert a flat-head screwdriver into the two locking rings to remove the rings , which are located above the wheels on both sides .
these rings secure the bottom assembly of the vacuum to the rest of the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert a flat-head screwdriver into the two locking rings to remove the rings, which are located above the wheels on both sides. These rings secure the bottom assembly of the vacuum to the rest of the unit.

Lines.Text: remove the four t15 torx screws that secure the motor housing to the vacuum .
remove the elbow-bend pipe on the right-side of the vacuum .
press the two release latches on either side of the elbow-bend pipe . pull it out and away from the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four T15 torx screws that secure the motor housing to the vacuum. Remove the elbow-bend pipe on the right-side of the vacuum. Press the two release latches on either side of the elbow-bend pipe. Pull it out and away from the vacuum.

Lines.Text: place the vacuum right-side up and leave it standing up .
remove the right side cover by pushing the release latch down while lifting the cover towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the vacuum right-side up and leave it standing up. Remove the right side cover by pushing the release latch down while lifting the cover towards you.

Lines.Text: set vacuum the on its back .
pull away the plastic cover of the motor housing .
a bit of force may be needed .

Steps.Text_raw: Set vacuum the on its back. Pull away the plastic cover of the motor housing. A bit of force may be needed.

Lines.Text: insert flat head screwdriver between gray motor housing and black motor .
pry motor cover housing away .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert flat head screwdriver between gray motor housing and black motor. Pry motor cover housing away.

Lines.Text: release the motor assembly from its housing by strongly hitting the brush clutch axle with a hammer .
the rubber grommets covering the motor may be greasy .

Steps.Text_raw: Release the motor assembly from its housing by strongly hitting the brush clutch axle with a hammer. The rubber grommets covering the motor may be greasy.

Lines.Text: remove motor from housing slowly .
do not pull the motor completely out of the housing . the motor is connected to the vacuum by two wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove motor from housing slowly. Do not pull the motor completely out of the housing. The motor is connected to the vacuum by two wires.

Lines.Text: remove the power terminals from both sides of the motor .
do not pull by the wires when removing terminal . this can result in damage to your vacuum .
these terminals will only fit one way ( i . e . only one end is long enough to reach to the far side of the motor ) .
remove the motor from the housing completely .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the power terminals from both sides of the motor. Do not pull by the wires when removing terminal. This can result in damage to your vacuum. These terminals will only fit one way (i.e. only one end is long enough to reach to the far side of the motor). Remove the motor from the housing completely.

Lines.Text: remove the two rubber grommets from your old motor , then transfer them to your new motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two rubber grommets from your old motor, then transfer them to your new motor.

Subject: Motor

Title: Speed Queen AES17AWF Heating Element and Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: 1 ) unplug the dryer !
2 ) tip the dryer onto its back and remove the panel below the door by removing the two screws in the lower corners .

Steps.Text_raw: 1) Unplug the dryer! 2) Tip the dryer onto its back and remove the panel below the door by removing the two screws in the lower corners.

Lines.Text: 3 ) at this point you can see the heating element in the back lower left corner . make careful note of where the 3 harness wires connect . ( make a diagram or take a picture ! )
if needed , the electrical schematic can be found in the space behind the control knobs .
remove the two screws on the back of the plastic bezel on top of the controls . a hole will allow you to get a hold of the schematic taped to the bottom of the compartment .

Steps.Text_raw: 3) At this point you can see the heating element in the back lower left corner. Make careful note of where the 3 harness wires connect. (Make a diagram or take a picture!) If needed, the electrical schematic can be found in the space behind the control knobs. Remove the two screws on the back of the plastic bezel on top of the controls. A hole will allow you to get a hold of the schematic taped to the bottom of the compartment.

Lines.Text: 4 ) remove the 3 wires ( one 12 ga black , one 12 ga orange , one 14 ga bl/bk ) . check the resistance across the heater terminals - it should be around 10 ohms . also check for burned connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: 4) Remove the 3 wires (one 12ga black, one 12ga orange, one 14ga bl/bk). Check the resistance across the heater terminals - it should be around 10 ohms. Also Check for burned connectors.

Lines.Text: 5 ) the heating element can be removed by removing two screws on the left and right edges of the element . it will slip right out .
remove the cycling thermostat and limit thermostat from the old element and place on the new one .
if replacing the heating element , you are done . reassemble .

Steps.Text_raw: 5) The heating element can be removed by removing two screws on the left and right edges of the element. It will slip right out. Remove the cycling thermostat and limit thermostat from the old element and place on the new one. If replacing the heating element, you are done. Reassemble.

Lines.Text: remove the two screws securing the lower edges of the door assembly .
rotate the lower edge up .
the door switch is at the upper right corner of the assembly and must be disconnected from the switch to completely free the door assembly . the wires go to connectors 1 ( common ) and 3 ( no ) .
note : a bad door switch will prevent dryer operation .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two screws securing the lower edges of the door assembly. Rotate the lower edge up. The door switch is at the upper right corner of the assembly and must be disconnected from the switch to completely free the door assembly. The wires go to connectors 1 (common) and 3 (NO). NOTE: A bad door switch will prevent dryer operation.

Lines.Text: the drum retainer plate is now exposed . it can be removed by removing 4 screws around the edges and lifting it off .
note the two tabs and slots near the lower screws .

Steps.Text_raw: The drum retainer plate is now exposed. It can be removed by removing 4 screws around the edges and lifting it off. Note the two tabs and slots near the lower screws.

Lines.Text: the drum is next . make a diagram of how the belt is arranged on the belt tensioner and motor pulley . reach behind the motor at the lower right and take the tension off the belt to remove the belt from the motor pulley .
at this point the belt can be replaced by slipping a new one over the drum and attaching it to the tensioner and belt pulley .
be very careful that the belt is not twisted and it is close to the wear track on the drum where it was running .
turn the drum slowly by hand to ensure everything runs smoothly .
if replacing a belt , you are done . reassemble .

Steps.Text_raw: The drum is next. Make a diagram of how the belt is arranged on the belt tensioner and motor pulley. Reach behind the motor at the lower right and take the tension off the belt to remove the belt from the motor pulley. At this point the belt can be replaced by slipping a new one over the drum and attaching it to the tensioner and belt pulley. Be very careful that the belt is not twisted and it is close to the wear track on the drum where it was running. Turn the drum slowly by hand to ensure everything runs smoothly. If replacing a belt, you are done. Reassemble.

Lines.Text: otherwise , remove one screw securing the top of the dryer to the sides to give it a little vertical clearance on the drum and lift the drum out .
the top of the dryer will still be attached by the wiring harness but can be set aside far enough to get access for the next operation .
the back plate is now exposed . there 4 screws around the edges holding it in as well as two more in the upper right corner securing the dryer power cord terminal block and a ground wire .
there is also one connector going to the neutral on the power cord terminal block ( make sure you reconnect it to neutral ! ) .
after all these are disconnected the back plate will lift out .

Steps.Text_raw: Otherwise, remove ONE screw securing the top of the dryer to the sides to give it a little vertical clearance on the drum and lift the drum out. The top of the dryer will still be attached by the wiring harness but can be set aside far enough to get access for the next operation. The back plate is now exposed. There 4 screws around the edges holding it in as well as two more in the upper right corner securing the dryer power cord terminal block and a ground wire. There is also one connector going to the neutral on the power cord terminal block (make sure you reconnect it to neutral!). After all these are disconnected the back plate will lift out.

Subject: Heating Element and Belt

Title: Removing the Tower Fan Rotating Blade and Transformer

Lines.Text: use a phillips 2 screwdriver to unscrew the four 6 mm phillips 0 back screws .
do this by unscrewing from left-to-right then pull the screws out of the back of the fan

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Philips #2 screwdriver to unscrew the four 6mm Phillips #0 back screws. Do this by unscrewing from left-to-right then pull the screws out of the back of the fan

Lines.Text: pull the front and back cover apart .
be careful not to pull the front cover off completely because it holds the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the front and back cover apart. Be careful not to pull the front cover off completely because it holds the wires.

Lines.Text: remove the phillips ( 5-mm head ) 6-mm screw that holds the circuit board to the outer shell of the fan .
make sure the fan is unplugged while removing the circuit board as you may get shocked .
to remove the screws , unscrew in a left-to-right fashion at an angle to make sure that the wires do not get tangled .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Phillips (5-mm head) 6-mm screw that holds the circuit board to the outer shell of the fan. Make sure the fan is unplugged while removing the circuit board as you may get shocked. To remove the screws, unscrew in a left-to-right fashion at an angle to make sure that the wires do not get tangled.

Lines.Text: remove the top cover containing the circuit board and the wires by pulling it away from the body of the fan .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top cover containing the circuit board and the wires by pulling it away from the body of the fan.

Lines.Text: remove the circuit board from the top cover . do not touch the other side of the circuit board as you may damage circuit elements .
unscrew the four screws on the top of the circuit board in a left-to-right fashion . after pull screws out of the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the circuit board from the top cover. Do not touch the other side of the circuit board as you  may damage circuit elements. Unscrew the four screws on the top of the circuit board in a left-to-right fashion. After pull screws out of the board.

Lines.Text: in order to remove the fan blade pliers were used to remove the holding nut .
after the holding nut is loose , use the pliers to pull up to remove the nut .

Steps.Text_raw: In order to remove the fan blade pliers were used to remove the holding nut. After the holding nut is loose, use the pliers to pull up to remove the nut.

Lines.Text: remove the two bronze phillips 29-mm bolts that hold the fan blade to the transformer .
use a pair of pliers to hold the nut at the bottom of the transformer , as you unscrew from left-to-right at the top of the transformer . after , pull up and remove both the screw and nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two bronze Phillips 29-mm bolts that hold the fan blade to the transformer. Use a pair of pliers to hold the nut at the bottom of the transformer, as you unscrew from left-to-right at the top of the transformer. After, pull up and remove both the screw and nut.

Lines.Text: next , remove the two silver phillips ( 8-mm head ) 40-mm screws from the transformer .
remove screws by pulling them away from the base .
the transformer should be free after this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, remove the two silver Phillips (8-mm head) 40-mm screws from the transformer. Remove screws by pulling them away from the base. The transformer should be free after this step.

Subject: Rotating Blade and Transformer

Title: How to Fix Keurig K75 Platinum Brewing System Water Pump Leak

Lines.Text: before beginning the repair , turn off the brewer and disconnect it from any power source .
move the brewer so that the metal baseplate is easily accessible .
remove the five silver 4 mm phillips 2 screws from the baseplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning the repair, turn off the brewer and disconnect it from any power source. Move the brewer so that the metal baseplate is easily accessible. Remove the five silver 4 mm Phillips #2 screws from the baseplate.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , gently pry the metal baseplate from the brewer .
gently set down the baseplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, gently pry the metal baseplate from the brewer. Gently set down the baseplate.

Lines.Text: remove the two silver 4 mm phillips 2 screws that hold the water pump in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two silver 4mm Phillips #2 screws that hold the water pump in place.

Lines.Text: realign the rubber gasket of the water pump to create a tight fit .

Steps.Text_raw: Realign the rubber gasket of the water pump to create a tight fit.

Title: How to Keurig K75 Platinum Brewing System

Lines.Text: before beginning the repair , turn off and unplug the brewer from any power source .
move the brewer so that the bottom is easily accessible .
unscrew the five 4 mm silver diagrammed screws using a 2 phillips head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning the repair, turn off and unplug the brewer from any power source. Move the brewer so that the bottom is easily accessible. Unscrew the five 4mm silver diagrammed screws using a #2 Philips Head screwdriver.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , gently pry open the base metal plate from the brewer .
gently place the base of the brewer down .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, gently pry open the base metal plate from the brewer. Gently place the base of the brewer down.

Lines.Text: locate the vacuum apparatus within the keurig b70 platinum .
using a 00 phillips screwdriver , unscrew the three 15 mm black screws diagrammed .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the vacuum apparatus within the Keurig B70 Platinum. Using a #00 Phillips screwdriver, unscrew the three 15 mm black screws diagrammed.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , lift the white piece of the vacuum away from the black membrane .
realign the circular pieces of the membrane so that the circles lie flush inside the black membrane apparatus .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, lift the white piece of the vacuum away from the black membrane. Realign the circular pieces of the membrane so that the circles lie flush inside the black membrane apparatus.

Title: Keurig K75 Platinum Brewing System Baseplate Replacement

Lines.Text: before beginning the repair , turn off the brewer and disconnect it from any power source .
move the brewer so that the metal baseplate is easily accessible .
remove the five silver 4 mm phillips 2 screws from the baseplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning the repair, turn off the brewer and disconnect it from any power source. Move the brewer so that the metal baseplate is easily accessible. Remove the five silver 4 mm Phillips #2 screws from the baseplate.

Lines.Text: using a spudger , gently pry the metal baseplate from the brewer .
gently set down the baseplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spudger, gently pry the metal baseplate from the brewer. Gently set down the baseplate.

Subject: Baseplate

Title: Repairing Door Interlock Metalflex ZV-446

Toolbox.Name: cleaning stuff q-tips and ipa sandpaper ...

Lines.Text: remove the door interlock from your device . on my washing machine i had to remove the rubber-lid and loosen two screws . than the interlock came of with a 3-pol cable attached . on the backside was a plastic plate which had to be unscrewed , too .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the door interlock from your device. On my washing machine I had to remove the rubber-lid and loosen two screws. Than the interlock came of with a 3-pol cable attached. On the backside was a plastic plate which had to be unscrewed, too.

Lines.Text: pull of the plug and remove the red cover arround the contacts . it is held with two snap-in connectors and its pretty tight ( dont destroy the contact cover ) . use a small flathead screwdriver to push the hooks away .
remove the top of the red housing . there are six snap-ins to open . make shure you have removed the contact cover first ! again this is best done with a small flathead screwdriver or blade .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull of the plug and remove the red cover arround the contacts. It is held with two snap-in connectors and its pretty tight (dont destroy the contact cover). Use a small flathead screwdriver to push the hooks away. Remove the top of the red housing. There are six snap-ins to open. Make shure you have removed the contact cover first! Again this is best done with a small flathead screwdriver or blade.

Lines.Text: the center contact is common for the switch an the relais . the right one goes to the coil and is for the relais-function of the interlock .
the left one is from the door switch . this is what malfunctioned on my washing machine .

Steps.Text_raw: The center contact is common for the switch an the relais. The right one goes to the coil and is for the relais-function of the interlock. The left one is from the door switch. This is what malfunctioned on my washing machine.

Lines.Text: the arrow points the contact of the switch . my machine stopped working because the door switch did not work properly . the machine never detected a closed door and hence never started wasching .

when the switch closes the copper plate with the arrow in the picture moves down . underneath ends the switchcontact from outside . it can be removed from the plastic housing . you should gently bend up the copper plate with the arrow . once removed you can clean the contact area of the bottom switch contact .

in my case nailpolish remover did not work , so i scratched the dirt off with a blade . i dont see a way to clean the top contact of the switch , because the copperplate is not removeble . for my switch cleaning the bottom contact was sufficient to get the washing machine working !

Steps.Text_raw: The arrow points the contact of the switch. My machine stopped working because the door switch did not work properly. The machine never detected a closed door and hence never started wasching. When the switch closes the copper plate with the arrow in the picture moves down. Underneath ends the switchcontact from outside. It can be removed from the plastic housing. You should gently bend up the copper plate with the arrow. Once removed you can clean the contact area of the bottom switch contact. In my case nailpolish remover did not work, so I scratched the dirt off with a blade. I dont see a way to clean the top contact of the switch, because the copperplate is not removeble. For my switch cleaning the bottom contact was sufficient to get the washing machine working!

Title: PANASONIC NR B 53 V1 Refrigerator Water Filter hosing to Extern

Lines.Text: before deinstalling the filter cut off the water line . lay a towel in the fridge . also cut off ac mains . this is an opened waterfilter . inside is a sort of coal which adsorbs unhealthy particles . it has to be changed every 6 months or less .

Steps.Text_raw: BEFORE DEINSTALLING THE FILTER CUT OFF THE WATER LINE. Lay a Towel in the Fridge. Also cut off AC Mains.                                                 This is an opened Waterfilter. Inside is a sort of coal which adsorbs unhealthy particles. It has to be changed every 6 months or less.

Lines.Text: first take out three drawers . the meat drawer is top , the vitaminsafe is in the middle and the freshzone is lowest . between meat vitaminsafe is a bottom which is snaped in with clipse . use a plastictool or a woodpiece to open the clips and remove the bottom . there are no screws .

Steps.Text_raw: First take out three drawers. The Meat drawer is top, the Vitaminsafe is in the middle and the Freshzone is lowest. Between Meat & Vitaminsafe is a Bottom which is snaped in with clipse. Use a plastictool or a woodpiece to open the clips and remove the bottom. There are no screws.

Lines.Text: behind the lowest drawer is an plastic panel , which can easy be pulled off . now you can see the water-reservoir for the water outlet . also you can see on the right the hosing for the waterfilter . there are no screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Behind the lowest drawer is an plastic panel, which can easy be pulled off. Now you can see the Water-reservoir for the Water Outlet. Also you can see on the right the hosing for the Waterfilter. There are no screws.

Lines.Text: the botton above the lowest drawer has a heating foil . unscrew on the back a ph2 head screw . also is a ph2 in front left at the filter's place . now carefully lift the bottom . take out the styroporfoam-element . then open the plasticbag which contains the connector for the heating . you should cut-off the ac-mains before unplugging this connector .
now you can remove the heating ; top of the bottom .
open the shorter ph2 screw to release the led-light on the bottom . that's necessary because with the wires at it you could not pull out the chassis of the bottom .
now you can pull out the chassis of the lower bottom , use a plastictool for the clipse . pull off the holder of the waterfilter .

Steps.Text_raw: The Botton above the lowest drawer has a heating foil. Unscrew on the back a PH2 Head screw. Also is a PH2 in front left at the Filter's place. Now carefully lift the Bottom. Take out the Styroporfoam-Element. Then open the Plasticbag which contains the Connector for the Heating. You should cut-off the AC-Mains before unplugging this Connector. Now you can remove the Heating; Top of the Bottom. Open the shorter PH2 Screw to release the LED-Light on the Bottom. That's necessary because with the wires at it you could not pull out the chassis of the Bottom. Now you can pull out the Chassis of the lower Bottom, use a Plastictool for the Clipse. Pull off the holder of the Waterfilter.

Lines.Text: here you have the a picture of the filterholder . the towel soaks the water
the inputhose has 8 mm . the output has 6 , 35 mm ( 1 /4 ) . lay a small towel under the holder .
pull off the hoses . some water could come out . mark the tubes with red and blue tape . so it will be easier to reasemle if a warrranty-check could occur .

Steps.Text_raw: Here you have the a picture of the Filterholder. The Towel soaks the water The Inputhose has 8 mm. The Output has 6,35 mm (1/4"). Lay a small Towel under the Holder. Pull off the hoses. Some Water could come out. Mark the tubes with red and blue tape. So it will be easier to reasemle if a warrranty-check could occur.

Lines.Text: now you need some plug couplings . adapter from 6 , 35 mm ( thats 1 /4 inch ) to 8 mm ( thats 5 /16 inch ) , coupling 6 , 35 to 6 , 35 and a piece of hose 6 , 35. carefully cut the hose nice and clean with a ahrsp cutter . now easy click these parts together . now you have a bypass for the original filtermount . : )

Steps.Text_raw: Now you need some plug couplings. Adapter from 6,35 mm (thats 1/4 inch) to 8 mm (thats 5/16 inch), Coupling 6,35 to 6,35 and a piece of hose 6,35. Carefully cut the hose nice and clean with a ahrsp cutter. Now easy click these parts together. Now you have a Bypass for the original Filtermount. :)

Lines.Text: here is a detail picture of the inlet and the outlet .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is a detail picture of the inlet and the outlet.

Lines.Text: now put it all together , don't forget the ph2 screws and you are done .
now you can mount an extren waterfilter .

the first water will be black from the coal . don't drink it . also there is now a lots of air in the hose , so the water will flow unregular and cause problems and weird sounds . give it some time , the problems will solve . : )

Steps.Text_raw: Now put it all together, don't forget the PH2 Screws and you are done. Now you can mount an extren Waterfilter. The first water will be black from the coal. Don't drink it. Also there is now a lots of air in the hose, so the water will flow unregular and cause problems and weird sounds. Give it some time, the problems will solve. :)

Lines.Text: this is an saw-cut off the external filter i've bought . you see the same adsorbing coal like in an original filter .
it costs about 10 bucks . the original costs about 80 bucks . two filters are needed every year . so this was a good decision . enjoy your clean water . : )
sorry for my bad english writing . i hope the pictures may help someone .

Steps.Text_raw: This is an Saw-Cut off the external Filter i've bought. You see the same adsorbing coal like in an original Filter. It costs about 10 Bucks. The Original costs about 80 Bucks. Two Filters are needed every year. So this was a good Decision. Enjoy your clean Water. :) Sorry for my bad english writing. I hope the pictures may help someone.

Title: How to clean the SAECO Incanto SBS Spout

Lines.Text: remove the spout by pressing the button on top and sliding it towards you .
unscrew the two ph1 screws on the back of the spout .
the spout halves should now separate easily but light prying might be necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the spout by pressing the button on top and sliding it towards you. Unscrew the two PH#1 screws on the back of the spout. The spout halves should now separate easily but light prying might be necessary.

Lines.Text: remove the spring of the pushbutton . relaese the button and remove the black insert off the cup filler .
push off the metal chrome part .
clean it with a small brush and rinse it under water .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the spring of the pushbutton. Relaese the Button and remove the black insert off the cup filler. Push off the metal chrome part. Clean it with a small brush and rinse it under water.

Lines.Text: reinstall the metal part on the back cup filler part then insert the black piece .
hold up the black part a little for pushing in the button .
then click it trogether and push in the spring .

Steps.Text_raw: Reinstall the metal part on the back cup filler part then insert the black piece. Hold up the black part a little for pushing in the Button. Then click it trogether and push in the spring.

Lines.Text: click it together , put in the two screws and you are done . : )

Steps.Text_raw: Click it together, put in the two screws and you are done. :)

Title: Vinotemp VT-12TEDi Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: remove nine 12 mm phillips screws from the upper back panel .
remove three 12 mm phillips screws inset under the back panel .
as soon as the screws are removed , the panel will fall freely .

when replacing the twelve 12 mm phillips screws , do not tighten the fasteners until all twelve screws have been loosely fitted back onto the cooler . this will ensure the flimsy metal casing will not warp .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove nine 12mm Phillips screws from the upper back panel. Remove three 12mm Phillips screws inset under the back panel. As soon as the screws are removed, the panel will fall freely. When replacing the twelve 12mm Phillips screws, do not tighten the fasteners until all twelve screws have been loosely fitted back onto the cooler. This will ensure the flimsy metal casing will not warp.

Lines.Text: power cord fastener
ground
motherboard
heat sink fan
heat sink

Steps.Text_raw: Power Cord Fastener Ground Motherboard Heat Sink Fan Heat Sink

Lines.Text: remove two 7 mm hex nuts .
clearance is minimal and these screws are very tight . you will likely need a socket wrench to avoid stripping .
if the white plastic components stick , pry them apart with a metal spudger . don't pull on the power cord to get plastic pieces to separate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 7mm Hex Nuts. Clearance is minimal and these screws are very tight. You will likely need a socket wrench to avoid stripping. If the white plastic components stick, pry them apart with a metal spudger. Don't pull on the power cord to get plastic pieces to separate.

Lines.Text: remove one 12 mm phillips screw securing ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove one 12mm Phillips screw securing ground.

Lines.Text: remove power cable from motherboard .
pinch cable connector to release it from the motherboard , then pull .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove power cable from motherboard. Pinch cable connector to release it from the motherboard, then pull.

Lines.Text: your power cord is removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Your power cord is removed.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: Vinotemp VT-12TEDi Motherboard Repair

Lines.Text: remove nine 12 mm phillips screws from the upper back panel .
remove three 12 mm phillips screws inset under the back panel .
as soon as the screws are removed , the panel will fall freely .

when replacing the twelve 12 mm phillips screws , do not tighten the fasteners until all twelve screws have been loosely fitted back onto the cooler . this will ensure the flimsy metal casing will not warp .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove nine 12mm Phillips screws from the upper back panel. Remove three 12mm Phillips screws inset under the back panel. As soon as the screws are removed, the panel will fall freely. When replacing the twelve 12mm Phillips screws, do not tighten the fasteners until all twelve screws have been loosely fitted back onto the cooler. This will ensure the flimsy metal casing will not warp.

Lines.Text: power cord fastener
ground
motherboard
heat sink fan
heat sink

Steps.Text_raw: Power Cord Fastener Ground Motherboard Heat Sink Fan Heat Sink

Lines.Text: remove two 7 mm hex nuts .
clearance is minimal and these screws are very tight . you will likely need a socket wrench to avoid stripping .
if the white plastic components stick , pry them apart with a metal spudger . don't pull on the power cord to get plastic pieces to separate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 7mm Hex Nuts. Clearance is minimal and these screws are very tight. You will likely need a socket wrench to avoid stripping. If the white plastic components stick, pry them apart with a metal spudger. Don't pull on the power cord to get plastic pieces to separate.

Lines.Text: remove one 12 mm phillips screw securing ground .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove one 12mm Phillips screw securing ground.

Lines.Text: remove power cable from motherboard .
pinch cable connector to release it from the motherboard , then pull .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove power cable from motherboard. Pinch cable connector to release it from the motherboard, then pull.

Lines.Text: your power cord is removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Your power cord is removed.

Lines.Text: remove heat sink fan cable connector .
remove cold sink fan cable connector .
remove temperature control board cable connector .
remove temperature ntc cable connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove heat sink fan cable connector. Remove cold sink fan cable connector. Remove temperature control board cable connector. Remove temperature NTC cable connector.

Lines.Text: remove four 12 mm phillips screws .
once the four phillips screws are removed , the motherboard will dangle there until you remove the heat sink . be careful .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four 12mm Phillips screws. Once the four Phillips screws are removed, the motherboard will dangle there until you remove the heat sink. Be careful.

Lines.Text: remove four 15 mm phillips screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four 15mm Phillips screws.

Lines.Text: cut zip tie binding wires together .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut zip tie binding wires together.

Lines.Text: remove two 32 mm phillips screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 32mm Phillips screws.

Lines.Text: remove heat sink slowly to avoid breaking cold sink fan cable .
disconnect cold sink fan cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove heat sink slowly to avoid breaking cold sink fan cable. Disconnect cold sink fan cable.

Lines.Text: the heat sink and motherboard are removed . yay !
the vinotemp vt-12 tedi has a very high rate of capacitor failure on the motherboard . before buying a new motherboard :
check for failure .
learn topic : solderinghow to solder and replace the broken capacitor yourself .

Steps.Text_raw: The heat sink and motherboard are removed. Yay! The Vinotemp VT-12TEDi has a very high rate of capacitor failure on the motherboard. Before buying a new motherboard: Check for [http://www.capacitorlab.com/visible-failures/|capacitor failure]. Learn [[Topic:Soldering|how to solder]] and replace the broken capacitor yourself.

Title: Repairing Side-by-side Refrigerator Diffuser

Lines.Text: unload the top three shelves of the fridge , and top two shelves of the freezer into cooler ( s ) .
mark the location of the shelves with a bit of tape . then remove the shelves by tipping up the front edge , then lifting and pulling them towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Unload the top three shelves of the fridge, and top two shelves of the freezer into cooler(s). Mark the location of the shelves with a bit of tape. Then remove the shelves by tipping up the front edge, then lifting and pulling them towards you.

Lines.Text: turn off the fridge ( on ours the switch is in the top left corner of the fridge . ) then unplug it or turn off the breaker .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn off the fridge (on ours the switch is in the top left corner of the fridge.)  Then unplug it or turn off the breaker.

Lines.Text: remove the wire cover in the top left edge of the fridge . it's held in place by one phillips head screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wire cover in the top left edge of the fridge. It's held in place by one Phillips head screw.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screw at the front of the diffuser cover . the diffuser itself will still be snugly in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screw at the front of the diffuser cover. The diffuser itself will still be snugly in place.

Lines.Text: unclip the wire connector from the bottom of the diffuser . remove the piece of tape holding the wires to the diffuser . we'll remove the other wire connector from the front of the diffuser later .

Steps.Text_raw: Unclip the wire connector from the bottom of the diffuser. Remove the piece of tape holding the wires to the diffuser. We'll remove the other wire connector from the front of the diffuser later.

Lines.Text: close the fridge door and open the freezer door . there's an air chute in the top of the freezer that will be coming out , along with the rear air chute . remove the pair of screws on the top chute using the 1 /4 hex socket . the back chute will still be holding the top chute in place .

if you're assisting , you may notice the ice dispenser is right next to the back of the person leaning into the fridge . unless it's a very hot day , try not to slip ice cubes down the shirt/shorts of your cohort .

Steps.Text_raw: Close the fridge door and open the freezer door. There's an air chute in the top of the freezer that will be coming out, along with the rear air chute. Remove the pair of screws on the top chute using the 1/4" hex socket. The back chute will still be holding the top chute in place. If you're assisting, you may notice the ice dispenser is right next to the back of the person leaning into the fridge. Unless it's a very hot day, try not to slip ice cubes down the shirt/shorts of your cohort.

Lines.Text: take a look at how the back chute and top chute fit together . the back chute , at least on ours , is mounted on hidden spring clips . pull the bottom edge of the back chute forward . as the top of the back chute comes out , the top chute will fall out too . don't let it hit the floor .

Steps.Text_raw: Take a look at how the back chute and top chute fit together. The back chute, at least on ours, is mounted on hidden spring clips. Pull the bottom edge of the back chute forward. As the top of the back chute comes out, the top chute will fall out too. Don't let it hit the floor.

Lines.Text: now you can see a right angle air duct from the fridge side . this simply pulls out to the left .

Steps.Text_raw: Now you can see a right angle air duct from the fridge side. This simply pulls out to the left.

Lines.Text: there is a spring clip in each corner of the fridge duct . gently push them towards the center of the opening , and then towards the fridge .

there are 4 clips but only 2 are shown in the picture . ( i forgot to take a picture after removing the right angle duct , so just imagine it's gone and you can see the other two as well . please take a picture and update this page . )
close the freezer door and head to the fridge side . but first , if your helper dropped ice down the back of your shorts in the prior step , feel free to return the favor .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a spring clip in each corner of the fridge duct. Gently push them towards the center of the opening, and then towards the fridge. There are 4 clips but only 2 are shown in the picture. (I forgot to take a picture after removing the right angle duct, so just imagine it's gone and you can see the other two as well. Please take a picture and update this page.) Close the freezer door and head to the fridge side. But first, if your helper dropped ice down the back of your shorts in the prior step, feel free to return the  favor.

Lines.Text: welcome back to the fridge side . seems roomy now that you've been crowded into the freezer , doesn't it ? the diffuser module should slide out freely . we'll remove the wires in the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Welcome back to the fridge side. Seems roomy now that you've been crowded into the freezer, doesn't it? The diffuser module should slide out freely. We'll remove the wires in the next step.

Lines.Text: on the side of the diffuser that was against the wall , you'll see a little clip holding the wire connector in place . gently pry on that and remove the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: On the side of the diffuser that was against the wall, you'll see a little clip holding the wire connector in place. Gently pry on that and remove the connector.

Lines.Text: now you can carry the little troublemaker over to better light . you might be able to reach in with your little finger and wiggle the diffuser door . if it slides open and closed freely , the door's tab has broken . if not , it's also possible the motor is kaput . ( someone please contribute diagnostics for that )

Steps.Text_raw: Now you can carry the little troublemaker over to better light. You might be able to reach in with your little finger and wiggle the diffuser door. If it slides open and closed freely, the door's tab has broken. If not, it's also possible the motor is kaput. (Someone please contribute diagnostics for that)

Lines.Text: the diffuser assembly is a nonserviceable part . unless you're stubborn like me . gently cut open the foam along the glue line all the way around with a box cutter or sharp knife . now remove the top half of the foam .

Steps.Text_raw: The diffuser assembly is a "nonserviceable" part. Unless you're stubborn like me. Gently cut open the foam along the glue line all the way around with a box cutter or sharp knife. Now remove the top half of the foam.

Lines.Text: now remove diffuser cover . it's held in place by 4 pairs of tabs . squeeze each pair of tabs with needle nose pliers and gently lift that corner . after all the tabs release , you can lift off the cover . don't tip the base or the door will fall out .
i only marked three tabs in the photo . if you can't find the fourth tab , then i know what you did with the beer that didn't fit in the cooler in step one !

Steps.Text_raw: Now remove diffuser cover. It's held in place by 4 pairs of tabs. Squeeze each pair of tabs with needle nose pliers and gently lift that corner. After all the tabs release, you can lift off the cover. Don't tip the base or the door will fall out. I only marked three tabs in the photo. If you can't find the fourth tab, then I know what you did with the beer that didn't fit in the cooler in step one!

Lines.Text: note which side of the door is up . you can now slide out the door , and find the plastic tab that broke off .

Steps.Text_raw: Note which side of the door is up. You can now slide out the door, and find the plastic tab that broke off.

Lines.Text: examine the door to see where you can reinforce it without interfering with the cam or making the door thicker . glue the plastic tab back in place , using a piece of flat toothpick or scrap of plastic to reinforce it . use super glue or epoxy . do not use heat to set the epoxy - this plastic softens very easily .
in the picture , you can see the broken tab , and the bit of toothpick next to it .

Steps.Text_raw: Examine the door to see where you can reinforce it without interfering with the cam or making the door thicker.  Glue the plastic tab back in place, using a piece of flat toothpick or scrap of plastic to reinforce it. Use super glue or epoxy. Do not use heat to set the epoxy - this plastic softens very easily. In the picture, you can see the broken tab, and the bit of toothpick next to it.

Lines.Text: reassemble the diffuser , making sure the cam sits properly in the hole of the diffuser door . if you have troubles snapping it together , recheck the door's position .

Steps.Text_raw: Reassemble the diffuser, making sure the cam sits properly in the hole of the diffuser door. If you have troubles snapping it together, recheck the door's position.

Lines.Text: clamp the foam part of the assembly back around the plastic . tape it along the seam . i used fiber tape , but packing tape or electrical tape might work .

Steps.Text_raw: Clamp the foam part of the assembly back around the plastic. Tape it along the seam. I used fiber tape, but packing tape or electrical tape might work.

Lines.Text: now reassemble everything :
second verse , same as the first . a little bit louder , just in reverse .
be sure to turn the fridge back on , plug it in , flip on the circuit breaker , etc .

Steps.Text_raw: Now reassemble everything: "Second verse, same as the first. A little bit louder, just in reverse." Be sure to turn the fridge back on, plug it in, flip on the circuit breaker, etc.

Lines.Text: finish the melting ice cream .

Steps.Text_raw: Finish the melting ice cream.

Title: Repairing Bosch Dishwasher (SHU5315UC-06) Won't Fill (drain motor keeps running)

Lines.Text: remove the two torx screws to release the lower access panel and set it aside .
verify if there is water in the base and remove as much as you can with a rag ( as pictured ) .
it is normal to see a small amount of water in there but if there is a large amount , this may be what is causing the float to remain up and you may have a different issue .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two Torx screws to release the lower access panel and set it aside. Verify if there is water in the base and remove as much as you can with a rag (as pictured). It is normal to see a small amount of water in there but if there is a large amount, this may be what is causing the float to remain up and you may have a different issue.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver to lift the float switch activator ( red stick ) . it has tabs which makes the task easy ( although they are difficult to see in the picture ) .
be careful not to shortcut the wires of the inlet valve with your screwdriver ( it might be wise to turn off the electricity before this procedure ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver to lift the float switch activator (red stick). It has tabs which makes the task easy (although they are difficult to see in the picture). Be careful not to shortcut the wires of the inlet valve with your screwdriver (it might be wise to turn off the electricity before this procedure).

Lines.Text: turn your dishwasher back on .
this may not fix it permanently , but the same procedure will work again and again .

if someone a permanent fix please share ! i suspect a defective float switch ( bosch part 165256 ) but thee fact that my dw works for a couple of cycle before the issue coming back makes me a little skeptical .
on this dishwasher you should check on the right side for a leaking wash motor pump assembly

Steps.Text_raw: Turn your dishwasher back on. This may not fix it permanently, but the same procedure will work again and again. If someone a permanent fix please share! I suspect a defective float switch (Bosch part #165256) but thee fact that my DW works for a couple of cycle before the issue coming back makes me a little skeptical. On this dishwasher you should check on the right side for a leaking wash motor pump assembly

Title: Rival Mini Chopper MC-67BL Turning Gears Replacement

Lines.Text: twist the plastic lid counterclockwise to unlock it .
lift the lid to remove it from the container .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the plastic lid counterclockwise to unlock it. Lift the lid to remove it from the container.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the blade from the container .
for reassembly , the teeth on the metal shaft line up with slots on the inside of the plastic hole .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the blade from the container. For reassembly, the teeth on the metal shaft line up with slots on the inside of the plastic hole.

Lines.Text: with your hand , twist the container counter-clockwise until it unlocks from the base . remove the container by lifting it straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: With your hand, twist the container counter-clockwise until it unlocks from the base. Remove the container by lifting it straight up.

Lines.Text: use your fingers to pry out the two rubber feet from the bottom cover of the base .
the two feet furthest from the button tower contain screws . the other two feet do not .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your fingers to pry out the two rubber feet from the bottom cover of the base. The two feet furthest from the button tower contain screws. The other two feet do not.

Lines.Text: use the phillips 2 screwdriver to unscrew the two 12.7-mm screws underneath the rubber feet .
use the same screwdriver to unscrew the 15.88-mm screw from the back of the chopper .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #2 screwdriver  to unscrew the two 12.7-mm screws underneath the rubber feet. Use the same screwdriver to unscrew the 15.88-mm screw from the back of the chopper.

Lines.Text: firmly lift the bottom cover off of the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly lift the bottom cover off of the base.

Lines.Text: remove the smaller white gear by lifting it up with your hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the smaller white gear by lifting it up with your hand.

Lines.Text: use a pair of pliers or any other clamping tool to securely hold the blade-shaft that sits above the base .
grab the gear with your other hand and turn '''''clockwise . ''''' unlike most screws , the gear is reverse-threaded to allow the blade to spin .
continue turning the gear until completely removed from the blade-shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of pliers or any other clamping tool to securely hold the blade-shaft that sits above the base. Grab the gear with your other hand and turn '''''CLOCKWISE.''''' Unlike most screws, the gear is reverse-threaded to allow the blade to spin. Continue turning the gear until completely removed from the blade-shaft.

Subject: Turning Gears

Title: Rival Mini Chopper MC-67BL Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: twist the plastic lid counterclockwise to unlock it .
lift the lid to remove it from the container .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the plastic lid counterclockwise to unlock it. Lift the lid to remove it from the container.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the blade from the container .
for reassembly , the teeth on the metal shaft line up with slots on the inside of the plastic hole .

only cut deep enough to remove the casing .

for reassembly the copper wires will need to be soldered together .

Title: Eureka 1660SP Roller Replacement

Lines.Text: press the black separator switch and lightly pull the bottom half away from the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the black separator switch and lightly pull the bottom half away from the top.

Lines.Text: remove the vacuum head from the lower half of the body .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the vacuum head from the lower half of the body.

Lines.Text: turn the vacuum head wheels up and remove all seven 13.9 mm screws from the bottom using a 2 phillips head screwdriver .
separate the top and bottom of the vacuum head . set the top aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the vacuum head wheels up and remove all seven 13.9mm screws from the bottom using a #2 Phillips head screwdriver. Separate the top and bottom of the vacuum head. Set the top aside.

Lines.Text: turn the vacuum head's bottom over so that the inside of the head is facing up .
using a phillips 00 screwdriver , press down on metal bar of the roller on one side until it releases from the housing .
turn the vacuum head's bottom over and pull at the roller and bar until they are completely out of the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the vacuum head's bottom over so that the inside of the head is facing up. Lines.Text: press the new bar and roller into place .
replace the screws .

Title: General Electric Bagel Switch 4-Slice Power Supply Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the toaster from the electrical outlet .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the toaster from the electrical outlet.

Lines.Text: remove the two levers and four dials by pulling them out directly towards you .
removing these components may require some force , but they will release .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two levers and four dials by pulling them out directly towards you. Removing these components may require some force, but they will release.

Lines.Text: look for the plastic clips on the back side of the toaster .
disconnect the small plastic clips on the back of the toaster . use phillips head screwdriver to do this step .
now , carefully remove the toaster casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Look for the plastic clips on the back side of the toaster. Disconnect the small plastic clips on the back of the toaster.  Use Philips head  Screwdriver to do this step. Now, carefully remove  the toaster casing.

Lines.Text: flip the toaster over so that the bottom plate is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the toaster over so that the bottom plate is facing up.

Lines.Text: remove the four screws from the bottom of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four screws from the bottom of the toaster.

Lines.Text: carefully separate the bottom plate from the metal components inside the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully separate the bottom plate from the metal components inside the  toaster.

Lines.Text: using wire cutters , cut the power supply cable close to the base of the toaster , leave about 2 inches of wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Using wire cutters, cut the power supply cable close to the base of the toaster, leave about 2 inches of wire.

Lines.Text: pull the power supply cord through the bottom plate of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the power supply cord through the bottom plate of the toaster.

Lines.Text: insert the end of the new power supply cable through the hole in the bottom plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the end of the new power supply cable through the hole in the bottom plate.

Lines.Text: strip about an inch of the wire insulation ( casing ) off the ends of both the new power supply cable , and the old power supply cable that is still attached to the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Strip about an inch of the wire insulation (casing) off the ends of both the new power supply cable, and the old power supply cable that is still attached to the toaster.

Lines.Text: splice the stripped ends of wire together using a wire cap .

Steps.Text_raw: Splice the stripped ends of wire together using a wire cap.
