Title: Bypass heater unit of a Whirlpool Dishwasher DWH B00 W for a hot water supply

Lines.Text: unplug the power supply of the dishwasher before disassembling the unit .
close the water stopcock .
open the front door of the unit and loosen the 4 screws marked in red . do not screw them fully out .
shut the door carefully holding the front door handle .
lower the front door about 4 cm . then you can remove the front shield .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the power supply of the dishwasher before disassembling the unit. Close the water stopcock. Open the front door of the unit and loosen the 4 screws marked in red. Do not screw them fully out. Shut the door carefully holding the front door handle. Lower the front door about 4 cm. Then you can remove the front shield.

Lines.Text: open front door .
fully unscrew the red marked screws .
close the front door .
carefully detach the upper white plastic part containing the control board .

Steps.Text_raw: Open front door. Fully unscrew the red marked screws. Close the front door. Carefully detach the upper white plastic part containing the control board.

Lines.Text: plug off connector hew .
i recommend to insulate the cable end with some tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Plug off connector HEW. I recommend to insulate the cable end with some tape.

Lines.Text: this step is necessary as the dishwasher will otherwise abort its program after about 25 minutes thereby beeping and showing blinking pattern no . 3. after putting the 10 kohm resistor in parallel to the ntc ( having ca . 50 kohm at 20 degree celsius ) the control circuit suspects a much higher water temperature ( about 80 degree celsius ) .
unplug the ntc connector which is shown highlighted .

bend the connections of the resistor and insert it into the hole at the ntc connector . wrap the resistors wire so that it will be connected in parallel to the ntc ( i promise to add a photo for this soon ) . use the tweezer for that .
plug in the ntc connector thereby building a connection with the resistor .

Steps.Text_raw: This step is necessary as the dishwasher will otherwise abort its program after about 25 minutes thereby beeping and showing blinking pattern no. 3. After putting the 10 kOhm resistor in parallel to the NTC (having ca. 50 kOhm at 20 degree Celsius) the control circuit suspects a much higher water temperature (about 80 degree Celsius). Unplug the NTC connector which is shown highlighted. Bend the connections of the resistor and insert it into the hole at the NTC connector. Wrap the resistors wire so that it will be connected in parallel to the NTC (I promise to add a photo for this soon). Use the tweezer for that. Plug in the NTC connector thereby building a connection with the resistor.

Title: How to disassemble and clean bObsweep Robotic Vacuum Cleaner front wheel

Lines.Text: flip bob over and remove the 7 screws around which hold the cover together .
remove the main brush . unscrew the holder , and lift the brush out . reminder : keep this screw separate from the others so you can use it later to reinstall .
depending on your model , there may be only 6 screws installed on bobsweep .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip Bob over and remove the 7 screws around which hold the cover together. Remove the main brush. Unscrew the holder, and lift the brush out. Reminder: Keep this screw separate from the others so you can use it later to reinstall. Depending on your model, there may be only 6 screws installed on bObsweep.

Lines.Text: there are two screw holes inside the brush compartment : one in the centre , one on the left end . remove both and keep aside for reassembly .
there are five more screws around bobsweep's edges . two are installed at the top and bottom , and one on the right end of the main brush .

Steps.Text_raw: There are two screw holes inside the brush compartment: one in the centre, one on the left end. Remove both and keep aside for reassembly. There are five more screws around bObsweep's edges. Two are installed at the top and bottom, and one on the right end of the main brush.

Lines.Text: flip bob back over so you can see the screen . lift the cover up to reveal bobsweeps main board .
detach the power inlet from the cover . grip and slide it out .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip bOb back over so you can see the screen. Lift the cover up to reveal bObsweep’s main board. Detach the power inlet from the cover. Grip and slide it out.

Lines.Text: remove three circuit plugs from the motherboard . pinch the small white tab on the side of each circuit plug and pull straight up to release each from the motherboard .
1. on the bottom left corner : a small connector with red , black and white wires .
2. one thick white wire that attaches on the right side of the previous connector .
3. on the top edge of bobs motherboard : a wide multicoloured connector .
place the cover aside and begin your repair .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove three circuit plugs from the motherboard. Pinch the small white tab on the side of each circuit plug and pull straight up to release each from the motherboard. 1. On the bottom left corner: a small connector with red, black and white wires. 2. One thick white wire that attaches on the right side of the previous connector. 3. On the top edge of bOb’s motherboard: a wide multicoloured connector. Place the cover aside and begin your repair.

Lines.Text: there is one screw holding the front wheel in place . it is found in front of bobsweep's main board .
hold the wheel from underneath bobsweep while removing the screw .
set the screw and washer aside for later .
lift bobsweep up and the front wheel will be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: There is one screw holding the front wheel in place. It is found in front of bObsweep's main board. Hold the wheel from underneath bObsweep while removing the screw. Set the screw and washer aside for later. Lift bObsweep up and the front wheel will be removed.

Lines.Text: there are four washers between the front wheel and bobsweep . they usually sit on top of the wheel , but can sometimes get stuck on bobsweep . make sure to check underneath your vacuum if any pieces are missing .
there will be one wide black washer that fits in the grooved section of the wheel .
the other three washers make up the bearing assembly on the innermost ring of the wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: There are four washers between the front wheel and bObsweep. They usually sit on top of the wheel, but can sometimes get stuck on bObsweep. Make sure to check underneath your vacuum if any pieces are missing. There will be one wide black washer that fits in the grooved section of the wheel. The other three washers make up the bearing assembly on the innermost ring of the wheel.

Lines.Text: un-install the three screws holding the front wheel together . the whole piece will open up so you can remove and clean each piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Un-install the three screws holding the front wheel together. The whole piece will open up so you can remove and clean each piece.

Lines.Text: after cleaning , reassemble all the pieces .
hold the wheel together while installing all three screws .

Steps.Text_raw: After cleaning, reassemble all the pieces. Hold the wheel together while installing all three screws.

Lines.Text: place the washer and bearing assembly back on the front wheel in the correct order .
the large black washer sits on top of the wheel . the number 2 side should be facing upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the washer and bearing assembly back on the front wheel in the correct order. The large black washer sits on top of the wheel. The number 2 side should be facing upwards.

Lines.Text: the bearing assembly should be replaced in the following order :
place one silver bearing on the wheel , flat side facing down .
place the gold bearing next .
the final piece is the second silver bearing . it should be placed on top of the wheel . this time the flat side should be facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: The bearing assembly should be replaced in the following order: Place one silver bearing on the wheel, flat side facing down. Place the gold bearing next. The final piece is the second silver bearing. It should be placed on top of the wheel. This time the flat side should be facing up.

Lines.Text: put the fully assembled front wheel back in place underneath bobsweep .
reinstall the final washer and screw from inside bobsweep , while holding the wheel in place . this will ensure a secure installation .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the fully assembled front wheel back in place underneath bObsweep. Reinstall the final washer and screw from inside bObsweep, while holding the wheel in place. This will ensure a secure installation.

Title: Schaltnetzteil - T56840L Elektroniksteuerung

Lines.Text: entfernen sie die deckplatte des trockners . dazu sind zwei sechskantschrauben , schlüsselweite 7 mm ( im bild oben recht und oben links ) zu entfernen und dann der deckel nach hinten schieben und gleichzeitig abheben ( der deckel ist vorne mit zwei haken eingehängt )

Steps.Text_raw: Entfernen Sie die Deckplatte des Trockners. Dazu sind zwei Sechskantschrauben, Schlüsselweite 7mm (im Bild oben recht und oben links) zu entfernen und dann der Deckel nach hinten schieben und gleichzeitig abheben (der Deckel ist vorne mit zwei Haken eingehängt)

Lines.Text: das versteifungsblech ist mit 5 schrauben zu entfernen ( rote markierungen )
dann ist dieses mit einen clip vorsichtig von der frontplatte zu trennen ( grüne markierung )

Steps.Text_raw: Das Versteifungsblech ist mit 5 Schrauben zu entfernen (rote Markierungen) Dann ist dieses mit einen Clip vorsichtig von der Frontplatte zu trennen (grüne Markierung)

Lines.Text: der kondenzwasser tank ist herauszunehmen
die frontplatte ist mit zwei weiteren schrauben zu lösen

Steps.Text_raw: Der Kondenzwasser Tank ist herauszunehmen Die Frontplatte ist mit zwei weiteren Schrauben zu lösen

Lines.Text: der abdeckschutz der steuerung ist zuerst auf der einen seite ( ca . mitte des gerätes ) zu lösen .
mit einem kleinen schraubendreher den clip einrücken und die abdeckung leicht anheben
dann die ganze abdeckung weiter anheben und gleichzeitig nach hinten ( weg von der frontplatte ) schieben ( auf der anderen seite ist die abdeckung in eine führung eingeschoben )

Steps.Text_raw: Der Abdeckschutz der Steuerung ist zuerst auf der einen Seite (ca. Mitte des Gerätes) zu lösen. Mit einem kleinen Schraubendreher den Clip einrücken und die Abdeckung leicht anheben Dann die ganze Abdeckung weiter anheben und gleichzeitig nach hinten (weg von der Frontplatte) schieben (auf der anderen Seite ist die Abdeckung in eine Führung eingeschoben)

Lines.Text: dann sind die stecker auf die platine abzuziehen . dazu sind die sicherungsclips leicht wegzubiegen
der kabelbinder ist wegzuschneiden
der stecker der netzzuleitung ist unter einer seperaten abdeckkappe zu finden . hier ist diese zuerst zu entfernen ( ist ein wenig kriffig )

Steps.Text_raw: Dann sind die Stecker auf die Platine abzuziehen. Dazu sind die Sicherungsclips leicht wegzubiegen Der Kabelbinder ist wegzuschneiden Der Stecker der Netzzuleitung ist unter einer seperaten Abdeckkappe zu finden. Hier ist diese zuerst zu entfernen (ist ein wenig kriffig)

Lines.Text: jetzt ist die abdeckung der platine zu entfernen : dazu sind lediglich die beiden tiefliegenden schrauben zu entfernen ( der steuergeräte träger muss nicht von der frontplatte gelöst werden um die platine auszubauen )

Steps.Text_raw: Jetzt ist die Abdeckung der Platine zu entfernen: Dazu sind lediglich die beiden tiefliegenden Schrauben zu entfernen (der Steuergeräte Träger muss nicht von der Frontplatte gelöst werden um die Platine auszubauen)

Lines.Text: ausbau der platine :
ungefähr in der mitte der platine befindet sich noch eine kreutzschlitzschraube , die entfernt werden muß .
nun sind die clips rund um die platine leicht abzuheben und gleichzeitig die platine anzuheben .

Steps.Text_raw: Ausbau der Platine: Ungefähr in der Mitte der Platine befindet sich noch eine Kreutzschlitzschraube, die entfernt werden muß. Nun sind die Clips rund um die Platine leicht abzuheben und gleichzeitig die Platine anzuheben.

Lines.Text: ist platine ausgebaut , sind die beiden bauteile auszulöten
der drahtwiederstand

Steps.Text_raw: Ist Platine ausgebaut, sind die beiden Bauteile auszulöten Der Drahtwiederstand

Lines.Text: der spannungswandler befindet sich auf der rückseite
mit einem feinen saitenschneider können auch die anschlussbeine abgeknipst werden . achtung : dabei können aber die lötpunkte auf der platine abgehebelt werden !

Steps.Text_raw: Der Spannungswandler befindet sich auf der Rückseite Mit einem feinen Saitenschneider können auch die Anschlussbeine abgeknipst werden. Achtung: Dabei können aber die Lötpunkte auf der Platine abgehebelt werden!

Lines.Text: ich habe bleifreies lötzinn verwendet , da industrieplatinen gerne ebenfalls bleifrei verlötet werden

Steps.Text_raw: Ich habe bleifreies Lötzinn verwendet, da Industrieplatinen gerne ebenfalls bleifrei verlötet werden

Title: KitchenAid KSB5CR Fan Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the glass container and place the blender upside down on a solid surface .
remove the four rubber feet using the needle nose pliers .
remove the four 7.5 phillips 25 mm screws that were located underneath the rubber feet using the phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the glass container and place the blender upside down on a solid surface. Remove the four rubber feet using the needle nose pliers. Remove the four #7.5 Phillips 25mm screws that were located underneath the rubber feet using the Phillips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift the back panel up , sliding it along the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the back panel up, sliding it along the power cord.

Lines.Text: remove the two 5 phillips 95 mm machine screws using the phillips 2 screwdriver .
remove the rubber o-ring by lifting it up .
remove the ribbon cable from the chassis by lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two #5 Phillips 95 mm machine screws using the Phillips #2 screwdriver. Remove the rubber O-ring by lifting it up. Remove the ribbon cable from the chassis by lifting it up.

Lines.Text: unhook the white wire that is looped around the peg by pulling it out of the clip .
repeat this process with the red wire on the other side of the chassis .
remove the end cap using the 8 needle nose pliers .
pull up the fan chassis .

Steps.Text_raw: Unhook the white wire that is looped around the peg by pulling it out of the clip. Repeat this process with the red wire on the other side of the chassis. Remove the end cap using the 8" needle nose pliers. Pull up the fan chassis.

Lines.Text: remove the fan by lifting it upwards .
this step is difficult and requires force . use of both hands is recommended .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the fan by lifting it upwards. This step is difficult and requires force.  Use of both hands is recommended.

Subject: Fan

Title: Black and Decker 3-Cup Rice Cooker Button Mechanism Repair

Lines.Text: ''make sure the device is unplugged before beginning disassembly ! ''
lift the lid and bowl from the top of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: ''Make sure the device is unplugged before beginning disassembly!'' Lift the lid and bowl from the top of the device.

Lines.Text: turn the device upside-down , so that the four legs of the device point upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the device upside-down, so that the four legs of the device point upwards.

Lines.Text: each of the four legs has a rubber cushion on its bottom . for each cushion , insert a plastic opening tool between the plastic leg and rubber cushion , and pry off the rubber cushion .

Steps.Text_raw: Each of the four legs has a rubber cushion on its bottom. For each cushion, insert a plastic opening tool between the plastic leg and rubber cushion, and pry off the rubber cushion.

Lines.Text: using a spanner screwdriver , remove the one 10 mm long 7 mm diameter spanner screw from the side of the brass panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spanner screwdriver, remove the one 10mm long 7mm diameter spanner screw from the side of the brass panel.

Lines.Text: using a phillips screwdriver , remove the 10 mm long 7 mm diameter phillips-head screws from the inside of all four legs .
the smaller leg at the bottom is now loose and not attached to the device . set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips screwdriver, remove the 10mm long 7mm diameter Phillips-head screws from the inside of all four legs. The smaller leg at the bottom is now loose and not attached to the device. Set it aside.

Lines.Text: lift the brass plate off the device and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brass plate off the device and set it aside.

Lines.Text: color coordinating wire groups make it easier to identify the wire groups during reassembly .
inside the device , there are three junctions with wires joined by phillips-head screws . the first is connected to two wires , and the other two are connected to three wires each .
unscrew the screw at the junction near the opposite side of the device from the front panel .
label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Color coordinating wire groups make it easier to identify the wire groups during reassembly. Inside the device, there are three junctions with wires joined by Phillips-head screws. The first is connected to two wires, and the other two are connected to three wires each. Unscrew the screw at the junction near the opposite side of the device from the front panel. Label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screw at the junction just clockwise from the button panel .
label the three wires of this junction with tape of a second color .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screw at the junction just clockwise from the button panel. Label the three wires of this junction with tape of a second color.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screw from the wire junction just behind the front panel .
label the three wires at this junction with a third color of tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screw from the wire junction just behind the front panel. Label the three wires at this junction with a third color of tape.

Lines.Text: on the inside of the device , there is a silver-colored beam leading to the center with a u-shaped brass beam poking through it .
the u-shaped brass beam should be bent outwards so that it cannot fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam .

Steps.Text_raw: On the inside of the device, there is a silver-colored beam leading to the center with a U-shaped brass beam poking through it. The U-shaped brass beam should be bent outwards so that it cannot fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam.

Lines.Text: if the brass beam is not poking through the silver-colored beam , you will need to position it so that it is .
position the brass beam below the hole in the silver-colored beam and push the silver-colored beam into it , so that the brass beam pokes through .

Steps.Text_raw: If the brass beam is not poking through the silver-colored beam, you will need to position it so that it is. Position the brass beam below the hole in the silver-colored beam and push the silver-colored beam into it, so that the brass beam pokes through.

Lines.Text: if the brass beam can't fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam , use pliers to bend the brass beam outwards so that it does not fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam .

Steps.Text_raw: If the brass beam can't fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam, use pliers to bend the brass beam outwards so that it does not fit through the hole in the silver-colored beam.

Title: Black and Decker 3-Cup Rice Cooker Light Bulb Disassembly

Lines.Text: ''make sure the device is unplugged before beginning disassembly ! ''
lift the lid and bowl from the top of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: ''Make sure the device is unplugged before beginning disassembly!'' Lift the lid and bowl from the top of the device.

Lines.Text: turn the device upside-down , so that the four legs of the device point upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the device upside-down, so that the four legs of the device point upwards.

Lines.Text: each of the four legs has a rubber cushion on its bottom . for each cushion , insert a plastic opening tool between the plastic leg and rubber cushion , and pry off the rubber cushion .

Steps.Text_raw: Each of the four legs has a rubber cushion on its bottom. For each cushion, insert a plastic opening tool between the plastic leg and rubber cushion, and pry off the rubber cushion.

Lines.Text: using a spanner screwdriver , remove the one 10 mm long 7 mm diameter spanner screw from the side of the brass panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a spanner screwdriver, remove the one 10mm long 7mm diameter spanner screw from the side of the brass panel.

Lines.Text: using a phillips screwdriver , remove the 10 mm long 7 mm diameter phillips-head screws from the inside of all four legs .
the smaller leg at the bottom is now loose and not attached to the device . set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips screwdriver, remove the 10mm long 7mm diameter Phillips-head screws from the inside of all four legs. The smaller leg at the bottom is now loose and not attached to the device. Set it aside.

Lines.Text: lift the brass plate off the device and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brass plate off the device and set it aside.

Lines.Text: color coordinating wire groups make it easier to identify the wire groups during reassembly .
inside the device , there are three junctions with wires joined by phillips-head screws . the first is connected to two wires , and the other two are connected to three wires each .
unscrew the screw at the junction near the opposite side of the device from the front panel .
label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Color coordinating wire groups make it easier to identify the wire groups during reassembly. Inside the device, there are three junctions with wires joined by Phillips-head screws. The first is connected to two wires, and the other two are connected to three wires each. Unscrew the screw at the junction near the opposite side of the device from the front panel. Label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screw at the junction just clockwise from the button panel .
label the three wires of this junction with tape of a second color .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screw at the junction just clockwise from the button panel. Label the three wires of this junction with tape of a second color.

Lines.Text: unscrew the screw from the wire junction just behind the front panel .
label the three wires at this junction with a third color of tape .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the screw from the wire junction just behind the front panel. Label the three wires at this junction with a third color of tape.

Lines.Text: using a pair of pliers , bend the brass-colored beam poking through the hotplate's silver colored beam from a ( shape into a c shape so it fits through the hole in the silver-colored beam .
push the brass beam down and pull the silver beam up to disconnect the two beams .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a pair of pliers, bend the brass-colored beam poking through the hotplate's silver colored beam from a "(" shape into a "c" shape so it fits through the hole in the silver-colored beam. Push the brass beam down and pull the silver beam up to disconnect the two beams.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 10 mm long 7 mm diameter phillips screws attached to the hotplate .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 10mm long 7mm diameter Phillips screws attached to the hotplate.

Lines.Text: carefully lift up the device , either by allowing the hotplate portion to fall out while it is close to the ground , or by catching the hotplate portion as it slides out .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift up the device, either by allowing the hotplate portion to fall out while it is close to the ground, or by catching the hotplate portion as it slides out.

Lines.Text: turn the rice cooker so that the front panel is facing down and you have a good view of the inside .
remove the one 8 mm long 9 mm diameter phillips screw just above the inside of the front panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the rice cooker so that the front panel is facing down and you have a good view of the inside. Remove the one 8mm long 9mm diameter Phillips screw just above the inside of the front panel.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the front panel out along with the silver-colored metal beam .
lay the panel flat , with the silver-colored metal beam facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the front panel out along with the silver-colored metal beam. Lay the panel flat, with the silver-colored metal beam facing up.

Lines.Text: unscrew the 6 mm long 5 mm diameter phillips screw from whichever panel ( s ) correspond ( s ) to the light that was broken on the other side .
remove the yellow panel ( s ) by lifting them off or turning the panel upside-down .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 6mm long 5mm diameter Phillips screw from whichever panel(s) correspond(s) to the light that was broken on the other side. Remove the yellow panel(s) by lifting them off or turning the panel upside-down.

Lines.Text: for each broken lightbulb , expose the wire leading to the bulb by pulling back the plastic coating on the wire while gently holding onto the bulb .

Steps.Text_raw: For each broken lightbulb, expose the wire leading to the bulb by pulling back the plastic coating on the wire while gently holding onto the bulb.

Lines.Text: using a pair of needlenose pliers or wire strippers , cut the rubber covering on each wire about 5 mm from the edge and pull away the remaining rubber from the light .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a pair of needlenose pliers or wire strippers, cut the rubber covering on each wire about 5 mm from the edge and pull away the remaining rubber from the light.

Lines.Text: cut the wires close to the original light so that you will have more wire available for sautering in the next step .
use a pair of wire cutters , diagonal pliers , or sharp scissors , cut the wires leading to the light .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut the wires close to the original light so that you will have more wire available for sautering in the next step. Use a pair of wire cutters, diagonal pliers, or sharp scissors, cut the wires leading to the light.

Lines.Text: using a sautering iron , carefully sauter both wire ends of the new light bulb to the device's wires .
make sure that the wires don't cross , as this will stop the light from working .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a sautering iron, carefully sauter both wire ends of the new light bulb to the device's wires. Make sure that the wires don't cross, as this will stop the light from working.

Subject: Light bulb

carefully push the plates together to unlock the inner portion of the hotplate .

Lines.Text: remove the 47 mm by 30 mm spring , by pulling it up and off the locking latch .
if the spring is in multiple pieces , does not compress and spring back easily , or otherwise does not behave like a spring , you will need to replace it .

to reassemble your device , follow these instructions in reverse order . the two silver latches will need to be bent outwards separately , and the brass latch will need to be bent back into a or ( shape by holding the pliers to a 90 degree angle of that in the instructions .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 47 mm by 30 mm spring, by pulling it up and off the locking latch. If the spring is in multiple pieces, does not compress and spring back easily, or otherwise does not behave like a spring, you will need to replace it. To reassemble your device, follow these instructions in reverse order. The two silver latches will need to be bent outwards separately, and the brass latch will need to be bent back into a "["or "(" shape by holding the pliers to a 90 degree angle of that in the instructions.

Lines.Text: locate the two wires which are connected directly to the power cord . unlike the other wires , they are sheathed in a particularly thick , dot-textured plastic .
make sure the voltmeter is on and set to a setting beween 120 and 500 v . for most voltmeters the proper setting for this is the 200 v setting .
attach one of the voltmeter's probes to the metal portions of each of the two wires connected to the power cord's end on the device
the voltmeter should read a number significantly above 20 v . a reading between 100 and 150 v indicates that the device is getting enough power . a lower number indicates the power cord is broken .

Lines.Text: color coordinating wire groups make it easier to identify the wire groups during reassembly .
inside the device , there are three junctions with wires joined by phillips-head screws . the first is connected to two wires , and the other two are connected to three wires each .

label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape .

Label each of the two wires at this junction with a single color of tape.

label the three wires of this junction with tape of a second color .

Lines.Text: locate the two wires which are connected directly to the power cord . unlike the other wires , they are sheathed in a particularly thick , dot-textured plastic .
make sure the voltmeter is on and set to a setting beween 120 and 500 v . for most voltmeters the proper setting for this is the 200 v setting .
attach one of the voltmeter's probes to the metal portions of each of the two wires connected to the power cord's end on the device
the voltmeter should read a number significantly above 20 v . a reading between 100 and 150 v indicates that the device is getting enough power . a lower number indicates the power cord is broken .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two wires which are connected directly to the power cord. Unlike the other wires, they are sheathed in a particularly thick, dot-textured plastic. Make sure the voltmeter is on and set to a setting beween 120 and 500V. For most voltmeters the proper setting for this is the 200V setting. Attach one of the voltmeter's probes to the metal portions of each of the two wires connected to the power cord's end on the device The voltmeter should read a number significantly above 20V. A reading between 100 and 150 V indicates that the device is getting enough power. A lower number indicates the power cord is broken.

replace with new power cord by doing disassembly steps in reverse order .

Steps.Text_raw: To ensure the power cord is compatible with the device, make sure that the replacement cord you are using has a proper insulating coating and uses a NEMA 1 plug. Title: Repairing a Bent Oven Door that Won't Close

Lines.Text: if your stove has a burning-hot control panel when the oven is on , take a look down the edges of the door to see if it has a bend that keeps the top edge from closing tightly when the bottom part of the door is fully closed .

(a search for this problem online will find several stories from people who had had the door and/or control panel replaced at great expense , only to have the problem come back . also melted knobs ! ) your problem may be dangerously hot area above oven door and slow cooking . one might as well try to fix it before buying a new stove .
this repair is pretty easy but you've got to be careful laying out all the parts as you take the door apart so all parts go back in right-side-up when you put it back together .

tools needed : hacksaw ( to cut the steel angle ) , drill ( to drill the angles and the door panel ) , screwdriver ( to take the door apart and attach angle ) , wrench or pliers ( to hold nuts when screwing on the angles ) .

Steps.Text_raw: If your stove has a burning-hot control panel when the oven is on, take a look down the edges of the door to see if it has a bend that keeps the top edge from closing tightly when the bottom part of the door is fully closed. (A search for this problem online will find several stories from people who had had the door and/or control panel replaced at great expense, only to have the problem come back. Also melted knobs!)  Your problem may be  dangerously hot area above oven door and slow cooking.  One might as well try to fix it before buying a new stove. This repair is pretty easy but you've got to be careful laying out all the parts as you take the door apart so all parts go back in right-side-up when you put it back together. Tools needed:  Hacksaw (to cut the steel angle), drill (to drill the angles and the door panel), screwdriver (to take the door apart and attach angle), wrench or pliers (to hold nuts when screwing on the angles).

Lines.Text: searching online for amana acs3350 oven door won't close , and amana acs3350 oven door diagram finds this thread :

the tee shirt suggestion-- actually , the first answer says tesher but the second guy translates it as teeshirt . bending the door back into shape by that method will fix it until it bends again . the holes drilled in the edges of the door ( hidden by a trim panel ) just above the top of each hinge makes it prone to bend .
as well as epinions review . the image of the door diagram , not posted here since it may be somebody's intellectual property .

Steps.Text_raw: Searching online for "Amana ACS3350 oven door won't close", and "Amana ACS3350 oven door diagram" finds this [http://www.fixya.com/support/t1259379-amana_oven_door_will_not_shut_tightly|fixya thread]: The tee shirt suggestion-- actually, the first answer says "tesher" but the second guy  translates it as teeshirt.  Bending the door back into shape by that method will fix it until it bends again.  The holes drilled in the edges of the door (hidden by a trim panel)  just above the top of each hinge makes it prone to bend.] As well as [http://www.epinions.com/review/hmgd-Large_Appliances-All-Ranges-Amana_Black_3_7_cu_ft_Gas_Slide-in_Range_with_Die-Cast_Sealed_Burners_ACS3350AB/content_440393961092?sb=1|this Epinions review]. The image of the door diagram, not posted here since it may be somebody's intellectual property.

Lines.Text: the door lifts off the hinges . if you've got the stove owner's manual it tells how to remove door . ( open door partly and pull it up . ) looking at the diagram and carefully laying parts out so as to be able to get them back in place later , take the door apart .

Steps.Text_raw: The door lifts off the hinges.  If you've got the stove owner's manual it tells how to remove door.  (Open door partly and pull it up.)  Looking at the diagram and carefully laying parts out so as to be able to get them back in place later, take the door apart.

Lines.Text: cut two 18 inch long pieces of 3 /4 inch steel angle . the angles mount inside the door and are secured with fender washers and 10-32 machine screws . then reassemble the door , slide it back on the hinges , and you're done !

an expensive stove with almost useless oven is fairly easy to fix ! the front panel still gets pretty hot , but not so hot that you're burned if you touch it . the oven gets to temperature and the cooking person who uses recipes no longer complains about super-long cooking times .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut two 18 inch long pieces of 3/4 inch steel angle.  The angles mount inside the door and are secured with fender washers and 10-32 machine screws.  Then reassemble the door, slide it back on the hinges, and you're done! An expensive stove with almost useless oven is fairly easy to fix!  The front panel still gets pretty hot, but not so hot that you're burned if you touch it.  The oven gets to temperature and the cooking person who uses recipes no longer complains about super-long cooking times.

Lines.Text: using a flathead screwdriver , remove the five , 28 mm front motor housing screws .

Title: Honeywell HY-204 Febreze Dial Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the four 14 mm screws from the back of the device using the phillips 0 screwdriver .

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 mm phillips 0 screws from the back of the black dial box .

Lines.Text: be careful not to separate the wires from the black dial box during separation , or you will have to re-solder them .
pull the dial carefully , but forcefully , straight away from the black dial box . do not twist the dial button while removing it .
when reassembling , screw the black box on first , line up the hole on the dial with the shaft on the black box , and push the dial into place .

Steps.Text_raw: Be careful not to separate the wires from the black dial box during separation, or you will have to re-solder them. Pull the dial carefully, but forcefully, straight away from the black dial box. Do not twist the dial button while removing it. When reassembling, screw the black box on first, line up the hole on the dial with the shaft on the black box, and push the dial into place.

Title: Krups F203 Coffee Grinder Plug/Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: in each of the four rectangular slots on the bottom of the device , there is an e-shaped clip .

Steps.Text_raw: In each of the four rectangular slots on the bottom of the device, there is an E-shaped clip.

Lines.Text: wedge the spudger between the flat side of the e-clip and the outside wall of the slot . then , loosen up the clip by prying it inward with the spudger .
try not to break these clips as this will cause structural integrity issues upon reassembly

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the spudger between the flat side of the E-clip and the outside wall of the slot. Then, loosen up the clip by prying it inward with the spudger. Try not to break these clips as this will cause structural integrity issues upon reassembly

Lines.Text: work your way around the four clips , loosening each a little at a time . eventually , all four clips will be loose enough to remove the base plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Work your way around the four clips, loosening each a little at a time. Eventually, all four clips will be loose enough to remove the base plate.

be sure to reference the how to solder video posted on the device page .

Title: Braun Aromaster KF440 one-way valve Replacement

turn the braun aromaster kf 440 upside down so the base is exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the carafe (coffee pot) from the coffee maker. Turn the Braun Aromaster KF 440 upside down so the base is exposed.

Lines.Text: locate the nut at the center of the base and unscrew it with a pair of basic pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the nut at the center of the base and unscrew it with a pair of basic pliers.

Lines.Text: gently lift the cover away from the bottom of the coffee maker and remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the cover away from the bottom of the coffee maker and remove it.

Lines.Text: locate the one-way valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the one-way valve.

Lines.Text: lift up on the one way valve to snap it out of place . ( this shouldn't require much force ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on the one way valve to snap it out of place. (This shouldn't require much force).

Lines.Text: using the larger plastic opening tool , gently push the tubing off of the one-way valve . ( if the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off , run the metal spudger around the inside of tubing to free it up . )

Steps.Text_raw: Using the larger plastic opening tool, gently push the tubing off of the one-way valve. (If the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off, run the metal spudger around the inside of tubing to free it up.)

Lines.Text: completely remove one-way valve from the inside of the coffee maker .

the piece will remain attached to the center plate for now .

place the opening tool under the clasp and gently lift the plastic clasps .

Lines.Text: gently lift the cover away from the bottom of the coffee maker and remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the cover away from the bottom of the coffee maker and remove it.

Lines.Text: using the larger plastic opening tool , gently push the tubing off of the one-way valve . ( if the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off , run the metal spudger around the inside of the tubing to free it up . )

Steps.Text_raw: Using the larger plastic opening tool, gently push the tubing off of the one-way valve. (If the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off, run the metal spudger around the inside of the tubing to free it up.)

Lines.Text: using the larger plastic opening tool , gently push the tubing off of the second one-way valve . ( if the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off , run the metal spudger around the inside of the tubing to free it up . )

Steps.Text_raw: Using the larger plastic opening tool, gently push the tubing off of the second one-way valve. (If the tubing is being stubborn and won't come off, run the metal spudger around the inside of the tubing to free it up.)

Lines.Text: looking at bottom of the coffee maker , locate the two gray wires attached to the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Looking at bottom of the coffee maker, locate the two gray wires attached to the circuit board.

Lines.Text: remove each wire by gripping with pliers and then gently pulling straight up .

if you're having a hard time getting the wires off , gently wiggle the wire end back and forth with the pliers while keeping sufficient downward force on the circuit board with your finger . the wire should pop off easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove each wire by gripping with pliers and then gently pulling straight up. If you're having a hard time getting the wires off, gently wiggle the wire end back and forth with the pliers while keeping sufficient downward force on the circuit board with your finger. The wire should pop off easily.

Lines.Text: locate the second set of attached wires , which are connected to the on/off switch .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the second set of attached wires, which are connected to the on/off switch.

Lines.Text: notice that there are 4 wires to remove .
remove each wire by gently gripping with pliers and then pulling straight back .
again , if your having a hard time removing the wires , revert back to the tip given in step 4.

Steps.Text_raw: Notice that there are 4 wires to remove. Remove each wire by gently gripping with pliers and then pulling straight back. Again, if your having a hard time removing the wires, revert back to the tip given in step 4.

Lines.Text: once everything is detached , the heating element should come right out .

Steps.Text_raw: Once everything is detached, the heating element should come right out.

Lines.Text: remove the bolt by simply screwing it off by hand , or by using the pliers again if you need to .
remove the metal spacer . ( note : make sure you are aware which way it came off because it does matter when you go to reassemble )
remove the wing nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bolt by simply screwing it off by hand, or by using the pliers again if you need to. Remove the metal spacer. ( Note: Make sure you are aware which way it came off because it does matter when you go to reassemble) Remove the wing nut.

Lines.Text: pull the heating element off of the heating plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the heating element off of the heating plate.

Subject: Heating Element

Title: Philips Kettle HD4685 Capacitors Replacement

Lines.Text: remove top lid
unscrew 5x torx ( t8 )
remove red cover
remember position of metallic bracket

Steps.Text_raw: Remove top lid Unscrew 5x Torx (T8) Remove red cover Remember position of metallic bracket

Lines.Text: carefully remove metallic strip
llift-up the entire black electric carrying unit carefully about 1 cm
un-click the fix of the black front cover and remove

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove metallic strip llift-up the entire black electric carrying unit carefully about 1 cm Un-click the fix of the black front cover and remove

Lines.Text: unscrew 3 torx t8 at the bottom of the kettle
take 3 big flat screwdriver to 3 of the 6 holes and gently apply pressure directed to the middle to unlock the bottom cover
in parallel : with a 3 rd screwdriver lift the cover by help of the occuring slit at the side
bottom cover should be revomed with gently force

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew 3 Torx T8 at the bottom of the kettle take 3 big flat screwdriver to 3 of the 6 holes and gently apply pressure directed to the middle to unlock the bottom cover in parallel: with a 3rd screwdriver lift the cover by help of the occuring slit at the side bottom cover should be revomed with gently force

Lines.Text: un-click the small mount to remove one half of the grip
un-fix carefully the hole half of the grip at the top of it and remove it
don't demage the cables inside the grip

Steps.Text_raw: Un-click the small mount to remove one half of the grip un-fix carefully the hole half of the grip at the top of it and remove it Don't demage the cables inside the grip

Lines.Text: take a small screwdriver
push the black cover around the kettle over the transparent 'litre scale
make it at both side of the kettle
pull the black cattle carefulle to the bottom of the kettle
stop , when you can see the full electric carrying unit ( see also next step )

Steps.Text_raw: take a small screwdriver push the black cover around the kettle over the transparent 'litre scale" make it at both side of the kettle pull the black cattle carefulle to the bottom of the kettle stop, when you can see the full electric carrying unit (see also next step)

Lines.Text: unscrew the two torx t8 to open the electric carrying unit to a half
unlock carefully the white rectacgular clip to release the black cover completely

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two Torx T8 to open the electric carrying unit to a half unlock carefully the white rectacgular clip to release the black cover completely

Lines.Text: lift the electric unit
change the two marked capacitors by unsoldering the old ones
yellow 'mkp x2 0.47 μf / 275 v'
black '470 μf / 16 v' - check polarity : white stripe of the minus has to be located near the yellow capacitor !

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the electric unit change the two marked capacitors by unsoldering the old ones yellow 'MKP X2 0.47μF / 275V' black '470μF / 16V' - check polarity: white stripe of the minus has to be located near the yellow capacitor!

Lines.Text: assemble the kettle in reverse manner and check at the end that you don't have any parts over
enjoy your working kettle !
now it should heat up to 100 c and make 'beep' at the end again

Steps.Text_raw: Assemble the kettle in reverse manner and check at the end that you don't have any parts over ENJOY YOUR WORKING KETTLE! Now it should heat up to 100°C and make 'beep' at the end again

Subject: Capacitors

Title: Fisher and Paykel Aquasmart Washing Machine Suspension Rods Replacement
Category: Fisher and Paykel Aquasmart Washing Machine

Lines.Text: first step is to disconnect power .
then disconnect all the hoses at the back and move the machine to a place where you have some room to work .

Steps.Text_raw: First step is to disconnect power. Then disconnect all the hoses at the back and move the machine to a place where you have some room to work.

Lines.Text: removing the lid is the easiest part . just push back until the lid is perpendicular with the top of the machine , then lift upwards and it will release .

Steps.Text_raw: Removing the lid is the easiest part. Just push back until the lid is perpendicular with the top of the machine, then lift upwards and it will release.

Lines.Text: simply pry off the plastic screw covers then unscrew the two forward screws . note there is no need to remove the cover , just tilt it backwards on its hinge to gain access . be careful with hoses and electrical wires at the back of the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Simply pry off the plastic screw covers then unscrew the two forward screws. Note there is no need to remove the cover, just tilt it backwards on its hinge to gain access. Be careful with hoses and electrical wires at the back of the cover.

Lines.Text: i used an old coat hanger to suspend the plastic cover out of the way by hooking it onto the trolley that i used to move the washing machine . this gives you access to the 4 rubber straps and 4 suspension rods .

Steps.Text_raw: I used an old coat hanger to suspend the plastic cover out of the way by hooking it onto the trolley that I used to move the washing machine. This gives you access to the 4 rubber straps and 4 suspension rods.

Lines.Text: you will see there are four rubber straps , one in each corner . i decided to replace these as well just to be on the safe side . when the old and new rubber straps were placed next to each other there was a significant difference in length . just pull them straight off .

Steps.Text_raw: You will see there are four rubber straps, one in each corner. I decided to replace these as well just to be on the safe side. When the old and new rubber straps were placed next to each other there was a significant difference in length. Just pull them straight off.

Lines.Text: the metal cylinder down the end is full of oil which leaks out over time . when i removed this one it was very greasy . note the rear right rod has a bend in it and is unique to the other three . ensure you identify this one first prior to commencing .

Steps.Text_raw: The metal cylinder down the end is full of oil which leaks out over time. When I removed this one it was very greasy. Note the rear right rod has a bend in it and is unique to the other three. Ensure you identify this one first prior to commencing.

Lines.Text: place your left hand under the drum rim and support it . remove and replace one rod at a time . you don't want the weight of the drum on the motor and pump below as you may break something underneath . by replacing them one at a time , the other three can help support the weight of the drum .

Steps.Text_raw: Place your left hand under the drum rim and support it. Remove and replace one rod at a time. You don't want the weight of the drum on the motor and pump below as you may break something underneath. By replacing them one at a time, the other three can help support the weight of the drum.

Lines.Text: to remove the rods lift the plastic hanger off the chassis and then jiggle the bottom part of the rod out of the slotted holder . there are no fasteners holding the rods in place . its just the weight of the drum holding them in place .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the rods lift the plastic hanger off the chassis and then jiggle the bottom part of the rod out of the slotted holder. There are no fasteners holding the rods in place. Its just the weight of the drum holding them in place.

Lines.Text: there is a clip half way down the rear right rod that needs to be undone . you also need to move the hoses and electrical looms out from under the plastic hanger prior to removing the rod . to remove the rods lift the plastic hanger off the chassis and then jiggle the bottom part of the rod out of the slotted holder .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a clip half way down the rear right rod that needs to be undone. You also need to move the hoses and electrical looms out from under the plastic hanger prior to removing the rod. To remove the rods lift the plastic hanger off the chassis and then jiggle the bottom part of the rod out of the slotted holder.

Lines.Text: once you have replaced all of the suspension rods and rubber straps you can reassemble the washing machine cover and lid . then you are finished . my washing machine ran beautifully after i completed this repair . best of luck to you .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have replaced all of the suspension rods and rubber straps you can reassemble the washing machine cover and lid. Then you are finished. My washing machine ran beautifully after I completed this repair. Best of luck to you.

Subject: Replacing Suspension Rods

Title: How to Fix Leaking Dolce Gusto Genio

Lines.Text: be sure to unplug the device first
remove the water tank , then with the tr10 screwdriver , first remove the two screws behind the tank ( red arrows )
now carefully remove the spring from it's holder ( orange arrow )

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure to unplug the device first Remove the water tank, then with the TR10 screwdriver, first remove the two screws behind the tank (red arrows) Now carefully remove the spring from it's holder (orange arrow)

Lines.Text: remove the two tr10 screws from the bottom part

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two TR10 screws from the bottom part

Lines.Text: with the back of the device towards you , start on the left panel
it is connected with 6 clips at the lower part , and several more for the top part
carefully pry loose the clips from the bottom upwards , starting with the clips on the bottom ( red arrows )
next open up the clip next to the power cord

open up the three clips on the side of the panel ( orange arrows ) . locktabs grip the holes in the orange clips 1 and 2. they will let go if they are lifted directly outwards from their base . just next to the locktabs are guide pins . they don't offer resistance during removal .

Steps.Text_raw: With the back of the device towards you, start on the left panel It is connected with 6 clips at the lower part, and several more for the top part Carefully pry loose the clips from the bottom upwards, starting with the clips on the bottom (red arrows) next open up the clip next to the power cord open up the three clips on the side of the panel (orange arrows). Locktabs grip the holes in the orange clips 1 and 2. They will let go if they are lifted  directly outwards from their base. Just next to the locktabs are guide pins. they don't offer resistance during removal.

Lines.Text: now continue with the top part . it is connected at two places , with a big mess of clips and placeholders . some force might be needed to pull them apart .
first tackle the bottom row of clips ( red arrow )
then pry the top row apart ( other red arrow )
you can now remove the entire left side and put it aside

Steps.Text_raw: Now continue with the top part. It is connected at two places, with a big mess of clips and placeholders. Some force might be needed to pull them apart. First tackle the bottom row of clips (red arrow) Then pry the top row apart (other red arrow) You can now remove the entire left side and put it aside

Lines.Text: remove the right side following the same procedure as for the left side . once the right side is fully loosened , disconnect the power button from the panel . it is held in its place by two small clips , which are easily loosened with the flathead screwdriver or spludger .
we now have full access to the penguin's innards !

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the right side following the same procedure as for the left side. Once the right side is fully loosened, disconnect the power button from the panel. It is held in its place by two small clips, which are easily loosened with the flathead screwdriver or spludger. We now have full access to the penguin's innards!

Lines.Text: there are three common places for the leak to occur . the flow rate measurement , the connector assembly to the water tank and the pump assembly .
to identify which of those is leaking , simply look for water where it's not expected . all couplings should be fully dry .

of the three common places of leaks , most stem from calcification of the connector assembly . since the standard decalcification methods ( with the satches ) doesn't touch these parts , it easily gets clogged up and water leaks in between the sealings .
when one of the couplings did fail , or the flow measurement or connector assembly is cracked , replace those parts first

Steps.Text_raw: There are three common places for the leak to occur. The flow rate measurement, the connector assembly to the water tank and the pump assembly. To identify which of those is leaking, simply look for water where it's not expected. All couplings should be fully dry. Of the three common places of leaks, most stem from calcification of the connector assembly. Since the standard decalcification methods (with the satches) doesn't touch these parts, it easily gets clogged up and water leaks in between the sealings. When one of the couplings did fail, or the flow measurement or connector assembly is cracked, replace those parts first

Lines.Text: loosen the connector assembly . it is not glued or held back by clips , so a slight wiggle is enough to pull it .
pull out the sealing rubber and filter
carefully but thoroughly clean the housing , the seal and the filter of any calcified remains .
clean the underside of the housing where the assembly is connected to the housing . remove all calcified remains from here as well

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the connector assembly. It is not glued or held back by clips, so a slight wiggle is enough to pull it. Pull out the sealing rubber and filter Carefully but thoroughly clean the housing, the seal and the filter of any calcified remains. Clean the underside of the housing where the assembly is connected to the housing. Remove all calcified remains from here as well

Title: Magic Bullet NutriBullet Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: before beginning , make sure the device is unplugged .
with a phillips head 2 screwdriver , begin unscrewing the four 10 mm screws located on the bottom of the power base .

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning, make sure the device is unplugged. With a Phillips head #2 screwdriver, begin unscrewing the four 10mm screws located on the bottom of the power base.

Lines.Text: once the screws are removed , pull the plastic base up gently .
once the plastic base is removed , there is a fan located in the center of the powerbase . make sure the cord does not get caught or frayed by the fan .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are removed, pull the plastic base up gently. Once the plastic base is removed, there is a fan located in the center of the powerbase. Make sure the cord does not get caught or frayed by the fan.

Lines.Text: gently lift the power cord from its side slot and place it to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the power cord from its side slot and place it to the side.

Lines.Text: with the phillips head 2 screwdriver , remove the two 10 mm screws that secure the white bracket .
the white safety bracket holds the cord down . after removing it , the cord will be free .

Steps.Text_raw: With the Phillips head #2 screwdriver, remove the two 10mm screws that secure the white bracket. The white safety bracket holds the cord down. After removing it, the cord will be free.

Lines.Text: after removing the gray base and silver casing , the wires will now be free and you will have easy access to them .
gently pull out the two plastic covers at the end of the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: After removing the gray base and silver casing, the wires will now be free and you will have easy access to them. Gently pull out the two plastic covers at the end of the wires.

Lines.Text: use tape or clamps to hold the wires together for an easy soldering experience .
using a soldering iron , solder your new wire to the red wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tape or clamps to hold the wires together for an easy soldering experience. Using a soldering iron, solder your new wire to the red wire.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: iRobot Roomba 650 Side Brush Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: with the roomba upside down and turned off , use the phillip's 02 screwdriver to remove the one 3.5 mm screw from the center of the side-brush .
set the screw aside and pull the brush out .

Steps.Text_raw: With the Roomba upside down and turned off, use the Phillip's 02 screwdriver to remove the one 3.5 mm screw from the center of the side-brush. Set the screw aside and pull the brush out.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four screws that hold the bottom panel using the phillips 02 screwdriver .

the screws will not come out of the bottom panel . they were designed to become loose but not be removed . this prevents you from losing them , and prevents the roomba from sucking them up if they came out during cleaning .
once you are sure that all the screws have been loosened as much as possible , then lift the bottom panel up off the roomba .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four screws that hold the bottom panel using the Phillips 02 screwdriver. The screws will not come out of the bottom panel. They were designed to become loose but not be removed. This prevents you from losing them, and prevents the Roomba from sucking them up if they came out during cleaning. Once you are sure that all the screws have been loosened as much as possible, then lift the bottom panel up off the Roomba.

Lines.Text: locate and loosen the two small screws fastened to the motor housing with the phillip's 00 screwdriver . like the bottom panel screws , these will not come out completely .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and loosen the two small screws fastened to the motor housing with the Phillip's 00 Screwdriver. Like the bottom panel screws, these will not come out completely.

Lines.Text: remove the screw on top of the housing . the small plastic piece should come right off .
carefully pry open the gear box by inserting a flat head screwdriver in the slot on the end of the box . ''this might be difficult and require some wiggling of the screwdriver . ''
the cover should come right off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw on top of the housing. The small plastic piece should come right off. Carefully pry open the gear box by inserting a flat head screwdriver in the slot on the end of the box. ''This might be difficult and require some wiggling of the screwdriver.'' The cover should come right off.

Lines.Text: locate and loosen the two screws inside the gearbox with the phillips 00 screwdriver . the motor should come right out the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and loosen the two screws inside the gearbox with the Phillips 00 Screwdriver. The motor should come right out the bottom.

Subject: Side Brush Motor

Title: iRobot Roomba 655 Pet Series Side Brush and Back Panel Removal

Lines.Text: flip the device over onto its back
unscrew the single screw that connects the side brush to brush motor using the phillips head 2 screwdriver
''this screw does not come out of the yellow side brush''

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device over onto its back Unscrew the single screw that connects the side brush to brush motor using the Phillips head #2 screwdriver ''This screw does not come out of the yellow side brush''

Lines.Text: remove the four phillips 1 screws on the back panel .
pop off the back plate once the screws are loose by gently prying away from the body
''the screws don't come completely out of the panel , but it will still come apart once unscrewed . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four Phillips #1 screws on the back panel. Pop off the back plate once the screws are loose by gently prying away from the body ''The screws don't come completely out of the panel, but it will still come apart once unscrewed.''

Subject: Side Brush and Back Panel

unscrew the single screw that connects the side brush to brush motor using the phillips head 2 screwdriver
''this screw does not come out of the yellow side brush''

pop off the back plate once the screws are loose by gently prying away from the body

insert the plastic spudger under the wheel housing .
apply force to pry the wheel '''straight '''up .
remove the wheel housing from the robot .

Steps.Text_raw: With the robot upside down, hold the caster wheel housing steady. Insert the plastic spudger under the wheel housing. Apply force to pry the wheel '''straight '''up. Remove the wheel housing from the robot.

with the other hand , push the wheel up and pop it out of its slotted housing .
clean the wheel with soap and water .

do not pull up too hard because you could snap a wire attached to the motor or motor circuit board .

pull the dust bin out

remove the top plastic carefully

remove the two 7 mm screws with your phillips 1 screwdriver , holding the wire sensors in place to the front bumper .

make sure the device is unplugged before continuing .

remove the bottom cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the six 10mm screws found on the bottom of the device. Remove the bottom cover.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 1 screwdriver , unscrew the 11 mm screws .
remove the plastic bar that is holding the power cord down .

Lines.Text: using scissors , carefully cut the zip tie .
careful not to cut the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Using scissors, carefully cut the zip tie. Careful not to cut the Power Cord.

gently pull off the plastic cover .
repeat this step with the other plastic cover .

Lines.Text: remove the power cord from the device .

Lines.Text: make sure the device is unplugged before continuing .
turn the kitchen gourmet upside down .

remove the bottom cover .

some screws are not visible from this photo , but their location is highlighted by the circles .

carefully slide down the metal covering .
repeat this step for the other tube .

carefully slide down the metal covering .
repeat this step for the other tube .
remove both of the water tubes completely .

Title: iRobot Roomba 650 Bumper Sensor IR Transmitter Replacement

Lines.Text: with the roomba upside down and turned off , use the phillip's 02 screwdriver to remove the one 3.5 mm screw from the center of the side-brush .
set the screw aside and pull the brush out .

Steps.Text_raw: With the Roomba upside down and turned off, use the Phillip's 02 screwdriver to remove the one 3.5 mm screw from the center of the side-brush. Set the screw aside and pull the brush out.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four screws that hold the bottom panel using the phillips 02 screwdriver .

the screws will not come out of the bottom panel . they were designed to become loose but not be removed . this prevents you from losing them , and prevents the roomba from sucking them up if they came out during cleaning .
once you are sure that all the screws have been loosened as much as possible , then lift the bottom panel up off the roomba .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four screws that hold the bottom panel using the Phillips 02 screwdriver. The screws will not come out of the bottom panel. They were designed to become loose but not be removed. This prevents you from losing them, and prevents the Roomba from sucking them up if they came out during cleaning. Once you are sure that all the screws have been loosened as much as possible, then lift the bottom panel up off the Roomba.

Lines.Text: once the side brush and bottom panel are out of the way , simply grasp the battery by the two green flaps and pull it out .

in the unlikely event that the battery has leaked acid , '''avoid all contact with it and any surfaces it has affected . ''' wear protective gloves and wipe up any residue with a paper towel . secure the battery in a plastic bag and dispose of it properly .
if you get battery acid on your skin or in your eye , flush immediately with water and seek medical attention .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the side brush and bottom panel are out of the way, simply grasp the battery by the two green flaps and pull it out. In the unlikely event that the battery has leaked acid, '''avoid all contact with it and any surfaces it has affected.''' Wear protective gloves and wipe up any residue with a paper towel. Secure the battery in a plastic bag and dispose of it properly. If you get battery acid on your skin or in your eye, flush immediately with water and seek medical attention.

Lines.Text: remove the front bumper . you may remove it with your hands or a tool . it should snap off with some effort . it will still be attached to the roomba by a couple of wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the front bumper. You may remove it with your hands or a tool. It should snap off with some effort. It will still be attached to the Roomba by a couple of wires.

Lines.Text: pull out the bin while pressing down on the release button . set aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out the bin while pressing down on the release button. Set aside.

Lines.Text: remove the top plastic cover by first using a plastic opening tool or metal spudger around the edges . then , carefully lift up from the back .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top plastic cover by first using a plastic opening tool or metal spudger around the edges. Then, carefully lift up from the back.

Lines.Text: use the phillip's head 1 screwdriver to take out the 10 5 mm screws .
continue to take out the two 5.5 mm screws with the phillip's head 2 screwdriver .
finally , remove the last 7.5 mm screw with the phillip's head 1 screwdriver .
lift the panel off and set aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillip's Head #1 Screwdriver to take out the 10 5 mm screws. Continue to take out the two 5.5 mm screws with the Phillip's Head #2 Screwdriver. Finally, remove the last 7.5 mm screw with the Phillip's Head #1 Screwdriver. Lift the panel off and set aside.

Lines.Text: remove the yellow ring and the two plastic control panel covers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the yellow ring and the two plastic control panel covers.

Lines.Text: use the phillip's 1 screwdriver to remove the four 7.5 mm screws that hold the control panel to the motherboard .
lift the control panel off , then lift the clear plastic motherboard protecting sheet and set both aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillip's #1 Screwdriver to remove the four 7.5 mm screws that hold the control panel to the motherboard. Lift the control panel off, then lift the clear plastic motherboard protecting sheet and set both aside.

Lines.Text: use the phillip's head 1 screwdriver to remove the five 5.5 mm motherboard screws .
gently lift the motherboard up off the roomba about half an inch .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillip's Head #1 Screwdriver to remove the five 5.5 mm motherboard screws. Gently lift the motherboard up off the Roomba about half an inch.

Lines.Text: remove the round cliff sensor belt by pulling it up off of the front edge of the roomba .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the round cliff sensor belt by pulling it up off of the front edge of the Roomba.

Lines.Text: disconnect the three cables that attach the motherboard to the front of the roomba .
lift up the motherboard , cliff sensor belt , and front bumper up and out of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the three cables that attach the motherboard to the front of the Roomba. Lift up the motherboard, cliff sensor belt, and front bumper up and out of the way.

Lines.Text: remove the rubber cover on the bumper sensor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rubber cover on the bumper sensor.

Lines.Text: use the phillip's 1 screwdriver to remove the two 7.5 mm screws from the bumper sensor module .
pry the module clips open with a spudger or your finger .
open the sensor module .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillip's #1 screwdriver to remove the two 7.5 mm screws from the bumper sensor module. Pry the module clips open with a spudger or your finger. Open the sensor module.

Lines.Text: once the bumper sensor module is open , remove the small ir chip .
pull off the black protector surrounding the chip .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the bumper sensor module is open, remove the small IR chip. Pull off the black protector surrounding the chip.

Lines.Text: for this next step , it might be helpful to have another set of hands .
use a soldering iron to desolder pins on the blue ir receiver . try repeatedly warming each pin up and giving a tug on the receiver . it should eventually slide out .
you will need to then solder in a new receiver in the exact same place you took the old one out .

Steps.Text_raw: For this next step, it might be helpful to have another set of hands. Use a soldering iron to desolder pins on the blue IR receiver. Try repeatedly warming each pin up and giving a tug on the receiver. It should eventually slide out. You will need to then solder in a new receiver in the exact same place you took the old one out.

Subject: Bumper Sensor IR Transmitter

Title: Hamilton Beach 25460Z Handle Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug your device before proceeding with disassembly .
on the back of the press , remove the locking washer by prying upwards with the nylon or metal spudger tool .
repeat for the other washer across from the first one .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug your device before proceeding with disassembly. On the back of the press, remove the locking washer by prying upwards with the nylon or metal spudger tool. Repeat for the other washer across from the first one.

Lines.Text: using any long , thin object , push the 43 mm bolt from the inside towards the outside to expose the end of the bolt .
pull the end of the bolt out to completely remove it .
repeat for the second bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: Using any long, thin object, push the 43mm  bolt from the inside towards the outside to expose the end of the bolt. Pull the end of the bolt out to completely remove it. Repeat for the second bolt.

Lines.Text: using the 4.0 mm allen wrench , unscrew the two 26 mm bolts connecting the handle to the upper heating element housing on both sides .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 4.0mm Allen Wrench, unscrew the two 26mm bolts connecting the handle to the upper heating element housing on both sides.

Lines.Text: unscrew the locking knob all the way to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the locking knob all the way to remove it.

Lines.Text: slide the locking knob couple down to the base of the handle , then pull up on the free end of the handle . it will easily pop off .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the locking knob couple down to the base of the handle, then pull up on the free end of the handle. It will easily pop off.

Subject: Handle

Title: Hamilton Beach 25460Z Top Heating Element Solders Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug your device before proceeding with disassembly .
on the back of the press , remove the locking washer by prying upwards with the nylon or metal spudger tool .
repeat for the other washer across from the first one .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug your device before proceeding with disassembly. On the back of the press, remove the locking washer by prying upwards with the nylon or metal spudger tool. Repeat for the other washer across from the first one.

Lines.Text: using any long , thin object , push the 43 mm bolt from the inside towards the outside to expose the end of the bolt .
pull the end of the bolt out to completely remove it .
repeat for the second bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: Using any long, thin object, push the 43mm  bolt from the inside towards the outside to expose the end of the bolt. Pull the end of the bolt out to completely remove it. Repeat for the second bolt.

Lines.Text: using the 4.0 mm allen wrench , unscrew the two 26 mm bolts connecting the handle to the upper heating element housing on both sides .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 4.0mm Allen Wrench, unscrew the two 26mm bolts connecting the handle to the upper heating element housing on both sides.

Lines.Text: unscrew the locking knob all the way to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the locking knob all the way to remove it.

Lines.Text: slide the locking knob couple down to the base of the handle , then pull up on the free end of the handle . it will easily pop off .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the locking knob couple down to the base of the handle, then pull up on the free end of the handle. It will easily pop off.

Lines.Text: gently separate the heating element housing from the cooking surface by pulling up on the housing and pushing down on the surface .
pulling too far or too hard can break the delicate internal wiring .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently separate the heating element housing from the cooking surface by pulling up on the housing and pushing down on the surface. Pulling too far or too hard can break the delicate internal wiring.

Lines.Text: on the underside of the housing , use the ph2 screwdriver to remove the single 12 mm screw to disconnect the led tray .
the housing can now be completely removed .

Steps.Text_raw: On the underside of the housing, use the PH2 Screwdriver to remove the single 12mm screw to disconnect the LED tray. The housing can now be completely removed.

Lines.Text: the left lead needs to be connected to the two red wires .
the right lead needs to be connected to the two white wires .
one or both of the leads can have damaged solder , resulting in poor connections between the lead and the wire ends .
de-solder the existing solder joints on the lead ( s ) .
solder the wire ends back to their corresponding leads .
refer to this topic : solderingpage if you need to brush up on your soldering skills .

Steps.Text_raw: The left lead needs to be connected to the two red wires. The right lead needs to be connected to the two white wires. One or both of the leads can have damaged solder, resulting in poor connections between the lead and the wire ends. De-solder the existing solder joints on the lead(s). Solder the wire ends back to their corresponding leads. Refer to this [[Topic:Soldering|page]] if you need to brush up on your soldering skills.

Subject: Top Heating Element Solders
