Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 4 screws on the inside. Remove 2 13.3mm Phillips PH#2 screws. Remove 2 17.5 mm  Phillips PH#2 screws. Unscrewing these screws will isolate the switch board.

Lines.Text: refer to these steps on soldering to replace the electrical cord in the smart stick .
be careful when soldering ; it gets very hot .

Steps.Text_raw: Refer to these steps on  [https://www.ifixit.com/Wiki/Soldering| Soldering] to replace the electrical cord  in the smart stick. Be careful when soldering; it gets very hot.

Subject: Electrical Cord

Title: Disassembling Honeywell HY-254-TGT Plastic Assembly

Lines.Text: remove the two 3 /4 wing screws on the bottom of the fan by rotating them counter-clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 3/4" wing screws on the bottom of the fan by rotating them counter-clockwise.

Lines.Text: twist the fan base counter-clockwise until the pins line up as shown .
pull the base straight towards you to remove it , feeding the wire through the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the fan base counter-clockwise until the pins line up as shown. Pull the base straight towards you to remove it, feeding the wire through the base.

Lines.Text: remove all of the marked 1 /2 phillips 02 screws on the backside of the fan
remove the two marked 3 /4 phillips 02 screws in the middle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all of the marked 1/2" Phillips #02 screws on the backside of the fan Remove the two marked 3/4" Phillips #02 screws in the middle.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool or screwdriver to pry off the back of the fan , starting from the top down .
be aware of two clips inside the fan , towards the bottom third of the fan . if the back appears stuck on certain spots , push inward edges of the front casing around the problematic area .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool or screwdriver to pry off the back of the fan, starting from the top down. Be aware of two clips inside the fan, towards the bottom third of the fan. If the back appears stuck on certain spots,  push inward edges of the front casing around the problematic area.

Subject: Plastic Assembly

Title: Motor and Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the highlighted screws shown with a phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the highlighted screws shown with a Phillips #2 Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the motor from the motor mounting plate . pull the motor and cord to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motor from the motor mounting plate. Pull the motor and cord to the side.

Lines.Text: use pliers to grip the crimp .

Steps.Text_raw: Use pliers to grip the crimp.

Lines.Text: open the crimp by pressing it opposite to how the crimp was pressed . repeat for second crimp .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the crimp by pressing it opposite to how the crimp was pressed. Repeat for second crimp.

Lines.Text: remove the crimps from the wires by pulling them off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the crimps from the wires by pulling them off.

Lines.Text: untwist the brown and the silver wire by gripping the tip and unwinding them . do the same for the second wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Untwist the brown and the silver wire by gripping the tip and unwinding them. Do the same for the second wire.

Lines.Text: separate the cord and motor .
now , depending on whether the cord or the motor was broken , head to the device page to order a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the cord and motor. Now, depending on whether the cord or the motor was broken, head to the device page to order a new one.

Subject: The Motor and Cord

Title: ARC-914SBD Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: begin by removing the condensation catcher to expose the screw . pinch the condensation catcher from both sides and pull .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by removing the condensation catcher to expose the screw. Pinch the condensation catcher from both sides and pull.

Lines.Text: remove the screw that was behind the condensation catcher using a phillips head screwdriver , size ph2.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw that was behind the condensation catcher using a Phillips head screwdriver, size PH2.

Lines.Text: remove the piece that was held by the screw by pulling out from the top , then pulling up . this will expose the hinges for the lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the piece that was held by the screw by pulling out from the top, then pulling up. This will expose the hinges for the lid.

Lines.Text: to remove the hinges , rotate the bottom of the rod upwards , then push inwards to pull them out . repeat the process for both sides . this will allow the lid to be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the hinges, rotate the bottom of the rod upwards, then push inwards to pull them out. Repeat the process for both sides. This will allow the lid to be removed.

Lines.Text: locate the piece on the black plastic trim that is opposite from where the hinges were . carefully , pry this piece from the bottom to get the tab from behind the stainless steel to in front of the steel as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the piece on the black plastic trim that is opposite from where the hinges were. Carefully, pry this piece from the bottom to get the tab from behind the stainless steel to in front of the steel as shown.

Lines.Text: next , you must remove the upper black trim which is connected to the inside liner with tabs . to do this you must hold the interior walls still , while rotating the trim so that the tabs line up with the slots . ( tabs cannot be seen at this point , pics are to give you an idea of what you cannot see inside the device )

Steps.Text_raw: Next, you must remove the upper black trim which is connected to the inside liner with tabs. To do this you must hold the interior walls still, while rotating the trim so that the tabs line up with the slots. (tabs cannot be seen at this point, pics are to give you an idea of what you cannot see inside the device)

Lines.Text: using a phillips head screwdriver , size ph2 , remove the screws from the control module to expose wired connections .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips head screwdriver, size PH2, remove the screws from the control module to expose wired connections.

Lines.Text: unplug thermostat from control module

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug thermostat from control module

Lines.Text: remove red and blue wires from heating element to fully detach from control module . this is done by removing the screws on the heating element terminals using a phillips head screwdriver , size ph2.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove red and blue wires from heating element to fully detach from control module. This is done by removing the screws on the heating element terminals using a Phillips head screwdriver, size PH2.

Lines.Text: again , using a phillips head screwdriver , size ph2 , remove the three screws holding the heating element assembly to the bowl . this will remove the heating element and the thermostat .

Steps.Text_raw: Again, using a Phillips head screwdriver, size PH2, remove the three screws holding the heating element assembly to the bowl. This will remove the heating element and the thermostat.

Lines.Text: unplug the interface from the control module

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the interface from the control module

Lines.Text: unplug the power from the control module

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the power from the control module

Lines.Text: locate the hidden screw behind the label and then remove it using a phillips head screwdriver , size ph2.

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the hidden screw behind the label and then remove it using a Phillips head screwdriver, size PH2.

Lines.Text: pry the black base from the stainless steel housing while pushing down on black base from inside the device . this step is much easier with two people . one person can pry while the other pushes .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the black base from the stainless steel housing while pushing down on black base from inside the device. This step is much easier with two people. One person can pry while the other pushes.

Lines.Text: using pliers , rotate the power cord clockwise to align it with the hole and simply pull it through .

Steps.Text_raw: Using pliers, rotate the power cord clockwise to align it with the hole and simply pull it through.

Lines.Text: heat each point with the soldering iron while pulling the led out from the front in order to remove the lights . the arrow in the picture points to the + sign above the left solder point . each of the led solder points will have one . led's are polarity sensitive ; therefore , the positive pin on the new led must match up to the positive solder point .

Title: Disassembling Chef's Choice M115 Case

Lines.Text: remove the two rubber feet on the motor side of the device .
remove the five phillips screws from the bottom of the case .
these screws are recessed deep in the device , so a long , thin screwdriver is required .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two rubber feet on the motor side of the device. Remove the five Phillips screws from the bottom of the case. These screws are recessed deep in the device, so a long, thin screwdriver is required.

Lines.Text: remove the two hex-cap screws on the bottom using a pair of pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two hex-cap screws on the bottom using a pair of pliers.

Lines.Text: carefully flip the device right-side-up while grasping the top and bottom pieces .
the white cover should lift off with no resistance . if it does not , ensure all screws were removed in previous step .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully flip the device right-side-up while grasping the top and bottom pieces. The white cover should lift off with no resistance. If it does not, ensure all screws were removed in previous step.

Lines.Text: remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it .
if the sharpener guard does not come off easily , ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it. If the sharpener guard does not come off easily, ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Subject: Case

Title: American Weigh AWS -100 Sensor Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the device over and remove the battery cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device over and remove the battery cover.

Lines.Text: remove the two screws ( length : 7 /16 ) located underneath the battery cover . use a phillip's head number 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two screws (length: 7/16") located underneath the battery cover.  Use a Phillip's head number 1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: once the screws are removed , lift up the metal weighing plate with your hands . at this point in the process , the sensor will still be attached .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are removed, lift up the metal weighing plate with your hands.  At this point in the process, the sensor will still be attached.

Lines.Text: using your hands or a plastic opening tool , peel back the metal plate from the plastic underneath . this will expose the screws connecting the sensor to the plastic .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands or a plastic opening tool, peel back the metal plate from the plastic underneath.  This will expose the screws connecting the sensor to the plastic.

Lines.Text: using the same screwdriver as before , remove the two screws ( length 3 /8 ) on the plastic plate connected the sensor .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the same screwdriver as before, remove the two screws (length 3/8") on the plastic plate connected the sensor.

Lines.Text: with the sensor detached , use a plastic opening tool to peel away the glue holding the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: With the sensor detached, use a plastic opening tool to peel away the glue holding the wires.

Lines.Text: remove the glue on the third side so that the wires are completely disconnected from the sensor . you should now be able to replace the defective sensor with your new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the glue on the third side so that the wires are completely disconnected from the sensor.  You should now be able to replace the defective sensor with your new one.

Subject: Sensor

the white cover should lift off with no resistance . if it does not , ensure all screws were removed in previous step .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully flip the device right-side-up while grasping the top and bottom pieces. The white cover should lift off with no resistance. If it does not, ensure all screws were removed in previous step.

Lines.Text: remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it .
if the sharpener guard does not come off easily , ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it. If the sharpener guard does not come off easily, ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Lines.Text: carefully lift the entire motor assembly out of the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lift the entire motor assembly out of the case.

Lines.Text: using a screwdriver , unclip the edges of the switch by pushing them inwards and nudging the switch out of the plastic casing . you will hear a click when the edges unhook from the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a screw driver, unclip the edges of the switch by pushing them inwards and nudging the switch out of the plastic casing. You will hear a click when the edges unhook from the casing.

Lines.Text: remove the spade connectors from the switch by pulling only on the connector , not the wire .
this may require a fair bit of force . use caution to not damage the device , yourself , or your surroundings .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the spade connectors from the switch by pulling only on the connector, not the wire. This may require a fair bit of force. Use caution to not damage the device, yourself, or your surroundings.

Subject: Power Switch

Title: De'Longhi EC155 Top Panel Replacement

Lines.Text: flip open the top panel to reveal water reservoir .
grab the water reservoir by the handle and lift out .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip open the top panel to reveal water reservoir. Grab the water reservoir by the handle and lift out.

Lines.Text: before flipping the device , removed the black container and grill .
flip the device on its head , front end facing you .
using the phillips 2 unscrew the two 52 mm screws found underneath the top portion of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Before flipping the device, removed the black container and grill. Flip the device on its head, front end facing you. Using the Phillips #2 unscrew the two 52 mm screws found underneath the top portion of the device.

Lines.Text: flip the device back to its proper orientation .
using the phillips 2 screwdriver remove the two 52 mm screws found on the lip next to the reservoir .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device back to its proper orientation. Using the Phillips #2 screwdriver remove the two 52 mm screws found on the lip next to the reservoir.

Lines.Text: insert the two plastic opening tools beneath the top knob .
use the two plastic opening tools as leverage to lift the top knob off .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the two plastic opening tools beneath the top knob. Use the two plastic opening tools as leverage to lift the top knob off.

Lines.Text: grasp the lid firmly with both hands .
pull mightily with both hands away from the device .
if you hear a slight snapping sound , it is supposed to do that .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the lid firmly with both hands. Pull mightily with both hands away from the device. If you hear a slight snapping sound, it is supposed to do that.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to push in the slot on the back panel while lifting .
similarly , reach into where the reservoir used to be and insert a plastic spudger underneath the inside panel .
we recommend to not use your fingers for this step because there is a chance they will be pinched .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to push in the slot on the back panel while lifting. Similarly, reach into where the reservoir used to be and insert a plastic spudger underneath the  inside panel. We recommend to not use your fingers for this step because there is a chance they will be pinched.

Lines.Text: you are now ready to lift the top off .
place one hand near the back , the other at the front , and lift .
you may want to lift the front and back individually by pulling one a little off the part before the other . afterwards , lifting the top off entirely will be easier .

Steps.Text_raw: You are now ready to lift the top off. Place one hand near the back, the other at the front, and lift. You may want to lift the front and back individually by pulling one a little off the part before the other. Afterwards, lifting the top off entirely will be easier.

Subject: Top Panel

Lines.Text: flip open the top panel to reveal water reservoir .
grab the water reservoir by the handle and lift out .

Lines.Text: flip the device on its head .
using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the four 12 mm screws found at each corner of the bottom panel .
lift the panel off or flip the device over and let the panel drop out .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device on its head. Using the Phillips #2 screwdriver, unscrew the four 12 mm screws found at each corner of the bottom panel. Lift the panel off or flip the device over and let the panel drop out.

flip the device on its head , front end facing you .
using the phillips 2 unscrew the two 52 mm screws found underneath the top portion of the device .

using the phillips 2 screwdriver remove the two 52 mm screws found on the lip next to the reservoir .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device back to its proper orientation. Using the Phillips #2 screwdriver remove the two 52 mm screws found on the lip next to the reservoir.

Lines.Text: insert the two plastic opening tools beneath the top knob .
use the two plastic opening tools as leverage to lift the top knob off .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the two plastic opening tools beneath the top knob. Use the two plastic opening tools as leverage to lift the top knob off.

Lines.Text: grasp the lid firmly with both hands .
pull mightily with both hands away from the device .
if you hear a slight snapping sound , it is supposed to do that .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp the lid firmly with both hands. Pull mightily with both hands away from the device. If you hear a slight snapping sound, it is supposed to do that.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to push in the slot on the back panel while lifting .
similarly , reach into where the reservoir used to be and insert a plastic spudger underneath the inside panel .
we recommend to not use your fingers for this step because there is a chance they will be pinched .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to push in the slot on the back panel while lifting. Similarly, reach into where the reservoir used to be and insert a plastic spudger underneath the  inside panel. We recommend to not use your fingers for this step because there is a chance they will be pinched.

Lines.Text: you are now ready to lift the top off .
place one hand near the back , the other at the front , and lift .
you may want to lift the front and back individually by pulling one a little off the part before the other . afterwards , lifting the top off entirely will be easier .

Steps.Text_raw: You are now ready to lift the top off. Place one hand near the back, the other at the front, and lift. You may want to lift the front and back individually by pulling one a little off the part before the other. Afterwards, lifting the top off entirely will be easier.

Lines.Text: twist the frother clockwise while pulling gently .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the frother clockwise while pulling gently.

Lines.Text: remove the four 16 mm screws with a t20 screw head .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 16mm screws with a T20 Screw head.

Lines.Text: remove each clip from the valve and core using the precision angled tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove each clip from the valve and core using the precision angled tweezers.

Lines.Text: pull out each led with one quick tug .
similarly , remove each set of wires from the setting tuner with one quick tug .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out each LED with one quick tug. Similarly, remove each set of wires from the setting tuner with one quick tug.

Lines.Text: flip the device and remove one end of the tube from the reservoir hole .
completely remove the other tube from both the reservoir hole and filter to the water pump .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device and remove one end of the tube from the reservoir hole. Completely remove the other tube from both the reservoir hole and filter to the water pump.

Lines.Text: pull the tube through the chamber with the water pump so it comes out of the top end .
twist the valve counter-clockwise while pulling gently .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the tube through the chamber with the water pump so it comes out of the top end. Twist the valve counter-clockwise while pulling gently.

Lines.Text: tilt the core towards the front while lifting from the back .
if the core is proving difficult to remove , a wire might be caught somewhere , likely near the water pump . we recommend shaking slightly as you lift since the frothing tube is at an odd angle .
we also recommend that you remove the valve before removing the core so that there is less obstructing movement . but the core can be removed without removing the valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the core towards the front while lifting from the back. If the core is proving difficult to remove, a wire might be caught somewhere, likely near the water pump. We recommend shaking slightly as you lift since the frothing tube is at an odd angle. We also recommend that you remove the valve before removing the core so that there is less obstructing movement. But the core can be removed without removing the valve.

Subject: Core

Title: Chef's Choice M115 Sharpening Stones Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the two rubber feet on the motor side of the device .
remove the five phillips screws from the bottom of the case .
these screws are recessed deep in the device , so a long , thin screwdriver is required .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two rubber feet on the motor side of the device. Remove the five Phillips screws from the bottom of the case. These screws are recessed deep in the device, so a long, thin screwdriver is required.

Lines.Text: remove the two hex-cap screws on the bottom using a pair of pliers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two hex-cap screws on the bottom using a pair of pliers.

Lines.Text: carefully flip the device right-side-up while grasping the top and bottom pieces .
the white cover should lift off with no resistance . if it does not , ensure all screws were removed in previous step .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully flip the device right-side-up while grasping the top and bottom pieces. The white cover should lift off with no resistance. If it does not, ensure all screws were removed in previous step.

Lines.Text: remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it .
if the sharpener guard does not come off easily , ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the sharpener guard by gently pulling up on it. If the sharpener guard does not come off easily, ensure all screws were removed in step 1.

Lines.Text: with the outer case removed , firmly grasp the motor-axle attachment and remove it from the base . it should come right off of the assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: With the outer case removed, firmly grasp the motor-axle attachment and remove it from the base.  It should come right off of the assembly.

Lines.Text: use a screwdriver to push the linkage pins out of the rod .
use pliers to pull the pins the rest of the way out .
remove all the linkage pins necessary to slide desired sharpening stone off the end of the shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a screwdriver to push the linkage pins out of the rod. Use pliers to pull the pins the rest of the way out. Remove all the linkage pins necessary to slide desired sharpening stone off the end of the shaft.

Lines.Text: on the rotating apparatus , holding the sharpening stones in place , are two c-clamps that grip the axle .
remove the c-clamps by applying pressure to both sides of the c and pushing the clamp over and off of the axle .
pull the bearing off the shaft . it is in between the two c-clamps .
these clamps are very small ; use caution to avoid dropping them on the ground or losing them .

Steps.Text_raw: On the rotating apparatus, holding the sharpening stones in place, are two C-clamps that grip the axle. Remove the C-clamps by applying pressure to both sides of the "C" and pushing the clamp over and off of the axle. Pull the bearing off the shaft. It is in between the two C-clamps. These clamps are very small; use caution to avoid dropping them on the ground or losing them.

Lines.Text: pull sharpening stones off the end of the shaft .
be sure to remember the order and placement of each individual stone so you can reassemble them in the same order .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull sharpening stones off the end of the shaft. Be sure to remember the order and placement of each individual stone so you can reassemble them in the same order.

Subject: Sharpening Stones

Title: Dyson DC58 Cyclone Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure your vacuum is unplugged .
avoid pressing the red trigger on the vacuum handle ; this will power on the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure your vacuum is unplugged. Avoid pressing the red trigger on the vacuum handle; this will power on the vacuum.

Lines.Text: locate the red lever parallel to the red trigger and on the side of the clear bin .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the red lever parallel to the red trigger and on the side of the clear bin.

Lines.Text: push the red lever downward to open the clear bin . you may need to do this over a trash bin if there is debris in the clear bin .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the red lever downward to open the clear bin. You may need to do this over a trash bin if there is debris in the clear bin.

Lines.Text: push the red lever downward again while pulling the clear bin away from the main body of the dyson vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the red lever downward again while pulling the clear bin away from the main body of the Dyson vacuum.

Lines.Text: flip the vacuum over so that the silver cyclone part of the vacuum is now at the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the vacuum over so that the silver cyclone part of the vacuum is now at the base.

Lines.Text: locate the two visible white clips seen between the main body and the purple cyclone of the vacuum .
use tweezers to pinch the two visible white clips together .
it may require a few tries to pinch the clips since the space between the main body and cyclone is small .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two visible white clips seen between the main body and the purple cyclone of the vacuum. Use tweezers to pinch the two visible white clips together. It may require a few tries to pinch the clips since the space between the main body and cyclone is small.

Lines.Text: tilt and pull the main body away from the purple cyclone of the vacuum .
you may hear a loud snap when the cyclone is released from the main body , this is to be expected .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt and pull the main body away from the purple cyclone of the vacuum. You may hear a loud snap when the cyclone is released from the main body, this is to be expected.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger placed between the black rim and the purple rim to separate the purple screen cover from the cyclone body .
pry all the way around the screen cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the metal spudger placed between the black rim and the purple rim to separate the purple screen cover from the cyclone body. Pry all the way around the screen cover.

Lines.Text: use a t9 screwdriver to remove the five 14 mm screws around the edge of the cyclone body .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 screw driver to remove the five 14mm screws around the edge of the cyclone body.

Lines.Text: pull down on the black tube-like part of the silver cyclone body to remove it from the cyclone of the dyson .
you may need to wiggle the tube as you are pulling down to loosen the pieces apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull down on the black tube-like part of the  silver cyclone body to remove it from the cyclone of the Dyson. You may need to wiggle the tube as you are pulling down to loosen the pieces apart.

Subject: Cyclone

Title: Ozeri Pronto ZK14-S Wire Replacement

Lines.Text: twist the plastic plate slowly to the left to pull it away .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the plastic plate slowly to the left to pull it away.

Lines.Text: pry off the sticker at the bottom where the ozeri logo is to reveal a screw . the sticker does not need to be completely removed for the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry off the sticker at the bottom where the “Ozeri” logo is to reveal a screw. The sticker does not need to be completely removed for the next step.

Lines.Text: using the 2.0 flathead screwdriver , remove the 9.50 mm phillips head screw under the sticker .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 2.0 Flathead screwdriver, remove the 9.50 mm Phillips head screw under the sticker.

Lines.Text: using the 2.0 flathead screwdriver , remove the two 18.76 mm phillips head screws in the plate stand .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 2.0 Flathead screwdriver, remove the two 18.76 mm Phillips head screws in the plate stand.

Lines.Text: using the 2.0 flathead screwdriver , remove the 9.44 mm phillips head screw on the end opposite of the lcd screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 2.0 Flathead screwdriver, remove the 9.44 mm Phillips head screw on the end opposite of the LCD screen.

Lines.Text: turn the device over so the back panel is facing up .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the device over so the back panel is facing up.

Lines.Text: using the plastic opening tool , pry off each of the two rubber stubs on the right side and the two stubs on the left side of bottom of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the plastic opening tool, pry off each of the two rubber stubs on the right side and the two stubs on the left side of bottom of the device.

Lines.Text: using the 2.0 flathead screwdriver , remove of the four 9.46 mm phillips head screws under the removed stubs .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 2.0 Flathead screwdriver, remove of the four 9.46 mm Phillips head screws under the removed stubs.

Lines.Text: pry apart the two panels to separate them from each other .
flip the device over so the lcd is facing up . flip the front panel over on its side .
be careful when separating the panels to avoid damaging the wires they are connected by .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry apart the two panels to separate them from each other. Flip the device over so the LCD is facing up. Flip the front panel over on its side. Be careful when separating the panels to avoid damaging the wires they are connected by.

Lines.Text: using the 2.0 flathead screwdriver , remove the three 7.20 mm screws on the back of the center lcd motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the 2.0 Flathead screwdriver, remove the three 7.20 mm screws on the back of the center LCD motherboard.

Lines.Text: stand the center motherboard up .
be careful when standing up the lcd motherboard to avoid damaging the wires it is connected to .

Steps.Text_raw: Stand the center motherboard up. Be careful when standing up the LCD motherboard to avoid damaging the wires it is connected to.

Lines.Text: desolder the post the damaged wire is attached to on the motherboard .
use caution when handling the soldering iron since it can get very hot .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the post the damaged wire is attached to on the motherboard. Use caution when handling the soldering iron since it can get very hot.

Lines.Text: using the iopener , warm the glue on the weight sensor the other end of the damaged wire is attached to .
use caution when handling the iopener since it can get very hot .
refer to the following guide for detailed instructions on how to use the iopener : ( legacy ) instructions

Steps.Text_raw: Using the iOpener, warm the glue on the weight sensor the other end of the damaged wire is attached to. Use caution when handling the iOpener since it can get very hot. Refer to the following guide for detailed instructions on how to use the iOpener: [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/iOpener+%28Legacy%29+Instructions/38783|iOpener (Legacy) Instructions]

Lines.Text: using the nylon or metal spudger , detach the end of the damaged wire from the weight sensor .
repeat steps 13 and 14 to remove the end of a damaged wire from the other two motherboards .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the nylon or metal spudger, detach the end of the damaged wire from the weight sensor. Repeat steps 13 and 14 to remove the end of a damaged wire from the other two motherboards.

Subject: Wire

Title: How to clean and maintain miele softtronic T8403c

Lines.Text: start with cleaning the filters inside the machine

unlock ( if possible , not all these machines inside filters are removable . . ) and clean out the filters using hot water and vinegar . there are tiny litlle holes in the filter , it is possible you will have to blow theme out with an compressor .

Steps.Text_raw: start with cleaning the filters inside the machine unlock ( if possible , not all these machines inside filters are removable..) and clean out the filters using hot water and vinegar. there are tiny litlle holes in the filter , it is possible you will have to blow theme out with an compressor.

Lines.Text: after cleaning the two small filter and the door filter . we will start to clean the big filter at the bottom of the machine .
you need to use the orange plastic spudger from miele itself . it is hidden at the watercollector .

Steps.Text_raw: after cleaning the two small filter and the door filter. we will start to clean the big filter at the bottom of the machine. you need to use the orange plastic "spudger" from Miele itself. It is hidden at the watercollector.

Lines.Text: remove the white plastic lid using the orange spudger .
when that is open use the second lid .
and eventualy the big steel filter . see the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: remove the white plastic lid using the orange spudger. when that is open use the second lid. and eventualy the big steel "filter". see the next step.

Lines.Text: and eventualy the steel condensator .
to clean this out use the schowerhead and clean the condensator with hot water , let it dry for a day .

Steps.Text_raw: and eventualy the "steel condensator. to clean this out use the schowerhead and clean the condensator with hot water , let it dry for a day.

Lines.Text: turn the machine and remove the big steel plate ( there could be some adhessive , . ) use the torx screwdriver t20

when the machine is getting a little older the black rubber seal dacay over time . . . ( i am not sure this phrase is correct ? ) . a new one costs 98 euro here in belgium . . . rediculous . . . , so be very carefull with older machines ( + 5 years . . )
after cleaning the machine on the back ( 3 times over 5 years ) the machine started leaking water , cause the rubber seal was comming loose .
tip : you can replace the broken rubber seal with silicone ( waterproof silicone )

Steps.Text_raw: turn the machine and remove the big steel plate (there could be some adhessive ,.) use the torx screwdriver t20 when the machine is getting  a little older the black rubber seal dacay over time... ( i am not sure this phrase is correct? ) . A new one costs 98 euro here in Belgium ...rediculous... , so be very carefull with older machines ( + 5 years..) after cleaning the machine on the back ( 3 times over 5 years) the machine started leaking water , cause the rubber seal was comming loose. Tip: you can replace the broken rubber seal with silicone ( waterproof silicone)

Lines.Text: clean out the back of the filterplace . use a wet and drycleaner to do this .

Steps.Text_raw: clean out the back of the filterplace. use a wet and drycleaner to do this.

Lines.Text: at the left side there is a white plate with one t30 torx screw .
remove the plate an loose the white water tube .

Steps.Text_raw: at the left side there is a white plate with one T30 torx screw. remove the plate an loose the white water tube.

Lines.Text: behind the plate you'll see the pump/ventilator .
clean it out with the wet and drycleaner .

Steps.Text_raw: behind the plate you'll see the pump/ventilator. clean it out with the wet and drycleaner.

Lines.Text: remove the end of the waterhose ( use the flathead screwdriver ) . and blow the hose out .

Steps.Text_raw: remove the end of the waterhose( use the flathead screwdriver). and blow the hose out.

Lines.Text: now we will clean out the bottom plate .
remove the plastic shell that is covering torx screws .
remove it using a stanley knife .
remove the screws ( at both sides ) and remove the plastic frame .
you'll see there will be a lot of dirt in the frame . blow ( or vacuum clean ) it . and put it back . also clean out the holes .
the machine is now clean and good to use again . i advise to do these hole guide one a year . clean the normal filters everytime you use the machine . ( just take out the fluff )

Steps.Text_raw: now we will clean out the bottom plate. remove the plastic shell that is covering Torx screws. remove it using a Stanley knife. remove the screws ( at both sides ) and remove the plastic frame. You'll see there will be a lot of dirt in the frame. blow (or vacuum clean) it. and put it back. also clean out the holes. the machine is now clean and good to use again. I advise to do these hole guide one a year. Clean the "normal" filters everytime you use the machine. (just take out the fluff)

Title: Vacuum Cleaner Brush Roll Replacement

Lines.Text: be sure to unplug the device from the wall outlet before disassembling .
remove the bottom head of the vacuum cleaner by pressing the push button .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure to unplug the device from the wall outlet before disassembling. Remove the bottom head of the vacuum cleaner by pressing the push button.

Lines.Text: carefully unscrew the 6 screws with a phillips screwdriver . set aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully unscrew the 6 screws with a  Phillips screwdriver. Set aside.

Lines.Text: separate the top portion of the head from the bottom .
make sure not to pull off or damage the connected wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the top portion of the head from the bottom. Make sure not to pull off or damage the connected wires.

Lines.Text: slip off the belt .

Steps.Text_raw: Slip off the belt.

Lines.Text: pull the brush roll from its slots .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the brush roll from its slots.

Lines.Text: use scissors to cut strings and other debris from the brush roll . avoid cutting the bristles .

Steps.Text_raw: Use scissors to cut strings and other debris from the brush roll. Avoid cutting the bristles.

Lines.Text: return the clean brush roll and re-situate the belt to secure it in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Return the clean brush roll and re-situate  the belt to secure it in place.

Subject: Brush Roll

Title: Replacing the ball bearing in Squeaky Ceiling Fan

Lines.Text: first , unscrew the mounting screw for the plastic cover located along the brim furthest from the centre .

Steps.Text_raw: First, unscrew the mounting screw for the plastic cover located along the brim furthest from the centre.

Lines.Text: the iron cage is firmly secured by another three screw .
out of the six mounting screws located along the inner circle , three of them will be the mounting screw for the iron cage
remaining six screws will be the mounting screw for the fan blade .

Steps.Text_raw: THe iron cage is firmly secured by another three screw. Out of the six mounting screws located along the inner circle, three of them will be the mounting screw for the iron cage Remaining six screws will be the mounting screw for the fan blade.

Lines.Text: unmount the wiring from the terminal block as well as the capacitor from the bracket .
unbolt the 13 mm mounting bolt to remove the supporting rod .

Steps.Text_raw: Unmount the wiring from the terminal block as well as the capacitor from the bracket. Unbolt the 13mm mounting bolt to remove the supporting rod.

Lines.Text: remove the safety cord .
plier will be used to loosen the holder .
the back plate could be removed once all the electric component be removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the safety cord. Plier will be used to loosen the holder. The back plate could be removed once all the electric component be removed.

Lines.Text: be sure to keep the o-ring safe .
the back plate could be removed by knocking it off by positioning it up-side down .

Steps.Text_raw: Be sure to keep the O-ring safe. The back plate could be removed by knocking it off by positioning it up-side down.

Lines.Text: three crawl puller will be used to removed the bearing .
lubricant will be spray prior to the extraction .

Steps.Text_raw: Three crawl puller will be used to removed the bearing. Lubricant will be spray prior to the extraction.

Lines.Text: the another bearing located 4 mm away from the tip required another bearing puller- two crawl puller .
alternatively , it can be knock off using a chisel from behind through the hole .
a long chisel becomes handy !

Steps.Text_raw: The another bearing located 4mm away from the tip required another bearing puller- Two crawl puller. Alternatively, it can be knock off using a chisel from behind through the hole. A long chisel becomes handy !

Lines.Text: three socket will be used to level the rotor core while giving the bearing a final push .

Steps.Text_raw: Three socket will be used to level the rotor core while giving the bearing a final push.

Lines.Text: a three inch pvc tube long of 6 /8 inch inner diameter will be used to install the new bearing ( 6302 z for this model of fan ) .
rubber mallet is used to punch onto the pvc tube during the installation .

Steps.Text_raw: A three inch PVC tube long of 6/8 inch inner diameter will be used to install the new Bearing (6302z for this model of fan). Rubber mallet is used to punch onto the PVC tube during the installation.

Lines.Text: a rubber mallet is used to install the another bearing onto the shaft . rubber mallet or wooden mallet is used to prevent damage to the bearing .
the same pvc tubing will be used to give the bearing a final push .

Steps.Text_raw: A rubber mallet is used to install the another bearing onto the shaft. Rubber mallet or wooden mallet is used to prevent damage to the bearing. The same PVC tubing will be used to give the bearing a final push.

Lines.Text: mechanical grease is apply around the inner wall of the iron cage
be sure to install the o-ring
installation of the fan required electrical knowledge . a certified personnel are required to help installing it back up to the ceiling .

Steps.Text_raw: Mechanical grease is apply around the inner wall of the iron cage BE sure to install the O-ring Installation of the fan required electrical knowledge. A certified personnel are required to help installing it back up to the ceiling.

Subject: Ball Bearing

Title: Keurig K10 MINI PLUS Top Needle Replacement

Lines.Text: press on tab while pulling up on k-cup until you hear a click . repeat for the remaining tabs . we found using the smallest of the plastic opening tools worked wonders .

Steps.Text_raw: Press on tab while pulling up on K-cup until you hear a click. Repeat for the remaining tabs. We found using the smallest of the "plastic opening tools" worked wonders.

Lines.Text: once all of the tabs have been pressed the k-cup should just pop out . after you just pull the remaining of the k-cup . you have successfully removed the k-cup .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all of the tabs have been pressed the K-Cup should just pop out. After you just pull the remaining of the K-Cup.  You have successfully removed the K-Cup.

Lines.Text: remove two 9 mm phillips 1 screws .
avoid the top needle if at all possible . the needle may cut you and or penetrate your skin .
the screws are located on the top of where the k-cup would be .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 9 mm Phillips #1 screws. Avoid the top needle if at all possible. The needle may cut you and or penetrate your skin. The screws are located on the top of where the K-Cup would be.

Lines.Text: once you remove the screws , the top cover should come out .
you will then want to remove these screws which are the same size
the needle is sharp so be careful

Steps.Text_raw: Once you remove the screws, the top cover should come out. You will then want to remove these screws which are the same size The needle is sharp so be careful

Lines.Text: once you get those removed , you are going to want to pull on the hose until it pops off .
once the hose comes off , the needle will fall out by itself .
be careful when picking up the needle as the needle is sharp

Steps.Text_raw: Once you get those removed, you are going to want to pull on the hose until it pops off. Once the hose comes off, the needle will fall out by itself. Be careful when picking up the needle as the needle is sharp

Subject: Top Needle

Title: Ninja Kitchen System Pulse Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: take out the three 15 mm phillips 1 screws .
remove the 15 mm t10 screw .
place the 4 screws on the magnetic mat .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the three 15 mm Phillips #1 screws. Remove the 15mm T10 screw. Place the 4 screws on the magnetic mat.

Lines.Text: remove the gray base by lifting upwards and placing to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the gray base by lifting upwards and placing to the side.

Lines.Text: remove the three 15 mm phillips 1 screws .
place screws on magnetic mat .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three  15 mm Phillips #1 screws. Place screws on magnetic mat.

Lines.Text: remove the motor by gently lifting up . be careful with the cords , as they may be tangled .
this is the entire motor for the ninja . if you have access to a spare motor , simply swap out the motors .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motor by gently lifting up. Be careful with the cords, as they may be tangled. This is the entire motor for the Ninja. If you have access to a spare motor, simply swap out the motors.

Subject: Motor

Title: Shop-Vac MC150A Filter Cage Replacement

Lines.Text: separate the power unit assembly ( the black top ) from the tank assembly ( the red bottom ) .
to open , grab the black clips on the side and pull out to un-hook from the red bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the power unit assembly (the black top) from the tank assembly (the red bottom). To open, grab the black clips on the side and pull out to un-hook from the red bottom.

Lines.Text: remove foam sleeve from filter cage

Steps.Text_raw: Remove foam sleeve from filter cage

Lines.Text: unscrew the 2 h3.5 allen screws attached to the filter cage .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the 2 H3.5 Allen screws attached to the filter cage.

Lines.Text: take out the filer cage , leave the black float , and replace the filter cage .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the filer cage, leave the black float, and replace the filter cage.

Title: Ninja Kitchen System Pulse Fan Replacement

Lines.Text: take out the three 15 mm phillips 1 screws .
remove the 15 mm t10 screw .
place the 4 screws on the magnetic mat .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the three 15 mm Phillips #1 screws. Remove the 15mm T10 screw. Place the 4 screws on the magnetic mat.

Lines.Text: remove the gray base by lifting upwards and placing to the side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the gray base by lifting upwards and placing to the side.

Lines.Text: remove the central 15 mm length screw , you must hold the fan in place and use a flat head screwdriver , twisting counterclockwise .
place this screw on the magnetic mat .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the central 15 mm length screw, you must hold the fan in place and use a flat head screw driver, twisting counterclockwise. Place this screw on the magnetic mat.

be careful as to not damage any wires when removing the fan .
set the fan to the side .

remove the 15 mm t10 screw .
place the 4 screws on the magnetic mat .

Title: iDevices iGrill Speaker Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the plastic cover from the back of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic cover from the back of the device.

Lines.Text: remove the batteries from their positions within the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the batteries from their positions within the device.

Lines.Text: remove five black 10 mm phillips 0 screws from the back side of the device .
remove two silver-colored 5 mm phillips from the left side of the internal cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove five black 10 mm Phillips #0 screws from the back side of the device. Remove two silver-colored 5 mm Phillips from the left side of the internal cover.

Lines.Text: separate the back cover from the main portion of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the back cover from the main portion of the device.

Title: Keurig K40 Handle Replacement

Lines.Text: unscrew one of the 2 mm screws on the handle using a t15 screw head . keep a firm grip on the device so it does not shift out of place .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew one of the 2mm screws on the handle using a T15 screw head. Keep a firm grip on the device so it does not shift out of place.

Lines.Text: flip the keurig over and unscrew the other 2 mm screw using the same screw head . keep a firm grip on the device to prevent it from shifting or falling .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the Keurig over and unscrew the other 2mm screw using the same screw head. Keep a firm grip on the device to prevent it from shifting or falling.

Lines.Text: remove the lever by pulling it away from the keurig .
replace a new handle by putting the keurig back together the same way it was taken apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lever by pulling it away from the Keurig. Replace a new handle by putting the Keurig back together the same way it was taken apart.

Subject: Handle

Title: ArmorAll AA255 Switch Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the orange main housing unit from the vacuum bucket by pulling outward on the handle tabs while lifting upward as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the orange main housing unit from the vacuum bucket by pulling outward on the handle tabs while lifting upward as shown.

Lines.Text: remove the five 15 mm ph2 screws .

Title: BQP2-4.7 Freezer Relay Repair

Lines.Text: the burnt out relay . notice the brown heat marks . this picture is with the insides already removed , so yours will show leads .

Steps.Text_raw: The burnt out relay. Notice the brown heat marks. This picture is with the insides already removed, so yours will show leads.

Lines.Text: pry the bottom off the qp2-4 r7. you may break the tabs on the bottom plate , but that's ok since we don't need the housing . look inside and you'll see the disc held in by a short metal brace . use pliers to remove the brace and remove the disc .
repeat the process for the bqp2-4.7 , but be careful not to damage the housing if you can .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry the bottom off the QP2-4R7. You may break the tabs on the bottom plate, but that's OK since we don't need the housing. Look inside and you'll see the disc held in by a short metal brace. Use pliers to remove the brace and remove the disc. Repeat the process for the BQP2-4.7, but be careful not to damage the housing if you can.

Lines.Text: notice the burnt out component in the red box vs . the shiny new one in the green box .
clean the leads on the bqp2-4.7 of any residue to ensure a good connection to the new thermistor disc .
reassemble the bqp2-4.7 by first inserting the leads , then pushing the disc between the connectors , and finally snapping the cover plate back on .
if you have an ohmmeter , check that you read about 4.7 ohms across the leads at room temperature .

Steps.Text_raw: Notice the burnt out component in the red box vs. the shiny new one in the green box. Clean the leads on the BQP2-4.7 of any residue to ensure a good connection to the new thermistor disc. Reassemble the BQP2-4.7 by first inserting the leads, then pushing the disc between the connectors, and finally snapping the cover plate back on. If you have an ohmmeter, check that you read about 4.7 ohms across the leads at room temperature.

Subject: Freezer Relay

Lines.Text: grab the handle and pull up to remove the top container .
set this piece close by as you will be needing it for a future step .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the handle and pull up to remove the top container. Set this piece close by as you will be needing it for a future step.

Lines.Text: using the crown bolt 8 steel spanner , unscrew the four 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Crown Bolt #8 Steel Spanner, unscrew the four 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline.

Lines.Text: check again to make sure that the coffee maker is not plugged in .
once the screws are removed , carefully pull off the metal piece .
once the piece is removed , you will be able to access the heater .

Steps.Text_raw: Check again to make sure that the coffee maker is not plugged in. Once the screws are removed, carefully pull off the metal piece. Once the piece is removed, you will be able to access the heater.

Lines.Text: this step involves using the top contained that you put aside in step 3.
using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the eight 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .

Steps.Text_raw: This step involves using the top contained that you put aside in step 3. Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the eight 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline.

Lines.Text: once screws are removed , carefully pull out the metal piece from the unit . this is the top part of the heater in the brew staton .
there are rubber washers inside each of the 8 holes on the piece of metal . be careful to not let any fall out when handling the piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Once screws are removed, carefully pull out the metal piece from the unit. This is the top part of the heater in the Brew Staton. There are rubber washers inside each of the 8 holes on the piece of metal. Be careful to not let any fall out when handling the piece.

Subject: Heating Plate

Title: Keurig K40 Open/Close Sensor Replacement

Lines.Text: begin by removing the top cover from the device .
remove the cover by gently rocking it back and forth with an emphasis on lowering the left side underneath an internal peg .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by removing the top cover from the device. Remove the cover by gently rocking it back and forth with an emphasis on lowering the left side underneath an internal peg.

Lines.Text: unscrew both 1.5 mm screws located on the water pump .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both 1.5mm screws located on the water pump.

Lines.Text: keeping one hand firmly placed on the device , tug upwards on the water pump until it is separated from the device .
the water pump and pipe should now be loose and easy to move as shown .

Steps.Text_raw: Keeping one hand firmly placed on the device, tug upwards on the water pump until it is separated from the device. The water pump and pipe should now be loose and easy to move as shown.

Lines.Text: pull on the point where the pipe meets the water pump .
the pipe will come loose and the water filter will be free and ready to be replaced .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull on the point where the pipe meets the water pump. The pipe will come loose and the water filter will be free and ready to be replaced.

Lines.Text: using a 2 phillips head screwdriver remove the 1.2 mm screw holding the sensor in place .
locate where the connections are soldered to the sensor

Steps.Text_raw: Using a #2 Philips head screwdriver remove the 1.2mm screw holding the sensor in place. Locate where the connections are soldered to the sensor

Lines.Text: melt the solder that is connected to the sensor .
be careful to avoid any rubber and try to only contact the metal making the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Melt the solder that is connected to the sensor. Be careful to avoid any rubber and try to only contact the metal making the connection.

Lines.Text: put the replacement sensor back on the post that holds it and begin to solder the two metal connections back to the sensor .
be careful not to touch the end of the soldering iron .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the replacement sensor back on the post that holds it and begin to solder the  two metal connections back to the sensor. Be careful not to touch the end of the soldering iron.

Subject: Open/Closed Sensor

Title: Hamilton Beach 48464 Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: this is what the bottom cover will look like . flip the brew station upside down to easily access the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: This is what the bottom cover will look like. Flip the Brew Station upside down to easily access the screws.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the three 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .
using the crown bolt 8 steel spanner , unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a orange outline .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the three 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline. Using the Crown Bolt #8 Steel Spanner, unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a orange outline.

Lines.Text: carefully slide off the bottom drip tray by sliding it out away from the brew station .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully slide off the bottom drip tray by sliding it out away from the Brew Station.

Lines.Text: gently lift the base away from the brew station .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the base away from the Brew Station.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline . this will release the bracket that is holding down the large piece in the middle .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline. This will release the bracket that is holding down the large piece in the middle.

Lines.Text: using one hand , gently lift the large silver piece out of the base .
the silver piece will still be connected to the brew station , so handy it with care .
using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .

Steps.Text_raw: Using one hand, gently lift the large silver piece out of the base. The silver piece will still be connected to the Brew Station, so handy it with care. Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline.

Lines.Text: once the screw is out , gently lift the white circuit board out of the base . this will be where the power cord begins , so you will now have access to the full length of the cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screw is out, gently lift the white circuit board out of the base. This will be where the power cord begins, so you will now have access to the full length of the cord.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: Hamilton Beach 48464 Tubing Replacement

Lines.Text: carefully open the top lid of the brew station .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully open the top lid of the Brew Station.

Lines.Text: slide out the filter basket that is sitting on top after opening the lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide out the filter basket that is sitting on top after opening the lid.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .
once screws are removed , pull off the little circle piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the two 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline. Once screws are removed, pull off the little circle piece.

Lines.Text: using tweezers , grab the tube that is exposed after you pulled the piece off in step 1 and pull it up and out of the brew station .

Steps.Text_raw: Using tweezers, grab the tube that is exposed after you pulled the piece off in step 1 and pull it up and out of the Brew Station.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the three 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline .
once screws are removed , gently pull off the liner that is on the inside of the lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Philips 2 Screwdriver, unscrew the three 8-mm screws labeled in a red outline. Once screws are removed, gently pull off the liner that is on the inside of the lid.

Lines.Text: after completing step 3 , you will be exposed to a little piece attached to the inside of the lid . pull this piece out , as it is the last piece of tubing used in the brew station .

Steps.Text_raw: After completing Step 3, you will be exposed to a little piece attached to the inside of the lid. Pull this piece out, as it is the last piece of tubing used in the Brew Station.

Subject: Tubing

Title: KitchenAid KHM512ER Beater Rings Replacement

Lines.Text: insert the back of a plastic opening tool into one of the beater holes
apply force to pull the circular plastic part off .
if necessary , use the other side of the plastic opening tool to pry the circular plastic part off .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the back of a plastic opening tool into one of the beater holes Apply force to pull the circular plastic part off. If necessary, use the other side of the plastic opening tool to pry the circular plastic part off.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 2 screwdriver to remove the two 20 mm screws holding the bottom plastic piece in place .
remove the bottom plastic piece using a plastic opening tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #2 screwdriver to remove the two 20mm screws holding the bottom plastic piece in place. Remove the bottom plastic piece using a plastic opening tool.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 2 screwdriver , remove the three 20.0 mm screws holding the motor assembly in place .
use your hands to remove the motor assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips 2 screwdriver, remove the three 20.0mm screws holding the motor assembly in place. Use your hands to remove the motor assembly.

Lines.Text: firmly grip the motor in your hand . using pliers , pull the connectors off the motors .
some force may be required . be careful not to cut yourself on any electrical components .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly grip the motor in your hand. Using pliers, pull the connectors off the motors. Some force may be required. Be careful not to cut yourself on any electrical components.

Lines.Text: lie the motor down flat on a table .
using a pair of tweezers , remove the ring from the plastic knob .

Steps.Text_raw: Lie the motor down flat on a table. Using a pair of tweezers, remove the ring from the plastic knob.

Subject: Beater Rings

Title: Tatung TAC-6G Light Element Replacement

Lines.Text: start with the device standing upright .

Steps.Text_raw: Start with the device standing upright.

Lines.Text: remove the 11 mm phillips screw from below the power component panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 11mm Phillips screw from below the power component panel.

Lines.Text: pull the panel away from the rice cooker .
remove the 9 mm phillips screw from behind the power component dashboard that is connected to the light plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the panel away from the rice cooker. Remove the 9mm Phillips  screw from behind the power component dashboard that is connected to the light plate.

Lines.Text: pull the light plate from the power component panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the light plate from the power component panel.

Lines.Text: flip the rice cooker device upside down .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the rice cooker device upside down.

Lines.Text: remove the one 7 mm phillips screw from the side of the brass panel
lift the brass plate off of the device and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the one 7mm Phillips screw from the side of the brass panel Lift the brass plate off of the device and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the 7 mm phillips screw holding the white and maroon colored wires that are connected to the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 7mm Phillips screw holding the white and maroon colored wires that are connected to the heating element.

Lines.Text: remove the 10 mm phillips screw that connects the white , blue and black wires to the white plastic piece in the corner of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 10mm Phillips screw that connects the white, blue and black wires to the white plastic piece in the corner of the device.

Lines.Text: remove the 7 mm phillips screw that connects two white wires and one red wire to the heating warm switch .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 7mm Phillips screw that connects two white wires and one red wire to the heating "warm" switch.

Lines.Text: using your hand , pull out the light plate with the maroon red and black wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hand, pull out the light plate with the maroon red and black wires.

Lines.Text: replace the light plate dashboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the light plate dashboard.

Subject: Light Element

Title: How to fix a clogged garbage disposal

Lines.Text: press the red reset button either on the front or on the bottom of your garbage disposal .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the red reset button either on the front or on the bottom of your garbage disposal.

Lines.Text: go to your breaker box and look for the breaker for your dishwasher . it may be attached to another appliance . switch it off .
do not continue without disconnecting the power .

Steps.Text_raw: Go to your breaker box and look for the breaker for your dishwasher. It may be attached to another appliance. Switch it off. Do not continue without disconnecting the power.

Lines.Text: unplug the garbage disposal from the outlet underneath the sink .
do not continue without disconnecting the power .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the garbage disposal from the outlet underneath the sink. Do not continue without disconnecting the power.

Lines.Text: disconnect the garbage disposal pipe from the sewer pipe .
there may be excess water in this part of the pipe so place the bucket underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the garbage disposal pipe from the sewer pipe. There may be excess water in this part of the pipe so place the bucket underneath.

Lines.Text: using two screwdrivers , place them in the hooks on the top of the garbage disposal and push against them clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Using two screwdrivers, place them in the hooks on the top of the garbage disposal and push against them clockwise.

Lines.Text: carefully bring down the garbage disposal from where it was connected to the sink .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully bring down the garbage disposal from where it was connected to the sink.

Lines.Text: remove the splashguard at the top of the garbage disposal that you normally see from the top of your sink .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the splashguard at the top of the garbage disposal that you normally see from the top of your sink.

Lines.Text: using a screwdriver dislodge and remove any items clogging the disposal . this will give you an opportunity to manually move the blades around .
never use your hand to move the blades .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a screwdriver dislodge and remove any items clogging the disposal. This will give you an opportunity to manually move the blades around. Never use your hand to move the blades.

Title: Hamilton Beach 70730 Drive Shaft Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the cover by turning it in the counterclockwise direction .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cover by turning it in the counterclockwise direction.

Lines.Text: remove the bowl scraping mechanism by simply grabbing the middle section and lifting .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bowl scraping mechanism by simply grabbing the middle section and lifting.

Lines.Text: remove the blade mechanism by lifting it off of the blade shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the blade mechanism by lifting it off of the blade shaft.

Lines.Text: place hands on bowl and turn it gently , but firmly , counter-clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Place hands on bowl and turn it gently, but firmly, counter-clockwise.

Lines.Text: make sure there is no food or grime along the outside sides of the bowl or the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure there is no food or grime along the outside sides of the bowl or the base.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , remove the four adhesive plastic covers that hide the screws .
these covers are adhered to the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, remove the four adhesive plastic covers that hide the screws. These covers are adhered to the screws.

Lines.Text: remove any access glue that is adhered to the screws with the precision tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove any access glue that is adhered to the screws with the precision tweezers.

Lines.Text: using a jis 1 driver , remove the four 10 mm screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a JIS #1 driver, remove the four 10 mm screws.

Lines.Text: lift the drive shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the drive shaft.

Subject: Drive Shaft

Title: How to Unclog a Keurig BVMC-KG5

Lines.Text: unplug your keurig .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug your Keurig.

Lines.Text: disassemble all of the parts . this includes : water tank , lid , k-cup holder , and both pieces of the tray where the coffee cup sits .
you should not need a screwdriver for this . all of the parts you are disassembling are easily removable by hand .
wash all of the parts in warm , soapy water . dry well .

Steps.Text_raw: Disassemble all of the parts.  This includes: water tank, lid, K-cup holder, and both pieces of the tray where the coffee cup sits. You should not need a screwdriver for this.  All of the parts you are disassembling are easily removable by hand. Wash all of the parts in warm, soapy water.  Dry well.

Lines.Text: unclog the needles using a slightly bent paperclip .
with the top of the keuring open , insert the free end of the paperclip into the three small holes surrounding the needle that pierces the k-cup .
jiggle the paperclip to loosen any debris .

Steps.Text_raw: Unclog the needles using a slightly bent paperclip. With the top of the Keuring open, insert the free end of the paperclip into the three small holes surrounding the needle that pierces the K-Cup. Jiggle the paperclip to loosen any debris.

Lines.Text: wipe the whole machine down and reassemble all of the previously removed parts .

Steps.Text_raw: Wipe the whole machine down and reassemble all of the previously removed parts.

Lines.Text: fill the water tank with a half water-half vinegar solution .
do not use straight vinegar . it can damage the machine's parts due to the acidity .
run the water-vinegar solution through the machine until you have emptied the tank .
run clean water through the machine . you may have to repeat this step several times to get all of the water-vinegar solution out of the pipes .

Steps.Text_raw: Fill the water tank with a half water-half vinegar solution. Do not use straight vinegar.  It can damage the machine's parts due to the acidity. Run the water-vinegar solution through the machine until you have emptied the tank. Run clean water through the machine.  You may have to repeat this step several times to get all of the water-vinegar solution out of the pipes.

Title: Hamilton Beach 64650 Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the handle on its side . remove five 3.8 mm phillips 2 screws shown and set aside them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the handle on its side.  Remove five 3.8 mm Philips #2 screws shown and set aside them aside.

Lines.Text: remove the four 8.6 mm phillips 2 screws securing the motor mount and place them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 8.6 mm Philips #2 screws securing the motor mount and place them aside.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the motor block out of the case .
collect the two spring located on top of the white beater gears . the springs are held in place with compression , and may fall into the case when the motor is moved .
handle the wires with care to ensure you do not break any of them .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the motor block out of the case. Collect the two spring located on top of the white beater gears. The springs are held in place with compression, and may fall into the case when the motor is moved. Handle the wires with care to ensure you do not break any of them.

Lines.Text: desolder the six wires connected to the motor using guide .
make sure to note colors when you disconnect them and remember where to reconnect them later .

Steps.Text_raw: Desolder the six wires connected to the motor using [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|this guide]. Make sure to note colors when you disconnect them and remember where to reconnect them later.

Lines.Text: once disconnected , the motor will slide out easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Once disconnected, the motor will slide out easily.

Subject: Motor

watch out for the quick burst button , it likes to run away .

do not pull on the wires to remove the speed level .

Title: Nutri Ninja BL450 Small Rubber Wheel Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the cup from the blender base .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cup from the blender base.

Lines.Text: turn the blender over and unscrew the three 14 mm screws holding the slotted base in place . these are torx security bits ( tr9 ) on some units .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the blender over and unscrew the three 14 mm screws holding the slotted base in place. These are Torx Security bits (TR9) on some units.

Lines.Text: using a the standard phillips head screwdriver bit , remove the slotted black plastic covering and then unscrew the one 11 mm screw holding the power cord in place .
unscrew the four 14 mm screws that are in the deep slots . this will release the motor from the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a the standard Phillips head screwdriver bit, remove the slotted black plastic covering and then unscrew the one 11mm screw holding the power cord in place. Unscrew the four 14 mm screws that are in the deep slots.  This will release the motor from the base.

Lines.Text: caution : the silver blade attached to the motor is very sharp . use a towel or thick cloth to protect your hands for the next step .
using a towel , hold the silver fan still . twist the small black rubber wheel that is attached to the top of the blender base to the right . this will remove the wheel for replacement .

Steps.Text_raw: CAUTION: the silver blade attached to the motor is very sharp.  Use a towel or thick cloth to protect your hands for the next step. Using a towel, hold the silver fan still.  Twist the small black rubber wheel that is attached to the top of the blender base to the right.  This will remove the wheel for replacement.

Subject: Small Rubber Wheel
