Steps.Text_raw: Both slot levers can be removed.

Lines.Text: place the toaster upside down so the bottom is facing the ceiling .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the toaster upside down so the bottom is facing the ceiling.

Lines.Text: take off both rubber feet using a small metal spudger .
wedge a spudger under the feet and pull up to pop off .

Steps.Text_raw: Take off both rubber feet using a small metal spudger. Wedge a spudger under the feet and pull up to pop off.

Lines.Text: use a ph2 screw bit to remove eight 12 mm screws that are located around the perimeter .
there are two screws under the rubber feet .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a PH#2 screw bit to remove eight 12mm screws that are located around the perimeter. There are two screws under the rubber feet.

Lines.Text: place the toaster right side up .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the toaster right side up.

Lines.Text: grab the outer shell firmly and pull up towards the face of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the outer shell firmly and pull up towards the face of the toaster.

Lines.Text: for this part , you might need to wiggle the toaster to get the outer shell off .
the shell will not completely come off until the motherboard is removed in the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: For this part, you might need to wiggle the toaster to get the outer shell off. The shell will not completely come off until the motherboard is removed in the next step.

Lines.Text: use a j1 screw bit to unscrew eight 8 mm screws from the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a J1 screw bit to unscrew eight 8mm screws from the motherboard.

Lines.Text: take out the grey cancel and bagel buttons from the shell .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the grey “cancel” and “bagel” buttons from the shell.

Lines.Text: once the outer shell is removed , rotate toaster so the back is facing you .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the outer shell is removed, rotate toaster so the back is facing you.

Lines.Text: use flat head tweezers and plastic opening tool to remove the top metal panel by prying the metal tabs upwards so they are able to slide through the openings and pull upwards .
there is a total of 8 tabs , 4 on each side .

Steps.Text_raw: Use flat head tweezers and plastic opening tool to remove the top metal panel by prying the metal tabs upwards so they are able to slide through the openings and pull upwards. There is a total of 8 tabs, 4 on each side.

Lines.Text: once top metal panel is unhooked . lift and let hang off the side of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Once top metal panel is unhooked. Lift and let hang off the side of the toaster.

Lines.Text: turn the toaster so that the faulty wire side is facing you .
position the top 5 metal tabs to fit through slots .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the toaster so that the faulty wire side is facing you. Position the top 5 metal tabs to fit through slots .

Lines.Text: position the 4 side tabs to fit thought the slots .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the 4 side tabs to fit thought the slots.

Lines.Text: pull the metal sheet away from the toaster to expose the heating board .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the metal sheet away from the toaster to expose the heating board.

Lines.Text: position the 4 metals tabs on the heating board . found at the top right and bottom left .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the 4 metals tabs on the heating board. Found at the top right and bottom left.

Lines.Text: at the bottom of the heating board , there are 2 tabs holding it to the rest of the toaster , pull those 2 tabs upwards to release heating board from the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: At the bottom of the heating board, there are 2 tabs holding it to the rest of the toaster, pull those 2 tabs upwards to release heating board from the toaster.

Lines.Text: there should now be 2 wires connected to the heating board that would need to be de-soldered to disconnect .
you can replace the wires on the heating board or if your wires are damaged or disconnect , solder together to fix

Steps.Text_raw: There should now be 2 wires connected to the heating board that would need to be de-soldered to disconnect. You can replace the wires on the heating board or if your wires are damaged or disconnect, solder together to fix

Subject: Heat Coil

pull the housing and filter out slowly .
remove the filter by turn it counterclockwise

Title: Fellowes T7CM On,  Off, Reverse Switch Replacement

Lines.Text: check to make sure the shredder is not plugged in to any electrical outlet .
remove the shredder from the catch basket and place the silver side down on a flat surface .
place the catch basket aside as you will not be needing it for the rest of the disassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Check to make sure the shredder is not plugged in to any electrical outlet. Remove the shredder from the catch basket and place the silver side down on a flat surface. Place the catch basket aside as you will not be needing it for the rest of the disassembly.

Lines.Text: flip the shredder silver side down and place on a flat even surface .
remove the manufacturer's label in order to gain access to the hidden screw hole .

locate all five of the case screws and remove them with a phillips-head screwdriver . the screws are located within the five marked circles in the photo . the size of the screws are 18 mm in length and head diameter of 5 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the shredder silver side down and place on a flat even surface. Remove the manufacturer's label in order to gain access to the hidden screw hole. Locate all five of the case screws and remove them with a Phillips-Head screwdriver. The screws are located within the five marked circles in the photo. The size of the screws are 18 mm in length and head diameter of 5 mm.

Lines.Text: once all of the screws are removed , slowly pull apart the casing .
if the casing is not separating , gently wiggle the top part of the casing from the bottom part of the casing .
'''use caution''' during this procedure to prevent from damaging any of the internal parts .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all of the screws are removed, slowly pull apart the casing. If the casing is not separating, gently wiggle the top part of the casing from the bottom part of the casing. '''Use Caution''' during this procedure to prevent from damaging  any of the internal parts.

Lines.Text: open the casing as shown to prevent tangling or damaging the wires .
take note to how the trigger assembly is attached before removal .
the trigger assembly is one part and should come off all together with little to no force applied .
remove the trigger assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the casing as shown to prevent tangling or damaging the wires. Take note to how the trigger assembly is attached before removal. The trigger assembly is one part and should come off all together with little to no force applied. Remove the trigger assembly.

Lines.Text: unscrew both of the screws from the circuit board of the switch . lift the circuit board away from the device . the screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew both of the screws from the circuit board of the switch . Lift the circuit board away from the device. The screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic switch case .
after the plastic case is removed , the switch can be replaced .
during the switch replacement , be careful of the springs that are held in side . they can potentially come loose and get lost .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic switch case. After the plastic case is removed, the switch can be replaced. During the switch replacement, be careful of the springs that are held in side. They can potentially come loose and get lost.

Subject: On,  Off, Reverse Switch

Title: Fellowes T7CM Trigger Sensor Replacement

place the catch basket aside as you will not be needing it for the rest of the disassembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Check to make sure the shredder is not plugged in to any electrical outlet. Remove the shredder from the catch basket and place the silver side down on a flat surface. Place the catch basket aside as you will not be needing it for the rest of the disassembly.

Lines.Text: flip the shredder silver side down and place on a flat even surface .
remove the manufacturer's label in order to gain access to the hidden screw hole .

locate all five of the case screws and remove them with a phillips-head screwdriver . the screws are located within the five marked circles in the photo . the size of the screws are 18 mm in length and head diameter of 5 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the shredder silver side down and place on a flat even surface. Remove the manufacturer's label in order to gain access to the hidden screw hole. Locate all five of the case screws and remove them with a Phillips-Head screwdriver. The screws are located within the five marked circles in the photo. The size of the screws are 18 mm in length and head diameter of 5 mm.

Lines.Text: once all of the screws are removed , slowly pull apart the casing .
if the casing is not separating , gently wiggle the top part of the casing from the bottom part of the casing .
'''use caution''' during this procedure to prevent from damaging any of the internal parts .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all of the screws are removed, slowly pull apart the casing. If the casing is not separating, gently wiggle the top part of the casing from the bottom part of the casing. '''Use Caution''' during this procedure to prevent from damaging  any of the internal parts.

Lines.Text: open the casing as shown to prevent tangling or damaging the wires .
take note to how the trigger assembly is attached before removal .
the trigger assembly is one part and should come off all together with little to no force applied .
remove the trigger assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the casing as shown to prevent tangling or damaging the wires. Take note to how the trigger assembly is attached before removal. The trigger assembly is one part and should come off all together with little to no force applied. Remove the trigger assembly.

Lines.Text: remove the wire holder . this is a small screwed in piece of plastic which holds the wires in place . the screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wire holder. This is a small screwed in piece of plastic which holds the wires in place. The screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm.

Lines.Text: remove the blade housing from the external case .
remove the three screws from the blade housing . the screw length is 18 mm and the head diameter is 5 mm

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the blade housing from the external case. Remove the three screws from the blade housing. The screw length is 18 mm and the head diameter is 5 mm

Lines.Text: use caution when lifting the blade housing from the casing .
'''warning : '''sharp objects are now exposed .
place the blade housing close to the case to ensure no damage occurs to the connected wires and that they remained attached to the casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Use Caution when lifting the blade housing from the casing. '''Warning: '''Sharp Objects are now exposed. Place the blade housing close to the case to ensure no damage occurs to the connected wires and that they remained attached to the casing.

Lines.Text: locate the main power cord .
clip the wire and strip the remaining end of the wire . twist the new cord together with the remaining old wire .
use electrical tape in order to cover the wire splice .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the main power cord. Clip the wire and strip the remaining end of the wire. Twist the new cord together with the remaining  old wire. Use electrical tape in order to cover the wire splice.

Lines.Text: remove the screws holding the feeding sensor in place . the screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm .
lift and remove the sensor .
replace the faulty sensor with a new sensor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screws holding the feeding sensor in place. The screw length is 10 mm and the head diameter is 6 mm. Lift and remove the sensor. Replace the faulty sensor with a new sensor.

Subject: Trigger Sensor

push the eject button to do so .
put the mixer in mode 5.
gently open the mixer .
the spring might jump loose ! !

remove the cable holder using the phillips screwdriver .
remove the screw holding the mode button .
carefully lift out the electrical unit .

use 2 screwdrivers to apply force on both sides of the locking rings .
lift the gears from encapsulant .

reassemble the mixer .
happy mixing !

if you do not have an ifixit opening tool , a quarter may be used instead .

if you do not have an ifixit opening tool , a quarter may be used instead .

red wire connecting the drive assembly to housing .

red wire connects through the upper portion of the housing .

prepare a cloth and turn the unit upside down making sure it is secure and that it is not being scratched .

secure the base with one hand while removing the last screw as it may fall .
after removing the screws remove the base and place it in a safe place . beware that it may be dirty/oily in the uncovered area . clean as necessary .
the 4 screws that need to be removed

Title: Dyson DC28 Animal Air Muscle Assembly Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the vacuum on its side to allow for easy access to the bottom of the cleaner head .
unlock the sole plate by using quarter or other flat tool to turn the three plastic bolts counter-clockwise , as indicated on the sole plate .
the plastic fasteners can be damaged when using a metal tool to turn them .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the vacuum on its side to allow for easy access to the bottom of the cleaner head. Unlock the sole plate by using [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Coin/IF145-095-1|a quarter] or other flat tool to turn the three plastic bolts counter-clockwise, as indicated on the sole plate. The plastic fasteners can be damaged when using a metal tool to turn them.

Lines.Text: gently pull off the sole plate

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull off the sole plate

Lines.Text: remove the dust collector using the red button located at the top of the bin

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the dust collector using the red button located at the top of the bin

Lines.Text: flip the vacuum over to allow for easy access to bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the vacuum over to allow for easy access to bottom.

Lines.Text: identify the 6 screws .
remove the six 9 mm screws using t15 torx screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Identify the 6 screws. Remove the six 9mm screws using T15 Torx Screwdriver.

Lines.Text: gently remove the drive cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the drive cover.

Lines.Text: remove the drive assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the drive assembly.

Lines.Text: grab the hose by hard plastic base .
pull firmly to remove it from the holder .
if you pull too hard the plastic can be ripped .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the hose by hard plastic base. Pull firmly to remove it from the holder. If you pull too hard the plastic can be ripped.

Lines.Text: firmly grab top section of the hose and remove from the holder .
if you pull too hard the plastic can be ripped .

Lines.Text: remove section of the hose from the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove section of the hose from the vacuum.

Lines.Text: go to the wheel on the right side of the vacuum .
remove the cap of wheel by sliding in a small metal spudger or flat head screwdriver and gently prying up .

Steps.Text_raw: Go to the wheel on the right side of the vacuum. Remove the cap of wheel by sliding in a small metal spudger or flat head screwdriver and gently prying up.

Lines.Text: use the pointed end of a spudger to pull off the e-clip .
the e-clip is hard to remove and may require some effort to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the pointed end of a [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Metal-Spudger/IF145-012-1|metal spudger] to pull off the e-clip. The e-clip is hard to remove and may require some effort to remove.

Lines.Text: pull the wheel off of the axel .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the wheel off of the axel.

Lines.Text: remove the axel piston from axel .
be careful not to lose the washer on the end of the axel piston .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the axel piston from axel. Be careful not to lose the washer on the end of the axel piston.

Lines.Text: use the cutters to cut the zip tie holding the tube on .
be careful not to cut the plastic hose .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Flush-Cutter/IF145-056-2|wire cutters] to cut the zip tie holding the tube on. Be careful not to cut the plastic hose.

Lines.Text: gently pry and pull the tube off of the nub .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pry and pull the tube off of the nub.

Lines.Text: use a flat head screwdriver or metal spudger to push the plastic out of the way and remove the air muscle .
be careful not to break the plastic . bend it just enough to remove the part .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flat head screwdriver or metal spudger to push the plastic out of the way and remove the air muscle. Be careful not to break the plastic. Bend it just enough to remove the part.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the air muscle from the rest of the vacuum.

Title: Saeco Royal Disassembly

Lines.Text: unplug !
remove all attachments like water tank , brewing unit etc .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug! Remove all attachments like water tank, brewing unit etc.

Lines.Text: the coffeebean supply is fixed with two screws . unscrew them and lift it off .
the adjuster of the grinder has to be solved . mark the position or just take a picture . this type is fixed with a screw , others are only sticked together .

Steps.Text_raw: The coffeebean supply is fixed with two screws. Unscrew them and lift it off. The adjuster of the grinder has to be solved. Mark the position or just take a picture. This type is fixed with a screw, others are only sticked together.

Lines.Text: there are two screws to be turned out .

Steps.Text_raw: There are two screws to be turned out.

Lines.Text: the screws are situated on the underneath of the cover . this type is held by four screws .

Steps.Text_raw: The screws are situated on the underneath of the cover. This type is held by four screws.

Lines.Text: now the cover can be raised : first grip on left and reight rear side and lift about 10 cm . sometimes the cover jams a little bit .
solve the hoses which lead to the water tank . sometimes you have to pull out some contacts , ( e . g . the yellow-green protection lead ) , dont forget to put it on later .
the cover can be drawn aslant towards the front , sliding it over the hot water pipe .
most repairs can be done with the cover being laid up partially , it must not be completely removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Now the cover can be raised: first grip on left and reight rear side and lift about 10 cm. Sometimes the cover jams a little bit. Solve the hoses which lead to the water tank. Sometimes you have to pull out some contacts, (e.g. the yellow-green protection lead), don´t forget to put it on later. The cover can be drawn aslant towards the front, sliding it  over the hot water pipe. Most repairs can be done with the cover being laid up partially , it must not be completely removed.

Title: Dyson v6 Absolute Cyclone Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the device.

Lines.Text: push down the red lever located on the outside of the bin , next to the device handle .
avoid pressing the trigger on the handle opposite the red lever , which activates the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down the red lever located on the outside of the bin, next to the device handle. Avoid pressing the trigger on the handle opposite the red lever, which activates the motor.

Lines.Text: push the red lever down a second time to release the bin .
avoid pressing the trigger on the handle opposite the red lever , which activates the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the red lever down a second time to release the bin. Avoid pressing the trigger on the handle opposite the red lever, which activates the motor.

Lines.Text: pull bin away from the cyclone .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull bin away from the cyclone.

Lines.Text: separate the bin from the main body of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the bin from the main body of the device.

Lines.Text: locate two visible white clips between the main body and the cyclone .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate two visible white clips between the main body and the cyclone.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to pinch the white clips together .
widely hold the tweezers apart to get them to reach between the two white clips .
because the space is tight between the cyclone and the main body , pinching the white clips may require additional effort .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to pinch the white clips together. Widely hold the tweezers apart to get them to reach between the two white clips. Because the space is tight between the cyclone and the main body, pinching the white clips may require additional effort.

Lines.Text: tilt and pull the main body away from the cyclone .
there may be a loud snap when the main body separates from the cyclone .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt and pull the main body away from the cyclone. There may be a loud snap when the main body separates from the cyclone.

Lines.Text: use the spudger to remove the cyclone .
start at the small opening beneath the place where the cyclone connects to the main body .
work the spudger around the rim of the red screen filter .
you will hear popping noises .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the spudger to remove the cyclone. Start at the small opening beneath the place where the cyclone connects to the main body. Work the spudger around the rim of the red screen filter. You will hear popping noises.

Lines.Text: use a t9 torx screwdriver to remove five 14 mm screws from the edge of the screen filter body .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T9 Torx screwdriver to remove five 14mm screws from the edge of the screen filter body.

Lines.Text: remove the filter screen cover away from the cyclone .
pull down on the black tube inside the cyclone body to remove it from the cyclone .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the filter screen cover away from the cyclone. Pull down on the black tube inside the cyclone body to remove it from the cyclone.

Subject: Cyclone

Lines.Text: press the red button on the back to release the hose and allow for easy access to the back

Steps.Text_raw: Press the red button on the back to release the hose and allow for easy access to the back

Lines.Text: remove the four 15 mm t-10 black screws now showing in the back of the vacuum hose track , using the phillips 0 screwdriver found in the ifixit tool kit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 15 mm T-10 black screws now showing in the back of the vacuum hose track, using the Phillips 0 screwdriver found in the iFixit tool kit.

Lines.Text: use a pair of needle nosed pliers to press both tabs simultaneously .
hold onto the front hatch while doing this or it will fall off and a spring and lever will fall out with it .
remove the hatch carefully exposing the wiring underneath

Steps.Text_raw: Use a pair of needle nosed pliers to press both tabs simultaneously. Hold onto the front hatch while doing this or it will fall off and a spring and lever will fall out with it. Remove the hatch carefully exposing the wiring underneath

Lines.Text: remove the black wire from its connection near the top of the hatch

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black wire from its connection near the top of the hatch

this exposes the white wire's connection

Steps.Text_raw: Open the black box near the bottom of the hatch area using the two push tabs This exposes the white wire's connection

Lines.Text: disconnect the white wire using the small metal tab .
do not damage the wire during the process .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the white wire using the small metal tab. Do not damage the wire during the process.

to replace the cord , slide the new grey cord into place and connect the two wires again then complete the steps in reverse

Title: Dyson Ball Multi Floor Upright Wheels Replacement

Lines.Text: twist the purple center circle counter clockwise until loose . this will leave the entire grey covering loosened .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist the purple center circle counter clockwise until loose. This will leave the entire grey covering loosened.

Lines.Text: place both hands on the filter itself and twist counterclockwise until loosened .
once loosened , pull up on the entire side filter and it will easily come apart from the main vacuum stand for replacement .

Steps.Text_raw: Place both hands on the filter itself and twist counterclockwise until loosened. Once loosened, pull up on the entire side filter and it will easily come apart from the main vacuum stand for replacement.

Lines.Text: place a pair of small needle-nose pliers in the small gray center of the side hemisphere . twist counterclockwise and pull the small center piece out .
reinsert the small needle nose pliers into the center piece that is now exposed . twist counterclockwise until you can pull the entire hemisphere off .

Steps.Text_raw: Place a pair of small needle-nose pliers in the small gray center of the side hemisphere. Twist counterclockwise and pull the small center piece out. Reinsert the small needle nose pliers into the center piece that is now exposed. Twist counterclockwise until you can pull the entire hemisphere off.

Lines.Text: remove the two 15 mm t-10 black screws on the side of the wheel .
after the 15 mm t-10 black screws are removed , you will be able to remove the half circle that covers the wheel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 15 mm T-10 black screws on the side of the wheel. After the 15 mm T-10 black screws are removed, you will be able to remove the half circle that covers the wheel.

Lines.Text: remove the six 15 mm t-10 black screws on the left side of the vacuum .
once this is done , remove the interior cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 15 mm T-10 black screws on the left side of the vacuum. Once this is done, remove the interior cover.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm t-10 silver screws on the bottom of the ball of the vacuum and the two lower 15 mm t-15 silver screws .
firmly grab the white , three-pronged piece on the left side and pull it off .
push off the right side of the piece by placing your thumbs where the first two 15 mm t-10 black screws originally were .
remove the bottom piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm T-10 silver screws on the bottom of the ball of the vacuum and the two lower 15mm T-15 silver screws. Firmly grab the white, three-pronged piece on the left side and pull it off. Push off the right side of the piece by placing your thumbs where the first two 15 mm T-10  black screws originally were. Remove the bottom piece.

Lines.Text: use the flat headed metal tool to press the tab and release the last part of the outer shell
this tab is difficult to release so some force is necessary
this part of the shell will now release and slide off easily

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat headed metal tool to press the tab and release the last part of the outer shell This tab is difficult to release so some force is necessary This part of the shell will now release and slide off easily

Lines.Text: remove the 15 mm t-10 black screw that is located where the wires enter into the vacuum using a phillips 0 screwdriver .
press into the notches on either side of the vacuum by using your thumbs . do this for both sides of the vacuum .
pull off the protective covering of the circuit board in order to reveal the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 15 mm T-10 black screw that is located where the wires enter into the vacuum using a Phillips 0 screwdriver. Press into the notches on either side of the vacuum by using your thumbs. Do this for both sides of the vacuum. Pull off the protective covering of the circuit board in order to reveal the circuit board.

Lines.Text: pull off the piece that includes the circuit board on it .
unscrew the final 10 mm t-10 black screw on the white circle using a phillips 0 screwdriver .
pull off that side gently using your fingers , then pull off the opposite side as well .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off the piece that includes the circuit board on it. Unscrew the final 10 mm T-10 black screw on the white circle using a Phillips 0 screwdriver. Pull off that side gently using your fingers, then pull off the opposite side as well.

Lines.Text: after the final screw is removed , pull off the wheels on both sides of the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: After the final screw is removed, pull off the wheels on both sides of the vacuum.

Title: STB-101 Miele Turbo Mini TurboBrush Disassembly and Cleaning

Lines.Text: here is a photo of the entire unit fully disassembled . most of the hair we need to get at is inside the ends of the brush axle ( bottom left of photo ) .

i recommend using a medium-large safety pin to dig out the hair/fibres , a pair of scissors to cut the hair off of the brush , and a flat head screwdriver to pry the black plastic end caps off with . you may need a small hammer for reassembly .
there are no screws . most pieces are held together by plastic pressure . be careful not to break any plastic clips or pieces or you will need to buy a new unit .
to prevent having to disassemble this unit often , always take a few minutes to cut any hair/fibre off of the brush after each use .
disassembly and cleaning should take from 30-45 minutes , depending on how much hair is stuck in the unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Here is a photo of the entire unit fully disassembled.  Most of the hair we need to get at is inside the ends of the brush axle (bottom left of photo). I recommend using a medium-large safety pin to dig out the hair/fibres, a pair of scissors to cut the hair off of the brush, and a flat head screw driver to pry the black plastic end caps off with.  You may need a small hammer for reassembly. There are no screws.  Most pieces are held together by plastic pressure.  Be careful not to break any plastic clips or pieces or you will need to buy a new unit. To prevent having to disassemble this unit often, always take a few minutes to cut any hair/fibre off of the brush after each use. Disassembly and cleaning should take from 30-45 minutes, depending on how much hair is stuck in the unit.

Lines.Text: following the instructions in your manual open the unit up . you line up the arrows , push the little plastic button , and slide the rotating cuff up . this should allow the top half of the unit to hinge upwards as shown in this photo .

Steps.Text_raw: Following the instructions in your manual open the unit up.  You line up the arrows, push the little plastic button, and slide the rotating cuff up.  This should allow the top half of the unit to hinge upwards as shown in this photo.

Lines.Text: now we remove the part that makes the unit spin . the fins are pulled by the vacuum suction and rotate the belt that moves the brush . to remove the fin assembly , gently squeeze the little black plastic clips on either side . this does not take much force , do it gently as if you break the clips there is no way to repair them .

Steps.Text_raw: Now we remove the part that makes the unit spin.  The fins are pulled by the vacuum suction and rotate the belt that moves the brush.  To remove the Fin assembly, gently squeeze the little black plastic clips on either side.  This does not take much force, do it gently as if you break the clips there is no way to repair them.

Lines.Text: this is probably the hardest part of the disassembly , certainly the least intuitive . the end caps hold the whole unit together and are just popped in . gently pry them off pulling them by hand , rotating as much as you can , and then using a small flatheaded screwdriver to pry them off . this will take a little pressure and work .

the caps are held on at the centre ( see the middle of caps in the photo ) . this is where you want to focus the pressure when prying . be careful of plastic clips but apply assertive pressure to pop them off .

Steps.Text_raw: This is probably the hardest part of the disassembly, certainly the least intuitive.  The end caps hold the whole unit together and are just popped in.  Gently pry them off pulling them by hand, rotating as much as you can, and then using a small flat-headed screwdriver to pry them off.  This will take a little pressure and work. The caps are held on at the centre (see the middle of caps in the photo).  This is where you want to focus the pressure when prying.  Be careful of plastic clips but apply assertive pressure to pop them off.

Lines.Text: the top half of the unit that hinges upward can be removed by gently bending the plastic edges outward . you should be left with the bottom half and brush assembly as shown in the photo .

Steps.Text_raw: The top half of the unit that hinges upward can be removed by gently bending the plastic edges outward.  You should be left with the bottom half and brush assembly as shown in the photo.

Lines.Text: just like the top half , the bottom half of the unit can be removed by gently bending the plastic fins on either side outward and sliding it off of the brush assembly . you will be left with what is shown in the photo .

Steps.Text_raw: Just like the top half, the bottom half of the unit can be removed by gently bending the plastic fins on either side outward and sliding it off of the brush assembly.  You will be left with what is shown in the photo.

Lines.Text: to remove the brush axle from the brush assembly , pull the little white plastic end cap outward slightly ( see second photo ) . then you can just pull the brush axle out .

Steps.Text_raw: To remove the brush axle from the brush assembly, pull the little white plastic end cap outward slightly (see second photo).  Then you can just pull the brush axle out.

Lines.Text: the unit is now fully disassembled ! clean all the parts . i recommend using a large safety pin . dig all of the hair/fibres out of the ends of the brush axle and white axle caps especially . cut all the hair off of the brush unit using scissors . once everything is clean , use your vacuum to clean all the remaining dust and leftover hair .

Steps.Text_raw: The unit is now fully disassembled!  Clean all the parts.  I recommend using a large safety pin.  Dig all of the hair/fibres out of the ends of the brush axle and white axle caps especially.  Cut all the hair off of the brush unit using scissors.  Once everything is clean, use your vacuum to clean all the remaining dust and leftover hair.

Lines.Text: just follow the steps in reverse .

fit the belt onto the white gear on the brush assembly . with white end cap pulled out , fit the brush axel into the brush assembly , make sure the belt is in the right place and runs freely . push the white end cap closed .

Steps.Text_raw: Just follow the steps in reverse. Fit the belt onto the white gear on the brush assembly.  With white end cap pulled out, fit the brush axel into the brush assembly, make sure the belt is in the right place and runs freely.  Push the white end cap closed.

Lines.Text: attach the bottom half of unit gently over white end caps .
attach the top half of the unit gently over white end caps .
push the black side caps into place . you may have to gently hammer these on so that they pop in . make sure they are in the right place so you don't break off the little plastic tabs inside .

Steps.Text_raw: Attach the bottom half of unit gently over white end caps. Attach the top half of the unit gently over white end caps. Push the black side caps into place.  You may have to gently hammer these on so that they "pop" in.  Make sure they are in the right place so you don't break off the little plastic tabs inside.

Lines.Text: put the belt around the fin unit . make sure the belt can run freely .

gently squeeze the plastic clips to allow them to clip the fin unit into place . note , these clips fit in in a vertical orientation ( longest from top to bottom ) and the middle part of the clip is what holds the unit in place . be gentle and do not break this .
the top hinge should close easily .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the belt around the Fin unit.  make sure the belt can run freely. Gently squeeze the plastic clips to allow them to clip the fin unit into place.  Note, these clips fit in in a "vertical" orientation (longest from top to bottom) and the middle part of the clip is what holds the unit in place.  Be gentle and do not break this. The top hinge should close easily.

Lines.Text: hooray ! your turbo mini is now as good as new ! just like this stock photo !

Steps.Text_raw: Hooray!  Your Turbo Mini is now as good as new!  Just like this stock photo!

Title: Dyson Cinetic Animal Ball Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: press the gray button to release the canister .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the canister by lifting it out.

Lines.Text: find and remove the four 21.5 mm screws on the bottom that hold the base plate on using a t15 torx bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Find and remove the four 21.5mm screws on the bottom that hold the base plate on using a T15 Torx bit.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the 21 mm screws for each wheel on the ball using a t15 torx bit .
remove plastic disc

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the 21mm screws for each wheel on the ball using a T15 Torx bit. Remove Plastic Disc

Lines.Text: locate and remove the five 22 mm screws on each side of the ball that keep the plastic enclosure together using a t15 torx bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the five 22mm screws on each side of the ball that keep the plastic enclosure together using a T15 Torx bit.

Lines.Text: remove the bottom half of the plastic sphere to reveal the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bottom half of the plastic sphere to reveal the motor.

Lines.Text: carefully slide the motor out of its housing in the ball .
cut the two wires near the side of the motor using wire cutters .

Lines.Text: install the new motor by splicing in the wires .
watch this video by njprepper321 on how to splice together wires if you are unsure on how to do this .
make sure to match the wires on the motor with the correct wires in the vacuum .

Title: Hitachi HB-B102 Automatic Home Bakery  II Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure to unplug the device before starting .
remove the lid by opening it to a 45 degree angle and pulling out .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure to unplug the device before starting. Remove the lid by opening it to a 45 degree angle and pulling out.

Lines.Text: next , remove the two 1.3cm screws that hold on the control panel with a 2 phillips head screwdriver . these screws , and the rest of the screws in this guide can all be removed using a 2 phillips head screwdriver .
then pull the control panel out of the device by using a metal spudger to pry it up . flip it over and look at the back of the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Next, remove the two 1.3cm screws that hold on the control panel with a #2 Phillips head screwdriver. These screws, and the rest of the screws in this guide can all be removed using a #2 Phillips head screwdriver. Then pull the control panel out of the device by using a metal spudger to pry it up. Flip it over and look at the back of the motherboard.

Lines.Text: you will then have to disconnect the six wires that connect the motherboard to the device . this can be done by firmly grasping a connector and pulling straight out from the unit . once all of the wires have been disconnected , set aside the control unit .

Steps.Text_raw: You will then have to disconnect the six wires that connect the motherboard to the device. This can be done by firmly grasping a connector and pulling straight out from the unit. Once all of the wires have been disconnected, set aside the control unit.

Lines.Text: remove the five 1cm screws that hold the the casing together . there will be two on each side , and one on the back .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 1cm screws  that hold the the casing together. There will be two on each side, and one on the back.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four 1.4 cm screws surrounding the slot for the bread pan .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four 1.4 cm screws surrounding the slot for the bread pan.

Lines.Text: now you can remove the top part of the assembly off by pulling straight up . don't forget to gently pull your wires through .

Steps.Text_raw: Now you can remove the top part of the assembly off by pulling straight up. Don't forget to gently pull your wires through.

Lines.Text: flip the machine over so that the bottom is facing straight up . then unscrew the four feet on the device with a 2 phillips head screwdriver . the screws will stay in the rubber feet .
next , remove the four 8 mm screws on the four sides of the machine . you do not need to unscrew the screws on the front end corners .
once the feet and screws are undone gently pull the metal plate off .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the machine over so that the bottom is facing straight up. Then unscrew the four feet on the device with a #2 Phillips head screwdriver. The screws will stay in the rubber feet. Next, remove the four 8mm screws on the four sides of the machine. You do not need to unscrew the screws on the front end corners. Once the feet and screws are undone gently pull the metal plate off.

Lines.Text: now that the bottom plate and top housing are off , you can gently pull the inner components out of the outer metal housing . this can be done by grabbing hold of the bread pan casing and slowly lifting the entire inner assembly straight up .
you now have access to the belt and motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the bottom plate and top housing are off, you can gently pull the inner components out of the outer metal housing . This can be done by grabbing hold of the bread pan casing and slowly lifting the entire inner assembly straight up. You now have access to the belt and motor.

Lines.Text: the belt assembly can be found on the bottom of the bread maker .

Steps.Text_raw: The Belt assembly can be found on the bottom of the bread maker.

Lines.Text: begin by pulling the belt off of the large wheel just slightly at the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Begin by pulling the belt off of the large wheel just slightly at the bottom.

Lines.Text: then rotate the large wheel upwards until the belt becomes lose in your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Then rotate the large wheel upwards until the belt becomes lose in your hands.

Lines.Text: now that the belt is free you can discard a loose or damaged belt and replace it with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Now that the belt is free you can discard a loose or damaged belt and replace it with a new one.

Steps.Text_raw: First, open up the home bakery and remove the bread pan.

lift the capacitor and place to the side .

unscrew the three 6 mm screws holding the motor to the metal plate .
gently pull the motor away from the metal plate .

Title: Princess Compact Blender Rubber Gasket Replacement

Lines.Text: lift the glass container of the motor
the motor is the bottom part of the blender
if your blender has recently been used , you may want to clean it before taking it apart

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the glass container of the motor The motor is the bottom part of the blender If your blender has recently been used, you may want to clean it before taking it apart

Lines.Text: unscrew the base from the glass container . the right direction is indicated by the red arrow .
the base is the part whereon the blades are attached

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the base from the glass container. The right direction is indicated by the red arrow. The base is the part whereon the blades are attached

Lines.Text: lift metal blades with the metal hood out of the base
watch out for sharp blades or wear gloves
large rubber ring may fall out of the base , this is no problem , just put it back in place

Steps.Text_raw: Lift metal blades with the metal hood out of the base Watch out for sharp blades or wear gloves Large rubber ring may fall out of the base, this is no problem, just put it back in place

Lines.Text: take the cutting blades in one hand and the black , plastic connector part in the other
this is where you could use the gloves
unscrew the latter together with the screw-nut from the axis by twisting
if necessary , apply a little force to slightly pull it out
'''to unscrew , you have to twist right . the righty tighty , lefty loosy-principle does not apply here'''

Steps.Text_raw: Take the cutting blades in one hand and the black, plastic connector part in the other This is where you could use the gloves Unscrew the latter together with the screw-nut from the axis by twisting If necessary, apply a little force to slightly pull it out '''To unscrew, you have to twist right. The “righty tighty, lefty loosy-principle” does not apply here'''

Lines.Text: gently slide off the hood and lower , small metal protective ring from the axis and dont lose the rubber ring !

Steps.Text_raw: Gently slide off the hood and lower, small metal protective ring from the axis and don’t lose the rubber ring!

Lines.Text: slide the broken ring off the axis
replace the broken ring for a new one

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the broken ring off the axis Replace the broken ring for a new one

Lines.Text: slide the remaining parts back on the axis in the following order :
metal hood
small metal protective ring
black plastic connector
screw back the screw-nut on the thread with the pliers to fasten the assembly
put the blade-assembly back in the base

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the remaining parts back on the axis in the following order: Metal hood Small metal protective ring Black plastic connector Screw back the screw-nut on the thread with the pliers to fasten the assembly Put the blade-assembly back in the base

Lines.Text: twist the base back onto the glass container
put the glass container on the stand ( bottom part of the blender , containing the motor )
start making your smoothie !

refer to this to solder and desolder connections guide to find more information on proper soldering techniques .

Title: Philips Senseo II 7810 Coffee Maker - Capacitor on Printboard replacement
Category: Philips Senseo II 7810 HD coffee maker

Lines.Text: remove the detachable components of the coffee maker :
unplug the product ;
empty the water container and remove it from the coffee machine ;
remove the cup tray and drip tray ;
remove the pod holder and coffee outflow unit .
placing parts in a sink is easiest when disassembling .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the detachable components of the coffee maker: unplug the product; empty the water container and remove it from the coffee machine; remove the cup tray and drip tray; remove the pod holder and coffee outflow unit. Placing parts in a sink is easiest when disassembling.

Lines.Text: remove outflow valve by putting a flathead screwdriver in the gaps and use this as a lever .
pull gently while applying force .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove outflow valve by putting a flathead screwdriver in the gaps and use this as a lever. Pull gently while applying force.

Lines.Text: remove back panel by :
inserting ( flathead ) screwdriver in the top and pressing this against the snap-fit ;
pressing screwdriver on left side against the snap-fit simultaneously ;
rotating back panel whilst pressing against the snap-fits to loosen the panel until it is no longer connected on that side ;
pressing screwdriver on right side against the snap-fit and removing back panel altogether .
expect difficulty with pulling , more hands may be required .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove back panel by: inserting (flathead) screwdriver in the top and pressing this against the snap-fit; pressing screwdriver on left side against the snap-fit simultaneously; rotating back panel whilst pressing against the snap-fits to loosen the panel until it is no longer connected on that side; pressing screwdriver on right side against the snap-fit and removing back panel altogether. Expect difficulty with pulling, more hands may be required.

Lines.Text: remove side clamps to make the boiler accessible by pressing the plastic hooks ( left and right ) to the side .
when used prior to the disassembly , the boiler may still contain hot water !

Steps.Text_raw: Remove side clamps to make the boiler accessible by pressing the plastic hooks (left and right) to the side. When used prior to the disassembly, the boiler may still contain hot water!

Lines.Text: access the inner housing of the coffee maker by :
removing tie wrap from three-way valve with a pair of scissors ;
requires a lot of force .
disconnecting the three-way valve from the hose . beware of possible breaking of the bottom tube of the valve that is inside the boiler opening ;
difficulty with pulling , needs sculling .
tilting the boiler , towards you ( away from the inner casing ) .
when filled with ( hot ) water , beware of boiler leakage .

Steps.Text_raw: Access the inner housing of the coffee maker by: removing tie wrap from three-way valve with a pair of scissors; Requires a lot of force. disconnecting the three-way valve from the hose. Beware of possible breaking of the bottom tube of the valve that is inside the boiler opening; Difficulty with pulling, needs sculling. tilting the boiler, towards you (away from the inner casing). When filled with (hot) water, beware of boiler leakage.

Lines.Text: remove the 2 screws from within the housing , using a torx t10 screwdriver .
tip : use the magnetism of a screwdriver to remove the screws from the housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 2 screws from within the housing, using a Torx T10 screwdriver. Tip: use the magnetism of a screwdriver to remove the screws from the housing.

Lines.Text: tilt the coffee machine and disconnect the bottom housing by pressing a flathead screwdriver against the snap-fit ( caution ) . there is a total of 6 snap-fits . ( two snap-fits at the rear are not visible in the picture )
beware of not applying too much force when pressing snap-fits to avoid bending ( ánd breaking ) during the repair .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the coffee machine and disconnect the bottom housing by pressing a flathead screwdriver against the snap-fit (CAUTION). There is a total of 6 snap-fits. (Two snap-fits at the rear are not visible in the picture) Beware of not applying too much force when pressing snap-fits to avoid bending (ánd breaking) during the repair.

Lines.Text: remove the cylindrical housing from the bottom housing .
remove the cup tray housing from the bottom housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the cylindrical housing from the bottom housing. Remove the cup tray housing from the bottom housing.

Lines.Text: remove the tape from the red pump , by pulling .
leaving the tape attached on the right side , enables re-using of the tape when reassembling .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape from the red pump, by pulling. Leaving the tape attached on the right side, enables re-using of the tape when reassembling.

Lines.Text: disconnect the two cables ( white-brown ) from the red pump by pulling gently . if the cables are hard to remove , carefully use flat nose pliers to pull the cables .
remember the position of the cables for reassembling the senseo machine . marking the location and the cable with a different color marker , can be a solution .
disconnect the red , blue and green/yellow cables from the boiler .
remember the position of the cables for reassembling the senseo machine . marking the location and the cable with a different color marker , can be a solution .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the two cables (white-brown) from the red pump by pulling gently. If the cables are hard to remove, carefully use flat nose pliers to pull the cables. Remember the position of the cables for reassembling the Senseo machine. Marking the location and the cable with a different color marker, can be a solution. Disconnect the red, blue and green/yellow cables from the boiler. Remember the position of the cables for reassembling the Senseo machine. Marking the location and the cable with a different color marker, can be a solution.

Lines.Text: remove the two white cables , so the printboard ( pcb ) is no longer connected to the internal components .
remember the position of the cables for reassembling the senseo machine . marking the location and the cable with a different color marker , can be a solution .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two white cables, so the printboard (PCB) is no longer connected to the internal components. Remember the position of the cables for reassembling the Senseo machine. Marking the location and the cable with a different color marker, can be a solution.

Lines.Text: remove the nut from the plate against the pcb , using a phillips screwdriver .

the order of loosening the snapfits now is important . first carefully press out ( in an upward direction ) four click fingers ( from plastic buttons ) that hold the plate in place , and then push out four pins in the pcb ( holes marked with black arrows ) , which loosens the buttons . beware of not affecting the transistor integrity when removing the plate .
remove the snap-fits of the pcb , so the plate and the pcb can be disconnected . use a flathead screwdriver for punching and sculling .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nut from the plate against the PCB, using a Phillips screwdriver. The order of loosening the snapfits now is important. First carefully press out (in an upward direction) four click fingers (from plastic buttons) that hold the plate in place, and then push out four pins in the PCB (holes marked with black arrows), which loosens the buttons. Beware of not affecting the transistor integrity when removing the plate. Remove the snap-fits of the PCB, so the plate and the PCB can be disconnected. Use a flathead screwdriver for punching and sculling.

Lines.Text: obvious characteristics of a damaged capacitor are leakage of a brownish fluid , corrosion , or severed leads . non-obvious signs could be measured with a capacity gauge ( for the professional handyman ) .
search for the pegs of the capacitor on the pcb and warm up the soldering iron . remember orientation ( left-right ) !
the capacitor specification should be : 470nf , min . 275 vac , 22.5 mm pitch . only use x2-class qualification which can be distinguished on the part . capacitors come in blue and yellow colors .
caution : the soldering iron will be hot . perform this action in a well-ventilated area .

Steps.Text_raw: Obvious characteristics of a damaged capacitor are leakage of a brownish fluid, corrosion, or severed leads. Non-obvious signs could be measured with a capacity gauge (for the professional handyman). Search for the pegs of the capacitor on the PCB and warm up the soldering iron. Remember orientation (left-right)! The capacitor specification should be: 470nF, min. 275 VAC, 22.5 mm pitch. Only use X2-Class qualification which can be distinguished on the part. Capacitors come in blue and yellow colors. Caution: the soldering iron will be hot. Perform this action in a well-ventilated area.

Lines.Text: loosen the capacitor of the pcb , by desoldering the tin spots using the iron and remove the capacitor from the pcb .
caution : the soldering iron will be hot . do not breath the soldering fumes . they are toxic . perform this action in a well-ventilated area .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen the capacitor of the PCB, by desoldering the tin spots using the iron and remove the capacitor from the PCB. Caution: the soldering iron will be hot. Do not breath the soldering fumes. They are toxic. Perform this action in a well-ventilated area.

Lines.Text: replace the capacitor by soldering a new capacitor of the same type on the exact same spot :
scratch the green plastic of the printboard ( with flathead screwdriver ) to improve conductivity and cohesion ;
keep the capacitor on the right spot , hold the tin against the pegs of the capacitor and heat the tin with the soldering iron . the tin will cool down and the capacitor will be fixed .
caution ; the soldering iron will be hot . do not breath the soldering fumes . they are toxic . perform this action in a well-ventilated area .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the capacitor by soldering a new capacitor of the same type on the exact same spot: scratch the green plastic of the printboard (with flathead screwdriver) to improve conductivity and cohesion; keep the capacitor on the right spot, hold the tin against the pegs of the capacitor and heat the tin with the soldering iron. The tin will cool down and the capacitor will be fixed. Caution; the soldering iron will be hot. Do not breath the soldering fumes. They are toxic. Perform this action in a well-ventilated area.

Lines.Text: reassemble the senseo coffee maker . the suggested actions during the disassembly should now help you greatly . be careful with connecting wires ( in the right way ) , tilting and reconnecting the boiler , and closing the housings and snap-fits .
tip : by following the previous 15 steps in reverse order , reassembly should take 15 minutes .

Steps.Text_raw: Reassemble the Senseo coffee maker. The suggested actions during the disassembly should now help you greatly. Be careful with connecting wires (in the right way), tilting and reconnecting the boiler, and closing the housings and snap-fits. Tip: by following the previous 15 steps in reverse order, reassembly should take 15 minutes.

Subject: Replacing the capacitor on printboard

Title: Kenmore Elite HE3 Washing Machine central control unit Replacement

Lines.Text: my 13 year old kenmore he3 washer failed to power on the other day . no error codes , no lights . i checked to be sure the breaker had not tripped and that the outlet actually had power . everything was ok , except the washer simply did not get any power .

Steps.Text_raw: My 13 year old Kenmore HE3 washer failed to power on the other day. No error codes, no lights. I checked to be sure the breaker had not tripped and that the outlet actually had power. Everything was OK, except the washer simply did not get any power.

Lines.Text: i had downloaded both the owner's manual and the service manual for this washer , so i looked thru them for a solution . the only thing i found was the recommendation in the troubleshooting section of the service manual that it was likely the ccu failing .

Steps.Text_raw: I had downloaded both the Owner's Manual and the Service Manual for this washer, so I looked thru them for a solution. The only thing I found was the recommendation in the Troubleshooting section of the Service Manual that it was likely the CCU failing.

Lines.Text: the manual suggests testing by unplugging the washer from power , waiting a few minutes then plugging it back into power . if you do not hear an audible click noise , replace the ccu . i did this and did not hear anything . we need a new central control unit .

Steps.Text_raw: The Manual suggests testing by unplugging the washer from power, waiting a few minutes & then plugging it back into power. If you do NOT hear an audible CLICK noise, replace the CCU.  I did this and did NOT hear anything. We need a new central control unit.

Lines.Text: before beginning any disassembly , be sure to unplug the washer from the power outlet . safety first !

Steps.Text_raw: Before beginning any disassembly, be sure to UNPLUG the washer from the power outlet. SAFETY FIRST!

Lines.Text: the central control unit ( ccu ) is located under the top panel of the washer , mounted to the rear frame support . to remove the top panel , use the torx bit and driver to remove the three screws on the top back edge of the top panel . do not lose these . a good idea is to put them in a zip lock bag and tape them to the front of the washer .

Steps.Text_raw: The central control unit (CCU) is located under the top panel of the washer, mounted to the rear frame support. To remove the top panel, use the Torx bit and driver to remove the three screws on the top back edge of the top panel. Do not lose these. A good idea is to put them in a zip lock bag and tape them to the front of the washer.

Lines.Text: to complete the top panel removal , slide the panel back about an inch lift the rear edge of the panel . the panel should come off easily . set it aside out of the way .
to make this easier and to be ready for the re-assembly , go ahead and close the washer door .

Steps.Text_raw: To complete the top panel removal, slide the panel back about an inch & lift the rear edge of the panel. The panel should come off easily. Set it aside out of the way. To make this easier and to be ready for the re-assembly, go ahead and CLOSE the washer door.

Lines.Text: the ccu looks like the picture here . now is the time to take pictures of the front side and left side of the ccu to assist in the proper re-assembly after swapping in the replacement part .
carefully remove the plugs from their respective connections . carefully remove the cables from the ccu cable guides , noting their locations for the re-assembly .

Steps.Text_raw: The CCU looks like the picture here. Now is the time to take pictures of the front side and left side of the CCU to assist in the proper re-assembly after swapping in the replacement part. Carefully remove the plugs from their respective connections. Carefully remove the cables from the CCU cable guides, noting their locations for the re-assembly.

Lines.Text: there are three plastic tabs securing the ccu to the rear frame . use a flat blade screwdriver to carefully lift the edges of the tabs so the ccu can be slowly moved towards the front of the washer .
remove the old ccu .

Steps.Text_raw: There are three plastic tabs securing the CCU to the rear frame. Use a flat blade screw driver to CAREFULLY lift the edges of the tabs so the CCU can be slowly moved towards the front of the washer. Remove the old CCU.

Lines.Text: order a replacement ccu . there are a number of sources you can use . we purchased from a reputable appliance parts source in town which we have used for stove parts in the past . be sure to provide the model and serial number of the washer so you get the right part .
once your replacement part arrives , compare it to the old part to be sure you have the correct part !

Steps.Text_raw: Order a replacement CCU. There are a number of sources you can use. We purchased from a reputable appliance parts source in town which we have used for stove parts in the past. Be sure to provide the model and serial number of the washer so you get the right part. Once your replacement part arrives, compare it to the old part to be sure you have the correct part!

Lines.Text: follow the steps in reverse to install the replacement part . i attached the ccu to the frame before re-connecting the plugs sliding the cables into the guides .
be careful plugging things in . these connections are not robust . you do not want to break anything .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the steps in reverse to install the replacement part. I attached the CCU to the frame before re-connecting the plugs & sliding the cables into the guides. Be careful plugging things in. These connections are not robust. You do not want to break anything.

Lines.Text: put the top panel on the washer and slide it into position . locate your screws for the top panel re-install them using the torx bit and driver .
be sure the door to the washer is closed before re-connecting the washer to power .
connect the power for the washer . you should her a click from the washer . you are ready to test .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the top panel on the washer and slide it into position. Locate your screws for the top panel & re-install them using the Torx bit and driver. Be sure the door to the washer is CLOSED before re-connecting the washer to power. Connect the power for the washer. You should her a CLICK from the washer. You are ready to test.

Lines.Text: lights . . . camera . . . action ! we have lights on the washer !
i ran a short cycle , water only , to test . it ran perfectly .

Steps.Text_raw: LIGHTS... CAMERA... ACTION! We have lights on the washer! I ran a short cycle, water only, to test. It ran perfectly.

Subject: central control unit

be sure not to lose the screws .

with the replacement motor , you can now begin reassembly .

using the wire stripper crimping tool strip the ends of each of the white wires and insert them into the opposite ends of a parallel connector , then crimp firmly .

Steps.Text_raw: Cut all four red wires using the wire stripper crimping tool. Using the wire stripper crimping tool strip the ends of each red  wire and insert them into a new wiring connector cap, then crimp firmly. Cut the white wire using the stripper crimping tool. Using the wire stripper crimping tool strip the ends of each of the white wires and insert them into the opposite ends of a parallel connector, then crimp firmly.

Title: Braun M1000 gearbox Replacement

Lines.Text: put the mixer in a vise as shown in picture and gently press it . you can use plastic vise jaws to avoid scratching the case .

Steps.Text_raw: Put the mixer in a vise as shown in picture and gently press it. You can use plastic vise jaws to avoid scratching the case. Increase the vise pressure and pull the handle until it pops out. It is important to apply the correct pressure to release the plastic hooks.

Lines.Text: pull the central gear to remove it from the crankshaft . in the picture you can see the crack in the gear that was causing excess noise .
replace the gears with the spare parts . the central gear needs to be inserted with some force on the crankshaft . a small hammer can be used to get the central gear in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the central gear to remove it from the crankshaft. In the picture you can see the crack in the gear that was causing excess noise. Replace the gears with the spare parts. The central gear needs to be inserted with some force on the crankshaft. A small hammer can be used to get the central gear in place.

push the plastic enclosure back in place . press gently until it clicks in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device upside down.

Lines.Text: use the screwdriver to take off the four ( 4 ) 10 mm screws located near the brush which secure the plastic guard .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the screwdriver to take off the four (4) 10mm screws located near the brush which secure the plastic guard.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic brush guard .
pull off the plastic covering the brush .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic brush guard. Pull off the plastic covering the brush.

Lines.Text: lift the brush to clean or replace .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brush to clean or replace.

Lines.Text: flip device upside down .
locate the six ( 6 ) screw connected to the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip device upside down. Locate the six (6) screw connected to the top cover.

Lines.Text: remove eight ( 8 ) star screws using the t10 bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove eight (8) star screws using the T10 bit.

Lines.Text: pull off one side of the brush front cover , and then pull off the other .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off one side of the brush front cover, and then pull off the other.

Lines.Text: flip right side up and turn around .
find the two clips connecting the top cover to the body of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip right side up and turn around. FInd the two clips connecting the top cover to the body of the device.

Lines.Text: lift up on the top cover gently .
disconnect the connector from the motherboard to detach the top cover from the robot .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on the top cover gently. Disconnect the connector from  the motherboard to detach the top cover from the robot.

Lines.Text: remove four ( 4 ) 10 mm 'star' screws using the t10 bit from the base plate where the rotating infrared sensor is located .
carefully place the sensor on or near the robot without pulling the wires out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove four (4) 10mm  'star' screws using the T10 bit from the base plate where the rotating infrared sensor is located. Carefully place the sensor on or near the robot without pulling the wires out.

Lines.Text: remove two ( 2 ) screws using the t10 bit that connects the plastic protector over the wheel motor .
pull up on the metal weight to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two (2) screws using the T10 bit that connects the plastic protector over the wheel motor. Pull up on the metal weight to remove.

Lines.Text: flip the botvac over being careful not to drop the ir sensor or cause damage to the wires .
using a flat-head screwdriver and a cloth for protection , press on the clips until they recede into the botvac .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the botvac over being careful not to drop the IR sensor or cause damage to the wires. Using a flat-head screw driver and a cloth for protection, press on the clips until they recede into the botvac.

Lines.Text: flip the robot back over ( right-side up ) .
carefully remove the plastic cover that protects the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the robot back over(right-side up). Carefully remove the plastic cover that protects the motor.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the motor that you wish to replace .
trace the wires that are connected to the motor back to the motherboard .
disconnect the connector from the motherboard for the respective motor you're replacing .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the motor that you wish to replace. Trace the wires that are connected to the motor back to the motherboard. Disconnect the connector from the motherboard for the respective motor you're replacing.

the battery cover is located in the center of the device in between both wheels .

Lines.Text: using a flathead 4 screwdriver , gently turn the 12 mm screw that holds the battery cover in .
the screw does not remove , it stays attached to the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Flathead #4 screwdriver, gently turn the 12mm screw that holds the battery cover in. The screw does not remove, it stays attached to the cover.

Lines.Text: gently remove the battery from the tray and disconnect the battery cable .
to remove the battery , pull it straight up . to disconnect the cable , gently pull it straight out of the connector .
to reinstall the cable , hold it near the end and gently push it in the connector .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove the battery from the  tray and disconnect the battery  cable. To remove the battery, pull it straight up. To disconnect the cable, gently pull it straight out of the connector. To reinstall the cable, hold it near the end and gently push it in the connector.

Lines.Text: with the battery removed , rotate your device so the front of it is facing you .
remove the four 10 mm phillips 2 screws that attach the shell .

Steps.Text_raw: With the battery removed, rotate your device so the front of it is facing you. Remove the four 10mm Phillips #2 screws that attach the shell.

Lines.Text: using both hands , hold the device together while you flip it over .
starting from the front , gently lift up the shell and slowly tilt back until it is fully removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Using both hands, hold the device together while you flip it over. Starting from the front, gently lift up the shell and slowly tilt back until it is  fully removed.

Lines.Text: with the shell off , flip the irobot over and remove the four 10 mm phillips 0 screws holding the deck plate assembly on .

Lines.Text: remove the two 12 mm phillips 0 screws that hold the two springs onto the deck plate assembly .
remove the two springs by gently lifting them up .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 12mm Phillips #0 screws that hold the two springs onto the deck plate assembly. Remove the two springs by gently lifting them up.

Lines.Text: flip the device over and remove the deck plate assembly cover by lifting it up .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the device over and remove the deck plate assembly cover by lifting it up.

Lines.Text: pull the arms together by lifting them up and to the center .
with the arms together . slide the deck plate up and over the arms until it is fully removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the arms together by lifting them up and to the center. With the arms together. slide the deck plate up and over the arms until it is fully removed.

remove the carriage lever by pulling it away from the toaster .

turn the toaster upside down .
unscrew all four 4 mm screws on the bottom using a phillip's head 2 ( ph2 ) screwdriver .

support the bottom . the ribbon cable that connects the toaster to the front cover can be damaged .
lift the front cover .
lift carefully . again the ribbon cable can be damaged .

Lines.Text: pull the outer cover away from the front of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the outer cover away from the front of the device.

Lines.Text: remove the two 18.2 mm screws from the bottom of the front cover using a 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 18.2 mm screws  from the bottom of the front cover using a [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Phillips-1-Screwdriver/IF145-021-2|Phillips #1 screwdriver].

Lines.Text: firmly pull the front cover off .
this piece is difficult to remove and requires force . it may help to use a wide , thin object to pry it off ( like a

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the front cover off. This piece is difficult to remove and requires force. It may help to use a wide, thin object to pry it off (like a [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Jimmy/IF145-259-1|Jimmy|new_window=true]).

Lines.Text: remove the 9.1 mm screw from the microchip .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 9.1 mm screw from the microchip.

Lines.Text: wedge the plastic spudger between the microchip and the glue dot until the glue pops off .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the plastic spudger between the microchip and the glue dot until the glue pops off.

Lines.Text: use the spudger to lift the edge of the wire and pull the wire out of the microchip .
use an esd tool such as a spudger when working with potentially dangerous electronics .
while reconnecting the wires , you will need a hot glue gun to reattach the wire ends to the new chip .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the spudger to lift the edge of the wire and pull the wire out of the microchip. Use an ESD tool such as a [https://www.ifixit.com/Store/Tools/Spudger/IF145-002-2|nylon spudger] when working with potentially dangerous electronics. While reconnecting the wires, you will need a hot glue gun to reattach the wire ends to the new chip.
