Lines.Text: flip the vacuum over so that the underside of the device is facing upward .
use a 3.0 hex bit screwdriver to remove the two 20 mm screws on the bottom of the motor cover .
the two screw holes will only be accessible if the handle release pedal is still released and the motor cover is rotated downward .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the vacuum over so that the underside of the device is facing upward. Use a 3.0 Hex bit screwdriver to remove the two 20mm screws on the bottom of the motor cover. The two screw holes will only be accessible if the handle release pedal is still released and the motor cover is rotated downward.

Lines.Text: flip the vacuum so that it is right side up again with the front of the motor cover facing you .
insert either a metal spudger or a plastic opening tool into the right or left side of the cover seam .
pry upward as you move the tool across the cover , separating the top half of the motor cover from the lower half .
there will be some audible popping noises from separating the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the vacuum so that it is right side up again  with the front of the motor cover facing you. Insert either a metal spudger or a plastic opening tool into the right or left side of the cover seam. Pry upward as you move the tool across the cover, separating the top half of the motor cover from the lower half. There will be some audible popping noises from separating the cover.

Lines.Text: grip the exhaust valve at the top of the motor cover .
lift up on the left side of the exhaust valve and then pull the right side upward to pry apart the motor cover .
there will be some audible popping noises from separating the cover .
separating the cover takes a firm pull . you may need someone to assist you in pulling the cover apart .

when you remove the cover , make sure to keep the cover close to the motor . there is a short wire that connects the top of the cover to the motor . the wire can be damaged if the cover is separated too far .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the exhaust valve at the top of the motor cover. Lift up on the left side of the exhaust valve and then pull the right side upward to pry apart the motor cover. There will be some audible popping noises from separating the cover. Separating the cover takes a firm pull. You may need someone to assist you in pulling the cover apart. When you remove the cover, make sure to keep the cover close to the motor. There is a short wire that connects the top of the cover to the motor. The wire can be damaged if the cover is separated too far.

Lines.Text: make sure the vacuum is unplugged before touching any internal components .
grip the white cable that connects the power switch to the motor . get as close as possible to the motor connection .
pull firmly to separate the cable from the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vacuum is unplugged before touching any internal components. Grip the white cable that connects the power switch to the motor. Get as close as possible to the motor connection. Pull firmly to separate the cable from the motor.

Lines.Text: there is a black wire that connects the cover to the motor . be careful to keep this wire connected and undamaged while removing the motor .
lift up on the left side of the motor .
move the motor to the left , sliding the motor shaft out of its circular casing .
separate the motor completely from the vacuum's base .

Steps.Text_raw: There is a black wire that connects the cover to the motor. Be careful to keep this wire connected and undamaged while removing the motor. Lift up on the left side of the motor. Move the motor to the left, sliding the motor shaft out of its circular casing. Separate the motor completely from the vacuum's base.

Lines.Text: make sure the device is unplugged before touching any internal components .
grip the black wire that connects the thermal fuse to the motor . get as close as possible to the motor connection .
firmly pull the wire to separate it from the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the device is unplugged before touching any internal components. Grip the black wire that connects the thermal fuse to the motor. Get as close as possible to the motor connection. Firmly pull the wire to separate it from the motor.

Lines.Text: follow the black thermal fuse wire back to its connection point with the motor cover .
grip the black wire at the connection point between the thermal fuse and the motor cover .
firmly pull the wire away from the motor cover to remove the thermal fuse .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the black thermal fuse wire back to its connection point with the motor cover. Grip the black wire at the connection point between the thermal fuse and the motor cover. Firmly pull the wire away from the motor cover to remove the thermal fuse.

Subject: Thermal Fuse

Title: Ninja Mega Kitchen System BL770 Circuit Base Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the five screws ( 13 mm long , 6 mm head ) attaching the base cover using a phillips screwdriver ( ph2 ) .
remove the two screws ( 13 mm long , 6 mm head ) attaching the base cover using a t10 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five screws (13mm long, 6mm head) attaching the Base Cover using a Phillips screwdriver (Ph2). Remove the two screws (13 mm long, 6mm head) attaching the Base Cover using a T10 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: carefully remove the second layer from the base . you will not need a screwdriver for this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully remove the second layer from the base. You will not need a screwdriver for this step.

Lines.Text: remove the 2 screws ( 13 mm , 6 mm head ) connected to the plastic piece holding down the power cord .
then remove the additional 4 screws ( 13 mm , 6 mm head ) and 2 screws ( 11 mm , 5 mm head ) securing the base .
carefully lift the base up from the rest of the blender .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 2 screws (13mm, 6mm head) connected to the plastic piece holding down the power cord. Then remove the additional 4 screws (13mm, 6mm head) and 2 screws (11mm, 5mm head) securing the base. Carefully lift the base up from the rest of the blender.

Lines.Text: remove 4 screws ( 11 mm , 4 mm head ) connecting the circuit board to the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove 4 screws (11mm, 4mm head) connecting the circuit board to the base.

Subject: Circuit Base

Title: Ninja Ultima BL810 Power Plug Replacement

Lines.Text: unscrew the phillips 0 11 mm screws .
unscrew the torx security 10 11 mm screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the  Phillips #0 11mm screws. Unscrew the Torx Security #10 11mm screw.

Lines.Text: unscrew the six phillips 2 11 mm screws from the remainder of the bottom plate .
pull the bottom covering off of the blender .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the six Phillips #2 11mm screws from the remainder of the bottom plate. Pull the bottom covering off of the blender.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two phillips 2 9 mm screws .
remove the plastic block .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two Phillips #2 9mm screws. Remove the plastic block.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four phillips 2 11 mm screws .
remove the plastic covers .
removing the top cover and then rotating the bottom cover into the same orientation works best .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four Phillips #2 11mm screws. Remove the plastic covers. Removing the top cover and then rotating the bottom cover into the same orientation works best.

Lines.Text: unscrew the three phillips 2 9 mm screws .
this metal plate doesn't need to be completely removed , just adjusted to the side to continue working .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the three Phillips #2 9mm screws. This metal plate doesn't need to be completely removed, just adjusted to the side to continue working.

Lines.Text: unscrew the four phillips 2 11 mm screws .
pull the power cord through as shown to create slack .
remove plastic casing by lifting upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the four Phillips #2 11mm screws. Pull the power cord through as shown to create slack. Remove plastic casing by lifting upwards.

Lines.Text: follow the power plug cords to find the right plastic caps .
squeeze the caps with pliers to loosen the grip .
pull the plastic caps off the twisted wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Follow the power plug cords to find the right plastic caps. Squeeze the caps with pliers to loosen the grip. Pull the plastic caps off the twisted wires.

Lines.Text: untwist the two wires from each other and pull the zip tie off .

Steps.Text_raw: Untwist the two wires from each other and  pull the zip tie off.

Subject: Power Plug

Title: Shark Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe NV360 Roller Brush Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the vacuum down by hand and locate the roller brush underneath the vacuum cleaner .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the vacuum down by hand and locate the roller brush underneath the vacuum cleaner.

Lines.Text: insert the metal spudger between the inside side of the wheel and the plastic body .
push the metal spudger away from you to pop the wheels out .
repeat the step to remove the other wheel on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the metal spudger between the inside side of the wheel and the plastic body. Push the metal spudger away from you to pop the wheels out. Repeat the step to remove the other wheel on the other side.

Lines.Text: remove the six 15 mm screws using the ph1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 15mm screws using the PH1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: move the blue fulcrum connecting the bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the blue fulcrum connecting the  bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice  between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush .
apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush. Apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames.

Lines.Text: lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface.

Lines.Text: lift the roller brush slightly upwards using your hand .
take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the roller brush slightly upwards  using your hand. Take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand.

Lines.Text: remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor.

Subject: Roller Brush Belt

Title: Ninja Coffee Bar CF086 Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure the ninja coffee bar is unplugged and that you have a dry , clean workspace for this task .
remove the carafe and water reservoir and set them aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the Ninja Coffee Bar is unplugged and that you have a dry, clean workspace for this task. Remove the carafe and water reservoir and set them aside.

Lines.Text: unscrew the t-10 screws from the bottom cover of the machine , and remove that bottom cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the T-10 screws from the bottom cover of the machine, and remove that bottom cover.

Lines.Text: unscrew and remove the heating plate layer . this will expose the internal workings of the machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew and remove the heating plate layer. This will expose the internal workings of the machine.

Lines.Text: locate the water heating element in the interior of your coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the water heating element in the interior of your coffee maker.

Lines.Text: unscrew the two indicated j1 s1 screws at the base of the water heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two indicated J1S1 screws at the base of the water heating element.

Lines.Text: unscrew and remove the remaining j1 s1 screws that secure the water heating element to the interior of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew and remove the remaining J1S1 screws that secure the water heating element to the interior of the device.

Lines.Text: grasp and remove the clamp securing the tube that feeds into the base of the water heating element .
detach the tube from the water heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Grasp and remove the clamp securing the tube that feeds into the base of the water heating element. Detach the tube from the water heating element.

Lines.Text: locate the coated wire that feeds into the side of the water heating element . remove this wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the coated wire that feeds into the side of the water heating element. Remove this wire.

Lines.Text: locate the two wires leading out from the water heating element that feed into crimp connectors .
using side cutters , sever these wires near the crimp connectors .
use the side cutters to cut the remaining wires that feed into the crimp connectors from the coffee machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two wires leading out from the water heating element that feed into crimp connectors. Using side cutters, sever these wires near the crimp connectors. Use the side cutters to cut the remaining wires that feed into the crimp connectors from the coffee machine.

Lines.Text: squeeze and remove the clamp that secures the main tube feeding into the water heating element . remove that tube .
remove the water heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze and remove the clamp that secures the main tube feeding into the water heating element. Remove that tube. Remove the water heating element.

Lines.Text: using wire strippers , strip the cut wires from your coffee machine near their cut ends to expose 2 cm of metal conductor from each .
use a similar procedure to strip the wires from your replacement heating element . using wire strippers , expose 2 cm of metal conductor from the ends of the wires .

Steps.Text_raw: Using wire strippers, strip the cut wires from your coffee machine near their cut ends to expose 2 cm of metal conductor from each. Use a similar procedure to strip the wires from your replacement heating element. Using wire strippers, expose 2 cm of metal conductor from the ends of the wires.

Lines.Text: prepare two crimp connectors by filling them with dielectric grease .
use a crimp connector to connect a stripped end of the wire leading from the replacement heating element to the stripped end of the corresponding wire from the coffee maker .
using a second crimp connector , repeat for the remaining pair of stripped wires .
using the appropriate crimping tool , crimp the connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Prepare two crimp connectors by filling them with dielectric grease. Use a crimp connector to connect a stripped end of the wire leading from the replacement heating element to the stripped end of the corresponding wire from the coffee maker. Using a second crimp connector, repeat for the remaining pair of stripped wires. Using the appropriate crimping tool, crimp the connectors.

Lines.Text: the power cord splits into two and feeds into two closed-end crimp connectors . two wires from your coffee machine also enter these connectors .
locate the neutral wire that feeds into the crimp connector from the machine . mark this wire .

Steps.Text_raw: The power cord splits into two and feeds into two closed-end crimp connectors. Two wires from your coffee machine also enter these connectors. Locate the neutral wire that feeds into the crimp connector from the machine. Mark this wire.

Lines.Text: using side cutters , cut the wires from your device below the crimp connectors .

Steps.Text_raw: Using side cutters, cut the wires from your device below the crimp connectors.

Lines.Text: using wire strippers , carefully expose a 2 cm length of the metal wire from each of the cut ends .

Steps.Text_raw: Using wire strippers, carefully expose a 2 cm length of the metal wire from each of the cut ends.

Lines.Text: apply dielectric grease to the insides of two new crimp connectors .
insert the stripped ends of the wire into the crimp connectors .
locate the ends of the replacement power cord . these should be already stripped ; if they are not , strip 2 cm from them using wire strippers .
feed the ends of the replacement power cord into the crimp connectors . crimp the connectors using the appropriate crimping tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Apply dielectric grease to the insides of two new crimp connectors. Insert the stripped ends of the wire into the crimp connectors. Locate the ends of the replacement power cord. These should be already stripped; if they are not, strip 2 cm from them using wire strippers. Feed the ends of the replacement power cord into the crimp connectors. Crimp the connectors using the appropriate crimping tool.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: Ninja Ultima BL810 Blade Replacement

Lines.Text: remove the lid from the container by twisting the lid counter clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the lid from the container by twisting the lid counter clockwise.

Lines.Text: use pliers to grip the nut on the bottom of the lid .
make sure to hold tight on the blade with a towel or glove to make sure you do not cut your hand .
twist the pliers counter clockwise while holding the blade to remove from lid .
make sure to keep track of each piece once disassembled .

Steps.Text_raw: Use pliers to grip the nut on the bottom of the lid. Make sure to hold tight on the blade with a towel or glove to make sure you do not cut your hand. Twist the pliers counter clockwise while holding the blade to remove from lid. Make sure to keep track of each piece once disassembled.

Subject: Single Serving Blade

Title: Ninja Ultima BL810 Handle Replacement

Lines.Text: remove five phillips 2 9 mm screws on the bottom of the blender .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove five Phillips #2 9mm screws on the bottom of the blender.

Lines.Text: use a metal spudger to pop out the upper layer of the handle .
pull the upper plastic layer off the handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a metal spudger to pop out the upper layer of the handle. Pull the upper plastic layer off the handle.

Lines.Text: unhook the latches from each side of the top portion of the handle with the metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Unhook the latches from each side of the top portion of the handle with the metal spudger.

Lines.Text: pull the black handle off of the pitcher .
don't pull to hard or you may break the handle off of the base .
once it disconnected , pull base and handle down in order to remove it from the pitcher .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the black handle off of the pitcher. Don't pull to hard or you may break the handle off of the base. Once it disconnected, pull base and handle down in order to remove it from the  pitcher.

Subject: Handle

detach the connector and remove the water pump .

Title: Shark Rotator Lift-Away Speed Brushroll Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure the vacuum is turned off and unplugged before proceeding .
locate the release button at the top of the vacuum pod next to the handle .
use the handle to lift the pod up off of the vacuum nozzle while pressing the release button .
removing the pod is optional , but it may be easier to locate blockages or access the motor and belt if you do so .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vacuum is turned off and unplugged before proceeding. Locate the release button at the top of the vacuum pod next to the handle. Use the handle to lift the pod up off of the vacuum nozzle while pressing the release button. Removing the pod is optional, but it may be easier to locate blockages or access the motor and belt if you do so.

Lines.Text: press the brushroll access buttons on the top of the nozzle to reveal the brushroll compartment .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the Brushroll Access buttons on the top of the nozzle to reveal the brushroll compartment.

Lines.Text: lift the brushroll out by using the pull-tab on the left side .
you can test the brushroll once it has been inserted by plugging the vacuum in and running the vacuum in carpet mode . the brushroll indicator light should be a solid green color .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brushroll out by using the pull-tab on the left side. You can test the brushroll once it has been inserted by plugging the vacuum in and running the vacuum in carpet mode.  The brushroll indicator light should be a solid green color.

Subject: Brushroll

Title: Dyson DC56 Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure the vacuum is unplugged from charger .
warning : avoid pressing red trigger because the vacuum will turn on the device and begin suction .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vacuum is unplugged from charger. Warning: Avoid pressing red trigger because the vacuum will turn on the device and begin suction.

Lines.Text: locate the purple button at the top of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the purple button at the top of the device.

Lines.Text: separate the device with the purple button .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the device with the purple button.

Lines.Text: take out the filter .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the filter.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the 10 mm phillips head screw using a phillips 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the 10mm Phillips head screw using a Phillips #1 screw driver.

Lines.Text: pull the battery pack down and away from the main body and remove it from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the battery pack down and away from the main body and remove it from the device.

Lines.Text: take out the 10 mm screw using a phillips 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the 10mm screw using a Phillips #1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: use a spudger to separate the back plate covering the motor .
be careful when trying to remove the motor with a metal spudger . be sure your battery is removed before trying to fully remove the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a spudger to separate the back plate covering the motor. Be careful when trying to remove the motor with a metal spudger.  Be sure your battery is removed before trying to fully remove the motor.

Lines.Text: use a flat spudger to loosen and remove the motor out of the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flat spudger to loosen and remove the motor out of the vacuum.

Subject: Motor

Title: Dyson DC56 Attachments Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure the vacuum is unplugged .
warning : avoid pressing the red trigger because it will turn on and begin suction .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vacuum is unplugged. Warning: Avoid pressing the red trigger because it will turn on and begin suction.

Lines.Text: locate the purple button at the top of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the purple button at the top of the device.

Lines.Text: separate the device with the purple button .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the device with the purple button.

Lines.Text: locate the dust bin's red release lever on the side of the device .
make sure if the dust bin is full you open the vacuum over a trash can .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the dust bin's red release lever on the side of the device. Make sure if the dust bin is full you open the vacuum over a trash can.

Lines.Text: push the red lever to release the dust bin lid .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the red lever to release the dust bin lid.

Lines.Text: locate the red lever below the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the red lever below the vacuum.

Lines.Text: push the red lever , pull the back up and away from the dust bin to separate them .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the red lever,  pull the back up and away from the dust bin to separate them.

Lines.Text: locate two screws at the back of the attachment holder .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate two screws at the back of the attachment holder.

Lines.Text: use a t8-torque screwdriver to take out the two 26 mm screws out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a T8-Torque screwdriver to take out the two 26mm screws out.

Lines.Text: loosen the attachment holder by using a metal spudger .

Title: Shark Rotator Powered Lift-Away Brush Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: push lift away button and pull the handle up to separate the body from the wand section .

Steps.Text_raw: Push lift away button and pull the handle up to separate the body from the wand section.

Lines.Text: push lift away button on the wand then lift up on the top section to separate .

Steps.Text_raw: Push lift away button on the wand then lift up on the top section to separate.

Lines.Text: tilt the wand shaft backwards for convenient .

Steps.Text_raw: Tilt the wand shaft backwards for convenient.

Lines.Text: lay the head nozzle piece upside down .
locate and rotate the three gray taps to the unlock position .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the head nozzle piece upside down. Locate and rotate the three gray taps to the unlock position.

Lines.Text: with your fingers , pry and pull the brush cage open .

Steps.Text_raw: With your fingers, pry and pull the brush cage open.

Lines.Text: remove the 13 screws ( circled in yellow ) using a phillips screwdriver .
be sure to keep track of which screws go into which hole .
remove the one screw ( circled in red ) that has a torx head .
the torx screw is hidden under a rubber gasket . carefully , lift up the gasket without damaging it to access this screw .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the 13 screws (circled in yellow) using a phillips screwdriver. Be sure to keep track of which screws go into which hole. Remove the one screw (circled in red) that has a Torx head. The Torx screw is hidden under a rubber gasket. Carefully, lift up the gasket without damaging it to access this screw.

Lines.Text: lift up the top cover now that all of the screws have been removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the top cover now that all of the screws have been removed.

Lines.Text: pry tab out with a flat head screwdriver or any wedge-like tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry tab out with a flat head screwdriver or any wedge-like tool.

Lines.Text: gently press in on brush to detach .
pull brush down and out .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently press in on brush to detach. Pull brush down and out.

Lines.Text: slide the belt off of the gear .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the belt off of the gear.

Subject: Brush Belt

press in the black , rubberish button located on the back of the vacuum to detach the vacuum head from the body .

repeat this for the other wheel .

prying in multiple locations may be necessary to create separation .

the white cable is positive .

the black cable is negative .

repeat this for the other wheel .

Lines.Text: remove the four 18 mm screws located on the top corners and the bottom/middle of the vacuum head using a jis 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 18mm screws located on the inside of the large wheels using a JIS 1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: locate the motor on the top right corner of the vacuum head shell .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the motor on the top right corner of the vacuum head shell.

Lines.Text: remove the belt from the motor gear by sliding the belt to the right .

Lines.Text: remove the white metal wire connector from the motor .
the white cable is positive .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the white metal wire connector from the motor. The white cable is positive.

Lines.Text: remove the black metal wire connector from the motor .
the black cable is negative .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black metal wire connector from the motor. The black cable is negative.

Lines.Text: remove the two 12 mm screws using a jis 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 12mm screws using a JIS 1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the wire housing by removing one 12 mm screw using a jis 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wire housing by removing one 12mm screw using a JIS 1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: lift up the wire housing from the plastic base using tweezers .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up the wire housing from the plastic base using tweezers.

Lines.Text: free the black and white cables that were previously attached to the motor from their slot .

Steps.Text_raw: Free the black and white cables that were previously attached to the motor from their slot.

Lines.Text: free the motherboard and its connecting parts from the rest of the vacuum .
turn the motherboard upside-down and spread wires out .

Steps.Text_raw: Free the motherboard and its connecting parts from the rest of the vacuum. Turn the motherboard upside-down and spread wires out.

Lines.Text: heat the wire connection's solder joint until the joint looks wet and liquidy .
while maintaining contact with the solder iron , free the wire end by pulling the wire away from the board with the tweezers .
for instructions on how to solder properly please refer to this soldering technique guide .
remember which cables were soldered onto where . you will have to re-solder the cables back onto the same joint .
solder iron is extremely hot and should be handled with care . always wear eye protection when soldering .

Steps.Text_raw: Heat the wire connection's solder joint until the joint looks wet and  liquidy. While maintaining contact with the solder iron, free the wire end by pulling the wire away from the board with the tweezers. For instructions on how to solder properly please refer to this soldering technique guide. https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750 Remember which cables were soldered onto where. You will have to re-solder the cables back onto the same joint. Solder iron is extremely hot and should be handled with care. Always wear eye protection when soldering.

Lines.Text: completely free the cable by pulling it out of the board .
repeat for the remaining cables . there are 4 total .

Steps.Text_raw: Completely free the cable by pulling it  out of the board. Repeat for the remaining cables. There are 4 total.

Title: Shark Rotator Lift-Away Speed Brushroll Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: make sure the vacuum is turned off and unplugged before proceeding .
locate the release button at the top of the vacuum pod next to the handle .
use the handle to lift the pod up off of the vacuum nozzle while pressing the release button .
removing the pod is optional , but it may be easier to locate blockages or access the motor and belt if you do so .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure the vacuum is turned off and unplugged before proceeding. Locate the release button at the top of the vacuum pod next to the handle. Use the handle to lift the pod up off of the vacuum nozzle while pressing the release button. Removing the pod is optional, but it may be easier to locate blockages or access the motor and belt if you do so.

Lines.Text: press the brushroll access buttons on the top of the nozzle to reveal the brushroll compartment .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the Brushroll Access buttons on the top of the nozzle to reveal the brushroll compartment.

Lines.Text: lift the brushroll out by using the pull-tab on the left side .
you can test the brushroll once it has been inserted by plugging the vacuum in and running the vacuum in carpet mode . the brushroll indicator light should be a solid green color .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the brushroll out by using the pull-tab on the left side. You can test the brushroll once it has been inserted by plugging the vacuum in and running the vacuum in carpet mode.  The brushroll indicator light should be a solid green color.

Lines.Text: remove the five 5 mm torx 9 screws on the front side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 5mm Torx #9 screws on the front side.

Lines.Text: remove the six 7.5 mm torx 20 screws on the bottom face of the nozzle .
a screwdriver extension may be necessary to reach the screw closest to the center of the nozzle .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 7.5mm Torx #20 screws on the bottom face of the nozzle. A screwdriver extension may be necessary to reach the screw closest to the center of the nozzle.

Lines.Text: remove the top panel by lifting the top piece off of the bottom .
there will be loud clicking noises .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top panel by lifting the top piece off of the bottom. There will be loud clicking noises.

Lines.Text: if you are trying to remove the belt , you may skip to the next step .
remove the 7.5 mm torx 20 screw in front of the motor .
the motor is the gray block on the right side of the floor nozzle ( when the nozzle faces towards you ) .

Steps.Text_raw: If you are trying to remove the belt, you may skip to the next step. Remove the 7.5mm Torx #20 screw in front of the motor. The motor is the gray block on the right side of the floor nozzle (when the nozzle faces towards you).

Lines.Text: if you are trying to remove the belt , you may skip to the next step .
remove the panel to reveal the motor screw .
remove the 7.5 mm torx 20 motor screw .
remove the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: If you are trying to remove the belt, you may skip to the next step. Remove the panel to reveal the motor screw. Remove the 7.5mm Torx #20 motor screw. Remove the motor.

Subject: Brushroll Motor

Title: Shark Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe NV360 Roller Brush Replacement

Lines.Text: lay the vacuum down by hand and locate the roller brush underneath the vacuum cleaner .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the vacuum down by hand and locate the roller brush underneath the vacuum cleaner.

Lines.Text: insert the metal spudger between the inside side of the wheel and the plastic body .
push the metal spudger away from you to pop the wheels out .
repeat the step to remove the other wheel on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the metal spudger between the inside side of the wheel and the plastic body. Push the metal spudger away from you to pop the wheels out. Repeat the step to remove the other wheel on the other side.

Lines.Text: remove the six 15 mm screws using the ph1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 15mm screws using the PH1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: move the blue fulcrum connecting the bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the blue fulcrum connecting the  bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice  between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush .
apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush. Apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames.

Lines.Text: lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface.

Lines.Text: lift the roller brush slightly upwards using your hand .
take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the roller brush slightly upwards  using your hand. Take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand.

Lines.Text: remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor.

Lines.Text: remove the roller brush from the plastic frame using your hands by lifting it away .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller brush from the plastic frame using your hands by lifting it away.

Subject: Roller Brush

Title: Shark Navigator Lift-Away Deluxe NV360 Power Button Replacement

Lines.Text: locate the latches on the side of the dust cup , the clear plastic chamber in the center of the vacuum .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the latches on the side of the dust cup, the clear plastic chamber in the center of the vacuum.

Lines.Text: pull the bottom of the latch with your hand in an upward direction .
lift the top of the latch up and away from the dust cup using your hand .
repeat the above steps with the latch on the other side of the dust cup .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the bottom of the latch with your hand in an upward direction. Lift the top of the latch up and away from the dust cup using your hand. Repeat the above steps with the latch on the other side of the dust cup.

Lines.Text: lift the dust cup up and away by its handle on the top with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the dust cup up and away by its handle on the top with your hands.

Lines.Text: lift the foam filter up , out , and away with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the foam filter up, out, and away with your hands.

Lines.Text: lift the felt filter up , out , and away with your hands by the tab on the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the felt filter up, out, and away with your hands by the tab on the top.

Lines.Text: locate the red latch on the side of the vacuum cleaner .
push the circular region of the latch with your finger .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the red latch on the side of the vacuum cleaner. Push the circular region of the latch with your finger.

Lines.Text: lift this upper plastic body of the vacuum cleaner up with your hands while continuing to press on the circular region of the latch .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift this upper plastic body of the vacuum cleaner up with your hands while continuing to press on the circular region of the latch.

Lines.Text: locate the lower junction that connects the curved grey plastic tube and the hose coming from the vacuum cleaner's handle .
press on the two grey flaps on either side of the hose simultaneously with your fingers and lift the hose out of the plastic cup with your hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the lower junction that connects the curved grey plastic tube and the hose coming from the vacuum cleaner's handle. Press on the two grey flaps on either side of the hose simultaneously with your fingers and lift the hose out of the plastic cup with your hand.

Lines.Text: locate the red latch that was next to the hose from the previous step .
hold the bottom of vacuum cleaner's handle and its extension .
use your other hand to press on the latch .
lift the handle off the vacuum cleaner .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the red latch that was next to the hose from the previous step. Hold the bottom of vacuum cleaner's handle and its extension. Use your other hand to press on the latch. Lift the handle off the vacuum cleaner.

Lines.Text: remove the two 15 mm screws with the ph1 screwdriver located on the bottom side of grey plastic body from which the handle was removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 15mm screws with the PH1 screwdriver located on the bottom side of grey plastic body from which the handle was removed.

Lines.Text: lift the grey compartment out of the main body of the vacuum cleaner by pulling upwards with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the grey compartment out of the main body of the vacuum cleaner by pulling upwards with your hands.

Lines.Text: continue to pull on the grey compartment until it is fully out of the main body of the vacuum .
place the grey compartment on a surface for the next step .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to pull on the grey compartment until it is fully out of the main body of the vacuum. Place the grey compartment on a surface for the next step.

Lines.Text: peel the sticker away with your hands until the hidden screw hole is fully exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Peel the sticker away with your hands until the hidden screw hole is fully exposed.

Lines.Text: locate and remove the five 15 mm screws with a ph1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and remove the five 15mm screws with a PH1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: insert plastic opening tool into the crevice in the middle between the two halves of the grey compartment .
apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic halves .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert plastic opening tool into the crevice in the middle between the two halves of the grey compartment. Apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic halves.

Lines.Text: locate the red power button and its red , blue , and black connected wires .
pinch and pull the red wire's clear plastic insulator away from the power button with your hands until the metal connector is fully exposed .
repeat this step for the blue wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the red power button and its red, blue, and black connected wires. Pinch and pull the red wire's clear plastic insulator away from the power button with your hands until the metal connector is fully exposed. Repeat this step for the blue wire.

Lines.Text: locate the protrusion on the metal connector of the red wire .
push down on the protrusion with the metal spudger while pushing the connector on the red wire away from the power button with your fingers .
pull and wiggle the wire away by its connector with your fingers until it is completely detached from the connector on the power button .
repeat this step for the blue wire

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the protrusion on the metal connector of the red wire. Push down on the protrusion with the metal spudger while pushing the connector on the red wire away from the power button with your fingers. Pull and wiggle the wire away by its connector with your fingers until it is completely detached from the connector on the power button. Repeat this step for the blue wire

Lines.Text: push down towards the outside on the ledges that are holding the power button inside the grey frame .
pull on the power button from the outside of the grey compartment with your hands , once the ledges are past the edge of grey frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down towards the outside on the ledges that are holding the power button inside the grey frame. Pull on the power button from the outside of the grey compartment with your hands, once the ledges are past the edge of grey frame.

Lines.Text: pull the power button a couple inches away from the grey frame with your hands so that you have easy access to the black wire's connection .
repeat steps 16 and 17 on the black wire and its connector .
remove the disconnected power button away from the frame with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the power button a couple inches away from the grey frame with your hands so that you have easy access to the black wire's connection. Repeat steps 16 and 17 on the black wire and its connector. Remove the disconnected power button away from the frame with your hands.

push the metal spudger away from you to pop the wheels out .
repeat the step to remove the other wheel on the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 15mm screws using the PH1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: move the blue fulcrum connecting the bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the blue fulcrum connecting the  bottom and the main body of the vacuum cleaner back and forth to loosen up crevice  between the two halves of the roller brush enclosure.

Lines.Text: insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush .
apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames .

Steps.Text_raw: Insert the plastic opening tool into the crevice between the blue and the dark grey plastic frames enclosing the roller brush. Apply an outward force throughout and all around the gap in order to separate the two plastic frames.

Lines.Text: lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the grey frame off the bottom of the vacuum cleaner with your hands and place it on a flat surface.

Lines.Text: lift the roller brush slightly upwards using your hand .
take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the roller brush slightly upwards  using your hand. Take one side of the black roller brush belt off by pulling it over the end of the roller brush with your other hand.

Lines.Text: remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller brush belt with your hands by sliding it of the end of the motor.

Lines.Text: remove the roller brush from the plastic frame using your hands by lifting it away .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the roller brush from the plastic frame using your hands by lifting it away.

Lines.Text: lift the roller brush motor up and away from its half-cylindrical holder with your hand .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the roller brush motor up and away from its half-cylindrical holder with your hand.

Lines.Text: locate the two connectors coming out of the roller brush motor .
pinch and pull the blue plastic insulation down the wire and away from the motor until the metal connectors are fully exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two connectors coming out of the roller brush motor. Pinch and pull the blue plastic insulation down the wire and away from the motor until the metal connectors are fully exposed.

Lines.Text: locate the protrusion near the connection between the metal and wire .
push down on the protrusion with your finger and push the metal connector away from the motor with the metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the protrusion near the connection between the metal and wire. Push down on the protrusion with your finger and push the metal connector away from the motor with the metal spudger.

Lines.Text: continue to push on the connector away from the motor with the metal spudger until it is disconnected completely .
repeat the steps 12-14 for the other wire .

Steps.Text_raw: Continue to push on the connector away from the motor with the metal spudger until it is disconnected completely. Repeat the steps 12-14 for the other wire.

Title: Ninja Professional Blender BL660 Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the 5 screws ( 13 mm long , 6 mm wide ) holding the outer base .
lift the base up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the 5 screws (13mm long, 6mm wide) holding the outer base. Lift the base up to remove it.

Lines.Text: remove the midsection by pulling it up . if the section is stuck , use the ifixit plastic opening tool to pry it off .
pull the power cord through the mid-section opening .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the midsection by pulling it up. If the section is stuck, use the iFixit plastic opening tool to pry it off. Pull the power cord through the mid-section opening.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the 6 screws ( 13 mm long , 6 mm wide ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the 6 screws (13 mm long, 6 mm wide).

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the two screws ( 5 mm long , 3 mm wide ) holding the power cord onto the motor cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the two screws (5 mm long, 3 mm wide) holding the power cord onto the motor cover.

Lines.Text: using the ifixit plastic opening tool , pry the motor cover off the general housing . once it is loose , lift it up to remove it off the base .
slide the cover all the way to the end of the power cord .
please note that the power cord does not completely come off the cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the iFixit plastic opening tool, pry the motor cover off the general housing. Once it is loose, lift it up to remove it off the base. Slide the cover all the way to the end of the power cord. Please note that the power cord does not completely come off the cover.

Lines.Text: check the connection between the power cord and the wires coming from the circuit board .

Steps.Text_raw: Check the connection between the power cord and the wires coming from the circuit board.

Lines.Text: remove the plastic caps on the wire connectors with your hands .
ensure that the connections are not loose , corroded or desoldered .
if the connections are desoldered , loose or corroded , re-solder them using the ifixit guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the plastic caps on the wire connectors with your hands. Ensure that the connections are not loose, corroded or desoldered. If the connections are desoldered, loose or corroded, re-solder them using the iFixit [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|soldering guide].

Lines.Text: if the connections in the preceding step are good , check the connection of the wires to the circuit board .
if any of the connections are loose or damaged , the blender might not be getting power .

Steps.Text_raw: If the connections in the preceding step are good, check the connection of the wires to the circuit board. If any of the connections are loose or damaged, the blender might not be getting power.

Lines.Text: re-solder the connections using the ifixit soldering guide .
the red arrow shows where the wires enter the circuit board .
the orange circle shows where the black ground wire is soldered to the board and the blue circle shows where the red power wire is soldered to the board .
make sure you check the correct solder as the wires are routed differently .

Steps.Text_raw: Re-solder the connections using the [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750| iFixit Soldering guide]. The red arrow shows where the wires enter the circuit board. The orange circle shows where the black ground wire is soldered to the board and the blue circle shows where the red power wire is soldered to the board. Make sure you check the correct solder as the wires are routed differently.

Subject: Power Cord

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the 5 screws holding the outer base .
lift the base up to remove it .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the 5 screws holding the outer base. Lift the base up to remove it.

Lines.Text: turn the base panel upside down to reveal the suction cup feet .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the base panel upside down to reveal the suction cup feet.

Lines.Text: push the stopper on the suction cup foot through the bottom panel using the ifixit plastic opening tool .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the stopper on the  suction cup foot through the bottom panel using the iFixit plastic opening tool.

Lines.Text: once stopper has passed through the bottom panel , pull suction cup foot out .
replace suction cup feet as needed .
ninja does not sell suction cup feet . you will need to obtain them from other third party vendors .

Steps.Text_raw: Once stopper has passed through the bottom panel, pull suction cup foot out. Replace suction cup feet as needed. Ninja does not sell suction cup feet. You will need to obtain them from other third party vendors.

Subject: Suction Cups on Base

Title: Hoover Presto 2-in-1 Cordless Stick Belt Replacement

Lines.Text: press grey release button on stick vacuum to release vacuum head .

Steps.Text_raw: Press grey release button on stick vacuum to release vacuum head.

Lines.Text: locate the circular black turn switch , which is in the upper right corner of the backside of the vacuum head
using a metal spudger , place the tool in the indent of the circular turn switch and turn it from the left to the right or from the locked symbol to the unlocked symbol

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the circular black turn switch, which is in the upper right corner of the backside of the vacuum head Using a metal spudger, place the tool in the indent of the circular turn switch and turn it from the left to the right or from the "locked" symbol to the "unlocked" symbol

Lines.Text: flip the vacuum head over so that the wheels and screws are facing you .
using a ph 1 screwdriver , remove the four 15 mm screws from each corner of the backside of the vacuum head .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the vacuum head over so that the wheels and screws are facing you. Using a PH #1 screw driver, remove the four 15mm screws from each corner of the backside of the vacuum head.

Lines.Text: locate the two wheels in the upper half of the vacuum head and remove them by sticking the metal spudger tool underneath the wheel and pushing it towards you until it pops out .
remove the two 15 mm screws located underneath the wheels with a ph 1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the two wheels in the upper half of the vacuum head and remove them by sticking the metal spudger tool underneath the wheel and pushing it towards you until it pops out. Remove the two 15mm screws located underneath the wheels with a PH #1 screw driver.

Lines.Text: using a firm grip , pull the two halves of the vacuum head away from each other until they are completely separated

Steps.Text_raw: Using a firm grip, pull the two halves of the vacuum head away from each other until they are completely separated

Lines.Text: remove the mechanism with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the mechanism with your hands.

Lines.Text: remove the two 7 mm screws located on either side of the roller with a ph 1 screwdriver .
removing these screws helps loosen the belt so that it is easier to take off the mechanism .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 7mm screws located on either side of the roller with a PH #1 screw driver. Removing these screws helps loosen the belt so that it is easier to take off the mechanism.

Lines.Text: use a metal spudger to lift the belt away from the mechanism .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a metal spudger  to lift the belt away from the mechanism.

Subject: Belt

Title: Hoover Presto 2-in-1 Cordless Stick Charger Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: using a firm grip , gently pull the standing charger away from the floor charger attachment

Steps.Text_raw: Using a firm grip, gently pull the standing charger away from the floor charger attachment

Lines.Text: flip the floor charger over so the screws and sticker are facing you
using a ph 1 screwdriver , remove the two 18 mm screws on the right hand side of the floor charger

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the floor charger over so the screws and sticker are facing you Using a PH #1 screw driver, remove the two 18mm screws on the right hand side of the floor charger

Lines.Text: using a ph 2 screwdriver , remove the three 18 mm screws on floor charger .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a PH #2 screw driver, remove the three 18mm screws on floor charger.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger tool , gently lift up the plastic cover in the upper right hand corner of the floor attachment to uncover a hidden screw
remove the 18 mm screw in the upper right hand corner with a ph 1 screwdriver

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger tool, gently lift up the plastic cover in the upper right hand corner of the floor attachment to uncover a hidden screw Remove the 18mm screw in the upper right hand corner with a PH #1 screw driver

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , gently pry open the two halves of the floor charger
once you have made a larger enough gap between the two halves , use your hands and gently pull the rest of the floor charger apart

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, gently pry open the two halves of the floor charger Once you have made a larger enough gap between the two halves, use your hands and gently pull the rest of the floor charger apart

Lines.Text: unscrew the two 18 mm screws on either side of the white battery cover with a ph 1 screwdriver

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the two 18mm screws on either side of the white battery cover with a PH  #1 screw driver

Lines.Text: using your hands , gently pull apart the two halves of the white battery cover to get to the battery

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands, gently pull apart the two halves of the white battery cover to get to the battery

Subject: Charger Battery

Title: DeLonghi ESAM xxxx - (Different Types) Pressure Regulator Installation

Lines.Text: pull the plug !
remove the drip tray , the water tank and the pulp container .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the plug! Remove the drip tray, the water tank and the pulp container.

Lines.Text: the back panel and side panels are attached with six phillips screws ph2. screw it out .

Steps.Text_raw: The back panel and side panels are attached with six phillips screws PH2. Screw it out.

Lines.Text: slide the right side panel about 2 cm to the back .
then solve it .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the right side panel about 2 cm to the back. Then solve it.

Lines.Text: the left side is a bit stuck . place a plastic opening tool in the gap between the front and left side panel above the opening for the water tank . lift the gap slightly larger .
then place the tool in the gap between the front and left side panel under the opening for the water tank . increase the gap and push the side part about 2 cm to the rear .
lift out the left side piece .

Steps.Text_raw: The left side is a bit stuck. Place a plastic opening tool in the gap between the front and left side panel above the opening for the water tank. Lift the gap slightly larger. Then place the tool in the gap between the front and left side panel under the opening for the water tank. Increase the gap and push the side part about 2 cm to the rear. Lift out the left side piece.

Lines.Text: take out the back

Steps.Text_raw: Take out the back

Lines.Text: the front panel is secured with four ph2 phillips screws , two left and one right each . turn it out .
use a plastic opening tool to lever off the steam tap .
carefully pull the front panel about 1 cm forward so that there is a gap between the top cover and the front panel ,
do not pull the front panel too far , it is still attached with different hoses and cables .

Steps.Text_raw: The front panel is secured with four PH2 Phillips screws, two left and one right each. Turn it out. Use a plastic opening tool to lever off the steam tap. Carefully pull the front panel about 1 cm forward so that there is a gap between the top cover and the front panel, Do not pull the front panel too far, it is still attached with different hoses and cables.

Lines.Text: two phillips screws ph2 hold the lid at the back . turn it out .
lift the lid upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Two Phillips screws PH2 hold the lid at the back. Turn it out. Lift the lid upwards.

Lines.Text: the old safety valve - seen in the first photo already expanded - is screwed on the pump . it is replaced by a combination of safety valve and pressure balance valve . the diaphragm valve dampens the shocks of the pump , making the flow of water quieter and quieter .

Steps.Text_raw: The old safety valve - seen in the first photo already expanded - is screwed on the pump. It is replaced by a combination of safety valve and pressure balance valve. The diaphragm valve dampens the shocks of the pump, making the flow of water quieter and quieter.

Lines.Text: remove the two hoses from the valve . for the thicker hose you have to squeeze the hose clamp with pliers , push it away and you can pull off the hose .
with the thinner pressure hose above you have to pull out first a clamp , then the hose comes out easily . there may be a gasket on the hose or it may stick in the valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two hoses from the valve. For the thicker hose you have to squeeze the hose clamp with pliers, push it away and you can pull off the hose. With the thinner pressure hose above you have to pull out first a clamp, then the hose comes out easily. There may be a gasket on the hose or it may stick in the valve.

Lines.Text: pull the pump slightly out of the housing in its rubber mount . place a fork wrench sw 12 on the pump tube .
then turn out the old valve .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the pump slightly out of the housing in its rubber mount. Place a fork wrench SW 12 on the pump tube. Then turn out the old valve.

Lines.Text: make sure that there is a sealing ring above the thread on the valves , marked yellow in the photo .
first screw the safety valve into the pump tube . do not turn too hard .
then screw the pressure regulating valve into the safety valve .
place the two outputs on top of each other .
put the two hoses back on . also pay attention here to the thinner tube on the sealing ring , if possible , a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Make sure that there is a sealing ring above the thread on the valves, marked yellow in the photo. First screw the safety valve into the pump tube. Do not turn too hard. then screw the pressure regulating valve into the safety valve. Place the two outputs on top of each other. Put the two hoses back on. Also pay attention here to the thinner tube on the sealing ring, if possible, a new one.

Subject: pressure regulator

Title: Vornado Duo Circuit Board Replacement

Lines.Text: start off by using a phillips 2 screwdriver to remove all 8 10 mm exterior screws on the rear of the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Start off by using a Philips #2 screwdriver to remove all 8 10mm exterior screws on the rear of the device.

Lines.Text: carefully take front panel off .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully take front panel off.

Lines.Text: loosen 5 mm screw at bottom of fan blade located inside the blades .

Steps.Text_raw: Loosen 5 mm screw at bottom of fan blade located inside the blades.

Lines.Text: remove fan blade after unscrewing top 2 screws located on each side of the covered board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove fan blade after unscrewing top 2 screws located on each side of the covered board.

Lines.Text: remove cover from board .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove cover from board.

Lines.Text: unsolder the circled spots on the mother board and resolder each wire to corresponding spot .

Steps.Text_raw: Unsolder the circled spots on the mother board and resolder each wire to corresponding spot.

Subject: Circuit Board

Title: How to seal with DeLonghi ESAM xxxx - the brewing group

Lines.Text: press the two red buttons of the brew group together and remove the brew group .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the two red buttons of the brew group together and remove the brew group.

Lines.Text: lay the machine on its rearside , with the open frontside looking upwards .
the brewing strainer of the upper piston is fixed with two phillips screws ph2.turn it out .
with some force , remove the brewing strainer and remove the old sealing ring .
clean the brewing strainer and what is underneath is fine .
grease the new sealing ring with food grade silicone grease . put it on the piston and tighten the brewing sieve again .

Steps.Text_raw: Lay the machine on  its rearside, with the open frontside looking upwards. The brewing strainer of the upper piston is fixed with two phillips screws PH2.Turn it out. With some force, remove the brewing strainer and remove the old sealing ring. Clean the brewing strainer and what is underneath is fine. Grease the new sealing ring with food grade silicone grease. Put it on the piston and tighten the brewing sieve again.

Lines.Text: pull the plastic retaining clip off the moving base of the brew group . it is just plugged .
pull the bottom out of the black plastic piece .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the plastic retaining clip off the moving base of the brew group. It is just plugged. Pull the bottom out of the black plastic piece.

Lines.Text: press out the piston on the opposite side .
remove the two sealing rings .

Steps.Text_raw: Press out the piston on the opposite side. Remove the two sealing rings.

Lines.Text: the filter screen is attached with a phillips screw ph2. turn it out . take off the brewing sieve .
clean brewing strainer and what is behind it is good .

Steps.Text_raw: The filter screen is attached with a phillips screw PH2. Turn it out. Take off the brewing sieve. Clean brewing strainer and what is behind it is good.

Lines.Text: the crema valve is hard to recognize . it is covered with a plastic stopper . you can gently remove it with the sharp tip of a cutter .
he is very tight . hoist piece by piece high with the cutter tip .
underneath is the valve . it consists of a spring and a small piston . clean everything very well , also the channels . be very careful .
plug in the valve again . screw the brewing strainer tight and attach the two new sealing rings . grease the sealing rings and the piston barrel thinly with food-grade silicone grease .

Steps.Text_raw: The crema valve is hard to recognize. It is covered with a plastic stopper. You can gently remove it with the sharp tip of a cutter. He is very tight. Hoist piece by piece high with the cutter tip. Underneath is the valve. It consists of a spring and a small piston. Clean everything very well, also the channels. Be very careful. Plug in the valve again. Screw the brewing strainer tight and attach the two new sealing rings. Grease the sealing rings and the piston barrel thinly with food-grade silicone grease.

Title: Ninja Coffee Bar CF080 Power Module Replacement

Lines.Text: face the machine bottom towards you .

Steps.Text_raw: Face the machine bottom towards you.

Lines.Text: unscrew six 0.6cm screws by holding the bottom board with torx 10 screwdriver to remove the board .
unscrew one 0.6 cm screw with j1 screwdriver to remove the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew six 0.6cm  screws by holding the bottom board with Torx #10 screwdriver to remove the board. Unscrew  one  0.6 cm screw with J1  screwdriver to remove the board.

Lines.Text: with moderate force remove and place the plastic opening tool between the divide in order to remove the bottom board .

Steps.Text_raw: With moderate force remove and place the "plastic opening tool" between the divide in order to remove the bottom board.

Lines.Text: remove the bottom board with moderate force .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the bottom board with moderate force.

Lines.Text: unscrew eight 0.6cm sized screws with phillips 1 screwdriver , holding the silver secures on the sides of the heated plate .
four screws on each side , two silver secures to remove the securers , located on the sliver bar holding the heated plate ( one on each end ) .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew eight 0.6cm sized screws with Phillips #1 screwdriver, holding the silver secures on the sides of the heated plate. Four screws on each side, two silver secures to remove the securers, located on the sliver bar holding the heated plate (one on each end).

Lines.Text: unscrew two 0.6cm sized screws phillips 1 screwdriver .
the silver bar will fall off once screws are removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew two 0.6cm sized screws Phillips #1 screwdriver. The silver bar will fall off once screws are removed.

Lines.Text: remove the heated plate from the machine with easy glide .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the heated plate from the machine with easy glide.

Lines.Text: remove the nine 0.5cm screws with phillips 2 screwdriver .
some screws are harder to see due to how deep the holes are .
recommend using extender 4 with phillips 2 screwdriver to help unscrew the screws within the deep holes of the machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nine 0.5cm screws with Phillips #2 screwdriver. Some screws are harder to see due to how deep the holes are. Recommend using Extender 4 with Phillips #2 screwdriver to help unscrew the screws  within the deep holes of the machine.

Lines.Text: remove the two 0.6cm with phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 0.6cm with Phillips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: detach various colored cords from one another , using both hands to place thumb and index finger to hold each grip then separate by pulling with the degree of force .
there with be 1 blue , 1 black , 1 red and 2 white .

Steps.Text_raw: Detach various colored cords from one another, using both hands to place thumb and index finger to hold each grip then  separate by pulling with the degree of force. There with be 1 blue, 1 black, 1 red and 2 white.

Lines.Text: remove the black board by maneuvering it through the cords .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black board by maneuvering it through the cords.

Lines.Text: grip the bottom end of the panel and pull it towards you to remove the module from the machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip the bottom end of the panel and pull it towards you to remove the module from the machine.

Lines.Text: remove the three 0.6cm screws with phillips 1 screwdriver .
they are in the black holes , 1 at the top and two at the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 0.6cm screws with Phillips #1 screwdriver. They are in the black holes, 1 at the top and two at the bottom.

Lines.Text: remove the black board attached to the module .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black board attached to the module.

Subject: Power Module

Title: iRobot Roomba 980 Motherboard Replacement

carefully lift the panel up once the screws are removed .

pull the tabs upwards to remove the battery .

pull the bin towards you to remove it .

slowly pry the plate loose and lift it from the device .

lift the side brush .

carefully lift the bottom plate .

Lines.Text: remove the ( 10 ) ten 6.1 mm silver screws .
lift the bottom guard off the front sensor panel by pulling it upwards .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the (10) ten 6.1mm silver screws. Lift the bottom guard off the front sensor panel by pulling it upwards.

Lines.Text: lift the 2 corner guards at the rear of the device by lifting it and popping them out .
pull the front sensor away slowly from the vacuum .
the cable connecting the front sensor to the roomba is delicate , so proceed with caution .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the 2 corner guards at the rear of the device by lifting it and popping them out. Pull the front sensor away slowly from the vacuum. The cable connecting the front sensor to the Roomba is delicate, so proceed with caution.

Lines.Text: flip the sensor over and remove the ( 2 ) two 3.8 mm silver screws holding the sensor to the panel .
once removed , pull the panel away carefully .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the sensor over and remove the (2) two 3.8mm silver screws holding the sensor to the panel. Once removed, pull the panel away carefully.

Lines.Text: remove the ( 16 ) sixteen 6.6 mm black screws shown in the pictures that are holding down the top plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the (16) sixteen 6.6mm black screws shown in the pictures that are holding down the top plate.

Lines.Text: lift the top plate slowly being careful not to damage the vacuum components while exposing the motherboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the top plate slowly being careful not to damage the vacuum components while exposing the motherboard.

Lines.Text: remove the ( 9 ) nine 6.4 mm silver screws holding the motherboard to the vacuum body and the clear plastic guard .
carefully remove the connector-clips that are attached to the motherboard .
some connectors will be difficult to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the (9) nine 6.4mm silver screws holding the motherboard to the vacuum body and the clear plastic guard. Carefully remove the connector-clips that are attached to the motherboard. Some connectors will be difficult to remove.

Lines.Text: using both hands , lift the motherboard connected to the camera away from the device's main motherboard .
important only lift it upwards to avoid bending the pins and causing further damage to the device's electronics .
remove the black plastic guard that is placed in between the 2 boards .

Steps.Text_raw: Using both hands, lift the motherboard connected to the camera away from the device's main motherboard. *IMPORTANT* Only lift it upwards to avoid bending the pins and causing further damage to the device's electronics. Remove the black plastic guard that is placed in between the 2 boards.

Lines.Text: lift the main motherboard off the vacuum upward . the screw inserts are holding it in place so it will have to be lifted evenly .
remove the motherboard from your device .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the main motherboard off the vacuum upward. The screw inserts are holding it in place so it will have to be lifted evenly. Remove the motherboard from your device.

Subject: Motherboard

Title: Black and Decker Dustbuster CHV1410 Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: to remove the filter and housing , press the green button labeled filter .

Lines.Text: pull the housing apart
when you pull apart the housing pieces could fall out . be sure to keep track of them .
remove the motor unit from the housing
note that the black disk needs to be firmly pulled it will resist , but can be pulled directly off of the pin if it is pulled hard enough .

the motor makes contact with the board at 2 points . these may be bent or distorted . straighten them with a pair of needle nose pliers in order to remove .

Title: Shark Steam Pocket Mop Water Tank / Bladder Replacement

once all 8 screws have been removed , gently remove the back panel from the rest of the mop's body

then gently lift the water tank / bladder out of its plastic housing . and turn it over .

slide the tabs away from the center of the vacuum to unlock the brushroll cover .
lift the brushroll cover upward .

remove the eight screws shown by rotating counter-clockwise with a t15 torx screwdriver .
two 14 mm torx screws
two 16 mm torx screws
four 21 mm torx screws

lift the filter grille upward .

the post-motor filter is underneath the filter grille .

one 12 mm screw with a t10 torx screwdriver
three 14 mm screw with a t15 torx screwdriver

Title: Shark Rocket Professional Hose Replacement

Lines.Text: look at the shark rocket professional's extension rod .
identify where the hose connects to the main body of the vacuum .
press the tabs on the sides of the connector to remove the hose .
you can use a long , thin object to unclog the hose .
if this fixes your problem , then you are finished with this guide .

Steps.Text_raw: Look at the Shark Rocket Professional's Extension Rod. Identify where the hose connects to the main body of the vacuum. Press the tabs on the sides of the connector to remove the hose. You can use a long, thin object to unclog the hose. If this fixes your problem, then you are finished with this guide.

Lines.Text: look at the vacuum handle and locate the orange button that says handle with a picture of a lock .
press the button and remove the handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Look at the vacuum handle and locate the orange button that says "Handle" with a picture of a lock. Press the button and remove the handle.

Lines.Text: look at the vacuum handle .
using a t-15 screwdriver , remove the five 15 mm screws in the handle by turning them counter-clockwise .

Steps.Text_raw: Look at the vacuum handle. Using a T-15 screwdriver, remove the five 15mm screws in the handle by turning them counter-clockwise.

Lines.Text: use a plastic opening tool to pry open the handle .
don't worry if the handle sounds like it is going to break ; it takes '''a lot''' of force to pull apart .
when popping open your handle , the small grey piece of plastic ( pictured in the last frame ) will fly out .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a plastic opening tool to pry open the handle. Don't worry if the handle sounds like it is going to break; it takes '''a lot''' of force to pull apart. When popping open your handle,  the small grey piece of plastic(pictured in the last frame) will fly out.

Lines.Text: the orange plastic piece may have naturally fallen out at this point .
look a your handle .
using your hands , pull the tube from the nozzle of the handle .
the tube is soldered onto a wire connecting to the plastic orange piece inside the handle .
cut this connection with wire clippers to remove and replace your tube .

Steps.Text_raw: The orange plastic piece may have naturally fallen out at this point. Look a your handle. Using your hands, pull the tube from the nozzle of the handle. The tube is soldered onto a wire connecting to the plastic orange piece inside the handle. Cut this connection with wire clippers to remove and replace your tube.

Lines.Text: remove the seal from the back of the mixer . then unhook the spring from the bottom of the speed control plate by using tweezers and pulling it back and out of the plate .
take a rag or towel and hook the spring on the towel so that the hook doesnt spring back inside the mixer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the seal from the back of the mixer. Then unhook the spring from the bottom of the speed control plate by using tweezers and pulling it back and out of the plate. Take a rag or towel and hook the spring on the towel so that the hook doesn’t spring back inside the mixer.

Lines.Text: using a phillips 2 screwdriver , remove the two adjustment screws by rotating them counterclockwise .

before beginning to remove the screws , use a ruler and measure how far the screws are in . these screws determine the speed of the mixer , and not screwing them back in to the same position will change the speed of the mixer .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a Phillips #2 screwdriver, remove the two adjustment screws by rotating them counterclockwise. Before beginning to remove the screws, use a ruler and measure how far the screws are in. These screws determine the speed of the mixer, and not screwing them back in to the same position will change the speed of the mixer.

push the dirt cup hepa media filter up to take it off .

gently lift off top .
do not try to take off completely . there are still wires attached to the hull .

make sure you remember which orange plug goes where !

make sure not to wiggle the wires , as that may break the metal holding them .

unscrew the screw on the spool .
remove the plastic circle .

and you are done !

remove grate that holds the power cord as pictured .

power cord should disconnect from vacuum body as pictured .

the back cover is now free . remove it by pulling back and up on the cover .

pull the trimband off the housing by grabbing each side and pulling it off the front .

using pliers or tweezers , remove the connectors attached to the white and black wires .

remove the cord from the mixer body .
