Title: Fast Fix Kenmore Model 100 Clutch Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the washing machine .
turn both the hot and cold water supply lines off .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the washing machine. Turn both the hot and cold water supply lines off.

Lines.Text: disconnect the supply hoses using channel lock pliers . use the towel to catch any water that may spill out .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the supply hoses using channel lock pliers.  Use the towel to catch any water that may spill out.

Lines.Text: use the channel lock pliers to remove tension on the hose spring clamp and pull the drain line from the washer .
water will come out when hose is disconnected .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the channel lock pliers to remove tension on the hose spring clamp and pull the drain line from the washer. Water will come out when hose is disconnected.

Lines.Text: pinch the plastic tabs with the needle nose pliers and push through the metal back panel .

Steps.Text_raw: Pinch the plastic tabs with the needle nose pliers and push through the metal back panel.

Lines.Text: pull up the control panel located on top of the washer machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull up the control panel located on top of the washer machine.

Lines.Text: lift the plastic tab on the timer wiring harness connector and pull from the timer .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the plastic tab on the timer wiring harness connector and pull from the timer.

Lines.Text: disconnect the hose and wiring harness from water level control .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the hose and wiring harness from water level control.

Lines.Text: push tab and remove the connector that is next to the water level control on the inside of the control panel .
pull the connector from the door safety switch located on the main body of the washing machine top .
disconnect the green wire ground point inside the control panel with the ratchet and a 1 /4 inch socket .

Steps.Text_raw: Push tab and remove the connector that is next to the water level control on the inside of the control panel. Pull the connector from the door safety switch located on the main body of the washing machine top. Disconnect the green wire  ground point inside the control panel with the ratchet and a 1/4 inch socket.

Lines.Text: use the flat head screwdriver to pry out clips on left and right side on top of the machine where the control panel was .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the flat head screwdriver to pry out clips on left and right side on top of the machine where the control panel was.

Lines.Text: pull the hood gently from the front to separate from the base , leaving the tub , motor , and transmission exposed .
carefully tilt the washer and set it on the back panel

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the hood gently from the front to separate from the base, leaving the tub, motor, and transmission exposed. Carefully tilt the washer and set it on the back panel

Lines.Text: remove the pump retaining clips .
leave the pump hoses attached and move the pump aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the pump retaining clips. Leave the pump hoses attached and move the pump aside.

Lines.Text: lift the tab and remove the motor wiring harness connector .
remove the plastic clip from the transmission housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the tab and remove the motor wiring harness connector. Remove the plastic clip from the transmission housing.

Lines.Text: remove the motor retaining clip screws with the ratchet and a 1 /4 inch socket .
use the flat head screwdriver to pry retaining clips off of motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the motor retaining clip screws with the ratchet and a 1/4 inch socket. Use the flat head screw driver to pry retaining clips off of motor.

Lines.Text: separate the motor from the transmission .

be sure to check the rubber motor coupling while it is apart . the motor and the transmission will have a plastic piece with three prongs that fit into the rubber coupling . check to make sure plastic prongs have not broken and the rubber coupling is not cracked .
''if the motor coupling is cracked or broken it will need to be replaced . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the motor from the transmission. Be sure to check the rubber motor coupling while it is apart.  The motor and the transmission will have a plastic piece with three prongs that fit into the rubber coupling.  Check to make sure plastic prongs have not broken and the rubber coupling is not cracked. ''If the motor coupling is cracked or broken it will need to be replaced.''

Lines.Text: inside the wash tank , use the flat head screwdriver to pop cap off of the agitator .
remove the transmission shaft nut with the ratchet and a 7 /16 inch socket .
remove the agitator by pulling it from the transmission shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Inside the wash tank, use the flat head screw driver to pop cap off of the agitator. Remove the transmission shaft nut with the ratchet and a 7/16 inch socket. Remove the agitator by pulling it from the transmission shaft.

Lines.Text: on the bottom of the machine , remove the 3 bolts that hold the transmission in place with the ratchet and a 3 /8 inch socket .
gently pull the transmission out of the washer .

Steps.Text_raw: On the bottom of the machine, remove the 3 bolts that hold the transmission in place with the ratchet and a 3/8 inch socket. Gently pull the transmission out of the washer.

Lines.Text: remove the metal washer from the transmission shaft .
pry the retaining clip from the transmission shaft with the flat head screwdriver .
pry the spring clip from the clutch with the flat head screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the metal washer from the transmission shaft. Pry the retaining clip from the transmission shaft with the flat head screw driver. Pry the spring clip from the clutch with the flat head screw driver.

Lines.Text: remove the clutch .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the clutch.

battery replacement , you should remove the screw and pull the mini circuit board holding the battery before attempting to swap batteries .

Title: Mill Cutter Paper Stripper Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the shredder from the wall electrical outlet .
remove the shredder from its catch basket and place it face down on a flat surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the shredder from the wall electrical outlet. Remove the shredder from its catch basket and place it face down on a flat surface.

Lines.Text: locate the seven case screws and remove them with a phillips screwdriver . the screws are identified by the seven marked circles . the screws are 15 mm in length and the head diameter is 5 mm .
remove the manufacturers label in order to get to one of the hidden screws , ''if applicable . ''

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the seven case screws and remove them with a Phillips screwdriver. The screws are identified by the seven marked circles. The screws are 15 mm in length and the head diameter is 5 mm. Remove the manufacturer’s label in order to get to one of the hidden screws, ''if applicable.''

Lines.Text: remove the screws connecting the stripper guide and the base of the shredder's housing unit with a phillips screwdriver . the diameter head and screws are 10 mm in length .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screws connecting the stripper guide and the base of the shredder's housing unit with a Phillips screwdriver. The diameter head and screws are 10 mm in length.

Lines.Text: once all of the screws have been removed , pull the casing apart .
remove the stripper guide from the housing unit .
use caution to prevent the trigger guard from falling apart .

Steps.Text_raw: Once all of the screws have been removed, pull the casing apart. Remove the stripper guide from the housing unit. Use caution to prevent the trigger guard from falling apart.

Lines.Text: remove the e-clips from the gears on the left side with a flathead screwdriver .

remove screws from the gear box cover on the right side with a phillips screwdriver . the screws are identified by the two marked circles . the screws are 7 mm in length and the head diameter is 3 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the e-clips from the gears on the  left side with a flathead screwdriver. Remove screws from the gear box cover on the right side with a Phillips screwdriver. The screws are identified by the two marked circles. The screws are 7 mm in length and the head diameter is 3 mm.

Lines.Text: remove the gears from both sides .
if the gears are hard to remove , use a flathead screwdriver to help remove them . the gears also may be greasy so place them on a paper towel or newspaper .
remove the screws from the gearbox side plate with phillips screwdriver to get to the gears . the screws are 7 mm in length and the head diameter is 3 mm .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the gears from both sides. If the gears are hard to remove, use a flathead screwdriver to help remove them. The gears also may be greasy so place them on a paper towel or newspaper. Remove the screws from the gearbox  side plate with Phillips screwdriver to get to the gears. The screws are 7 mm in length and the head diameter is 3 mm.

Lines.Text: replace the mill cutter paper stripper set and stripper guide set .
use protective gloves as the blades are very sharp .

Steps.Text_raw: Replace the mill cutter paper stripper set and stripper guide set. Use protective gloves as the blades are very sharp.

Subject: Mill cutter paper stripper set and stripper guide set

Title: Cuisinart DCC-1200 Coffee Carafe Handle Replacement

Lines.Text: wedge the metal spudger between the plug and the handle .
carefully pry the plug with the metal spudger by applying pressure around the plug .
too much pressure and prying can damage the plug .

Steps.Text_raw: Wedge the metal spudger between the plug and the handle. Carefully pry the plug with the metal spudger by applying pressure around the plug. Too much pressure and prying can damage the plug.

Lines.Text: use the bit driver with the phillips ph1 bit to remove the 27 millimeter long screw in the base of the handle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the bit driver with the Phillips PH1 bit to remove the 27 millimeter long screw in the base of the handle.

Lines.Text: lift up on and remove the lid from the carafe .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up on and remove the lid from the carafe.

Lines.Text: position the metal spudger underneath the top cap of the handle .
gently pry up to extract the upper assembly cap .
pry carefully to prevent from causing aesthetic damage to upper assembly cap .

Steps.Text_raw: Position the metal spudger underneath the top cap of the handle. Gently pry up to extract the upper assembly cap. Pry carefully to prevent from causing aesthetic damage to upper assembly cap.

Lines.Text: use the bit driver with the phillips ph1 to remove the 5 millimeter screw in upper assembly of handle .
remove handle by lifting straight up .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the bit driver with the Phillips PH1 to remove the 5 millimeter screw in upper assembly of handle. Remove handle by lifting straight up.

Subject: Coffee Carafe Handle

Title: Kenmore 80 Series Upper Agitator Not Spinning

Lines.Text: kenmore series 80 ( whirlpool ) .
prior to working on unit , make sure to unplug from power source .
open lid to washer machine to expose interior of tub and agitator .

Steps.Text_raw: Kenmore Series 80 (Whirlpool). Prior to working on unit, make sure to unplug from power source. Open lid to washer machine to expose interior of tub and agitator.

Lines.Text: spin agitator by hand until small notch facing front .
insert medium flat head screwdriver into the small notch and pry cover up and off .

Steps.Text_raw: Spin agitator by hand until small notch facing front. Insert medium flat head screw driver into the small notch and pry cover up and off.

Lines.Text: looking straight down the cam , a 7 /16 head bolt can be seen .
insert 7 /16 socket with an extension to access the head of the bolt .
using free hand , hold bottom of agitator when removing bolt .
'lower agitator will try to spin when loosing agitator cam bolt .

Steps.Text_raw: Looking Straight down the cam, a 7/16" head bolt can be seen. Insert 7/16" socket with an extension to access the head of the bolt. Using free hand, hold bottom of agitator when removing bolt. 'Lower agitator will try to spin when loosing agitator cam bolt.

Lines.Text: remove agitator from washer tub by pulling straight up .
lower and upper agitator may come up together , or upper agitator may only come up .
if both upper and lower agitator were removed together , gently separate them .
put lower agitator aside , you will be only working with the upper agitator .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove agitator from washer tub by pulling straight up. Lower and upper agitator may come up together, or upper agitator may only come up. If both upper and lower agitator were removed together,  gently separate them. Put lower agitator aside, you will be only working with the upper agitator.

Lines.Text: gently remove auger cam from the top agitator .
be careful not to lose the bolt still at base of cam .
worn plastic pieces of the ratcheting dogs , may have also become broken .
make sure all parts come up and out !
when removed , place cam upside down on a flat work surface .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently remove auger cam from the top agitator. Be careful not to lose the bolt still at base of cam. Worn plastic pieces of the ratcheting dogs, may have also become broken. Make sure all parts come up and out! When removed, place cam upside down on a flat work surface.

Lines.Text: remove the retaining ring by sliding it straight up and off the cam shaft .
be cognizant , during reassembly , the retaining ring fits back into the grooves on the shaft .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the retaining ring by sliding it straight up and off the cam shaft. Be cognizant, during reassembly, the retaining ring fits back into the grooves on the shaft.

Lines.Text: with the retaining ring removed , you can now access the ratcheting dogs .
remove the 4 ratcheting dogs from their place .
be sure to remove any broken pieces of the ratcheting dogs from their seat , or new dogs will not seat properly .

Steps.Text_raw: With the retaining ring removed, you can now access the ratcheting dogs. Remove the 4 ratcheting dogs from their place. Be sure to remove any broken pieces of the ratcheting dogs from their seat, or new dogs will not seat properly.

Lines.Text: pat 80040 : 4 pk ratcheting dogs
the old ratcheting dogs should be extremely worn when compared to the new ratcheting dogs .
insert each new ratcheting dog into the 4 available slots
ensure that each ratcheting dog has free motion and is not hanging on anything .
project is now ready for reassembly !

Steps.Text_raw: Pat # 80040: 4pk Ratcheting Dogs The old ratcheting dogs should be extremely worn when compared to the new ratcheting dogs. Insert each new ratcheting dog into the 4 available slots Ensure that each ratcheting dog has free motion and is not hanging on anything. Project is now ready for reassembly!

Subject: Kenmore / Whirlpool Top Load Upper Agitator

Title: How to Reattach the Support Bracket in a Hamilton Beach 2-Slice Toaster

Lines.Text: remove all five 5 mm phillips 1 screws from the bottom of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove all five 5mm Phillips #1 screws from the bottom of the toaster.

Lines.Text: lift the top of the toaster from the bottom section of the toaster .
do this carefully so that you don't damage the switch board .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the top of the toaster from the bottom section of the toaster. Do this carefully so that you don't damage the switch board.

Lines.Text: look into the toaster and locate the two divots that the support bracket has detached from .

Steps.Text_raw: Look into the toaster and locate the two divots that the support bracket has detached from.

Lines.Text: locate the detached support bracket .
from the back of the toaster ( the side opposite the side of the toasting lever ) , you will see the broken support bracket sticking out .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the detached support bracket. From the back of the toaster (the side opposite the side of the toasting lever), you will see the broken support bracket sticking out.

Lines.Text: use the portion of the bracket that is sticking out of the back of the toaster to move the support bracket .
align the support bracket with the two divots on the moving bracket assembly .
in this particular model , the shell of the toaster cannot be completely removed . it might be helpful to have a helper hold up the shell of the toaster so that it is not in your way .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the portion of the bracket that is sticking out of the back of the toaster to move the support bracket. Align the support bracket with the two divots on the moving bracket assembly. In this particular model, the shell of the toaster cannot be completely removed. It might be helpful to have a helper hold up the shell of the toaster so that it is not in your way.

Lines.Text: using moderate force , push the teeth of the support bracket into the divots on the moving bracket assembly .
if the teeth on the support bracket are damaged , further repair might be necessary in order for them to fit into the divots .

Steps.Text_raw: Using moderate force, push the teeth of the support bracket into the divots on the moving bracket assembly. If the teeth on the support bracket are damaged, further repair might be necessary in order for them to fit into the divots.

Lines.Text: carefully lower the shell of the toaster back down to its base .
lift and lower the toasting lever a few times to ensure that the support bracket is firmly in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully lower the shell of the toaster back down to its base. Lift and lower the toasting lever a few times to ensure that the support bracket is firmly in place.

Lines.Text: screw on the bottom of the toaster using all five 5 mm phillips 1 screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Screw on the bottom of the toaster using all five 5mm Phillips #1 screws.

Title: Insignia NS-VCS14SL7 Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: push down the black button to release the dust cup .
pull the dust cup up and away from handheld portion to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down the black button to release the dust cup. Pull the dust cup up and away from handheld portion to remove.

Lines.Text: remove the five 12.0 mm screws on the back of the handheld portion using the phillips 2 screwdriver .
lift the silver cover off of the black body of the handheld portion to expose the battery and wiring .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 12.0 mm screws on the back of the handheld portion using the Phillips #2 screwdriver. Lift the silver cover off of the black body of the handheld portion to expose the battery and wiring.

Lines.Text: pull apart the red and black wires .
do so for all of the wires . ( red x1 , black x2 )

Steps.Text_raw: Pull apart the red and black wires. Do so for all of the wires. (Red x1, Black x2)

Lines.Text: remove the tape holding the battery to the black housing .
slide the entire battery bundle out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape holding the battery to the black housing. Slide the entire battery bundle out.

Subject: Battery

Title: Insignia NS-VCS14SL7 Motor Replacement

Lines.Text: push down the black button to release the dust cup .
pull the dust cup up and away from handheld portion to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Push down the black button to release the dust cup. Pull the dust cup up and away from handheld portion to remove.

Lines.Text: remove the five 12.0 mm screws on the back of the handheld portion using the phillips 2 screwdriver .
lift the silver cover off of the black body of the handheld portion to expose the battery and wiring .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the five 12.0 mm screws on the back of the handheld portion using the Phillips #2 screwdriver. Lift the silver cover off of the black body of the handheld portion to expose the battery and wiring.

Lines.Text: pull apart the red and black wires .
do so for all of the wires . ( red x1 , black x2 )

Steps.Text_raw: Pull apart the red and black wires. Do so for all of the wires. (Red x1, Black x2)

Lines.Text: remove the tape holding the battery to the black housing .
slide the entire battery bundle out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the tape holding the battery to the black housing. Slide the entire battery bundle out.

Lines.Text: use plastic spudger to remove blue wire from motor , freeing the motor .

Steps.Text_raw: Use plastic spudger to remove blue wire from motor, freeing the motor.

Lines.Text: twist and pull black casing off of the motor , leaving the motor and irremovable black impeller housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist and pull black casing off of the motor, leaving the motor and irremovable black impeller housing.

Subject: Motor

pull the dust cup up and away from handheld portion to remove .

lift the silver cover off of the black body of the handheld portion to expose the battery and wiring .

do so for all of the wires . ( red x1 , black x2 )

slide the entire battery bundle out .

Lines.Text: pry upwards on the retaining clip with black plastic spudger and pull to remove the 5 pin connector .

remove brown printed circuit board .
pull up on clear plastic power button assembly to remove .

Title: Cuisinart DCC-1200  Hose Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing upwards .
use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the t10 torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws .
lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing upwards. Use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the T10  Torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws. Lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker.

Lines.Text: gently squeeze the hose clamps together and begin moving the metal clamp away from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently squeeze the hose clamps together and begin moving the metal clamp away from the heating element.

Lines.Text: gently pull on the loose hose to remove it from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull on the loose hose to remove it from the heating element.

Lines.Text: squeeze the clamp with tweezers on the opposite end of the hose from the one you already removed .
once the clamp is free , gently pull upwards on the hose to remove it .
replace the disconnected hose with a new functioning hose .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the clamp  with tweezers on the opposite end of the hose from the one you already removed. Once the clamp is free, gently pull upwards on the hose to remove it. Replace the disconnected hose with a new functioning hose.

Subject: Water Hoses

Title: Cuisinart DCC-1200  Heating Element Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing up .
use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the t10 torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws .
lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing up. Use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the T10  Torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws. Lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker.

Lines.Text: squeeze the hose clamps together and begin moving the metal clamp away from the heating element .
gently pull on the loose hose to remove it from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Squeeze the hose clamps together and begin moving the metal clamp away from the heating element. Gently pull on the loose hose to remove it from the heating element.

Lines.Text: repeat previous step to disconnect the other attached water hose .

Steps.Text_raw: Repeat previous step to disconnect the other attached water hose.

Lines.Text: use the bit driver with the extension attachment with the ph1 phillips bit to remove the two 18 mm long screws on heating element plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the bit driver with the extension attachment with the PH1 Phillips bit to remove the two 18mm long screws on heating element plate.

Lines.Text: if heating contacts are connected , use a soldering iron to the bond between metal contact points .
solder iron can cause burns if used improperly

Steps.Text_raw: If heating contacts are connected, use a soldering iron to [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|desolder] the bond between metal contact points. Solder iron can cause burns if used improperly

Lines.Text: remove the heating element clamp and set aside to access the heating element .
gently squeeze and pull up on metal clamp attached to the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the heating element clamp and set aside to access the heating element. Gently squeeze and pull up on metal clamp attached to the heating element.

Lines.Text: remove and replace the defective heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove and replace the defective heating element.

Subject: Heating Element

Title: Heating Element Contacts

Lines.Text: flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing upwards .
use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the t10 torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws .
lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the coffee maker over so the bottom is facing upwards. Use the screwdriver with size 4 extension with the T10  Torx bit to remove all four 17 mm long screws. Lift the bottom cover off the bottom of the coffee maker.

solder iron can cause burns if used improperly

Title: Shark Professional Steam Pocket Mop Steam Nozzle Replacement

Lines.Text: press the mop head release button to remove it from the steam mop body .

Steps.Text_raw: Press the mop head release button to remove it from the steam mop body.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm screws holding the joint assembly to the mop head with your phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10mm screws holding the joint assembly to  the mop head with your Phillips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the two plastic hinge covers by pulling the hinges out of the joint and sliding the covers off .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two plastic hinge covers by pulling the hinges out of the joint and sliding the covers off.

Lines.Text: stretch joint assembly forward to expose two 11 mm phillips 2 screws on either side of the steam tube .
remove both screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Stretch joint assembly forward to expose two 11mm Phillips #2 screws on either side of the steam tube. Remove both screws.

Lines.Text: lift joint assembly out of hinge socket and pull upward with mild force to disconnect steam nozzle .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift joint assembly out of hinge socket and pull upward with mild force to disconnect steam nozzle.

Lines.Text: use needle nose pliers to compress metal clamp .

Steps.Text_raw: Use needle nose pliers to compress metal clamp .

Lines.Text: pull the nozzle out of the tube .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the nozzle out of the tube.

Subject: Steam Nozzle

Title: Cuisinart DCC-1200 Toggle Switch Replacement

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , gently pry out the two plastic plugs located on top .
too much pressure with the spudger may cause damage to plugs .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, gently pry out the two plastic plugs located on top. Too much pressure with the spudger may cause damage to plugs.

Lines.Text: remove the two 11 mm long screws from the top of the coffee maker underneath the cover using the bit driver with the extension with the ph1 phillips bit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 11 mm long screws from the top of the coffee maker underneath the cover using the bit driver with the extension with the PH1 Phillips bit.

Lines.Text: once the screws are removed , take the coffee maker face plate off by pulling it down and away from the rest of the coffee maker .
use care when handling the face plate once it is removed from the rest of the coffee maker as the electrical connection is still intact .

Steps.Text_raw: Once the screws are removed, take the coffee maker face plate off by pulling it down and away from the rest of the coffee maker. Use care when handling the face plate once it is removed from the rest of the coffee maker as the electrical connection is still intact.

Lines.Text: remove the electrical connection to the circuit board by carefully removing the connection by pulling straight up and away from the circuit board .
once the electrical connection is removed , separate the face plate from the rest of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the electrical connection to the circuit board by carefully removing the connection by pulling straight up and away from the circuit board. Once the electrical connection is removed, separate the face plate from the rest of the coffee maker.

Lines.Text: use the bit driver with the ph1 phillips bit to remove the three 11 mm long screws holding the circuit board to the face plate .
once the circuit board screws are removed , carefully remove the circuit board from the face plate revealing the inside of the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the bit driver with the PH1 Philips bit to remove the three 11 mm long screws holding the circuit board to the face plate. Once the circuit board screws are removed, carefully remove the circuit board from the face plate revealing the inside of the face plate.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm long screws with the bit driver with the ph1 phillips bit driver from the toggle switch plate .
once the screws are removed , remove the toggle switch plate from the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm long screws with the bit driver with the PH1 Phillips bit driver from the toggle switch plate. Once the screws are removed, remove the toggle switch plate from the face plate.

Lines.Text: remove the hex nut from behind the toggle switch on the front of the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the hex nut from behind the toggle switch on the front of the face plate.

Lines.Text: remove toggle switch by pulling it out from inside the face plate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove toggle switch by pulling it out from inside the face plate.

Subject: Toggle Switch

Lines.Text: pull out the heating element and use precision tweezers or pliers to pinch and loosen the two clamps .
remove both tubes from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out the heating element and use precision tweezers or pliers to pinch and loosen the two clamps. Remove both tubes from the heating element.

Lines.Text: grip each wire at its base and pull to disconnect them from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Grip each wire at its base and pull to disconnect them from the heating element.

Lines.Text: remove two 12.0 mm phillips head 2 screws from the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove two 12.0 mm Phillips head #2 screws from the heating element.

Lines.Text: pull apart wire connectors to fully detach the heating element .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull apart wire connectors to fully detach the heating element.

Subject: Heating Element

Title: Cuisinart CHW-12 Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the coffee-maker from the power source .
use a phillips head screwdriver to remove the four 7 mm screws from the back and the three 8 mm screws from the bottom . this will release the bottom cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the coffee-maker from the power source. Use a Phillips head screwdriver to remove the four 7mm screws from the back and the three 8mm screws from the bottom. This will release the bottom cover.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to remove the two rubber feet marked within the provided pictures .
remove both 8 mm phillips head screws found within the holes where the feet were just removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to remove the two rubber feet marked within the provided pictures. Remove both 8mm Phillips head screws found within the holes where the feet were just removed.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the cover off the bottom of the coffee maker . this will give you access to the inside of the coffee maker .
pull the gray ribbon cable strait out of the black containment box .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the cover off the bottom of the coffee maker. This will give you access to the inside of the coffee maker. Pull the gray ribbon cable strait out of the black containment box.

Lines.Text: locate the phillips head screws holding the highlighted plastic shield in place .
remove the two 14 mm screws with a phillips head screwdriver .
carefully slide the shield out of place along the power cord and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Phillips head screws holding the highlighted plastic shield in place. Remove the two 14mm screws with a Phillips head screwdriver. Carefully slide the shield out of place along the power cord and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the two 14 mm phillips head screws securing the plastic containment box .
pull the plastic containment box straight out of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 14mm Phillips head screws securing the plastic containment box. Pull the plastic containment box straight out of the coffee maker.

Lines.Text: remove the four 11 mm phillips head screws in each corner of the plastic containment box .
pull the top from the plastic housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 11mm Phillips head screws in each corner of the plastic containment box. Pull the top from the plastic housing.

Lines.Text: pull the circuit board out of the containment box .
locate the power cable connection point on the circuit board .
desolder the power cable wires connected to the board .
solder iron can cause burns if used improperly .
replace the power cable with the corresponding wires of the new power cable .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the circuit board out of the containment box. Locate the power cable connection point on the circuit board. Desolder the power cable wires connected to the board. Solder iron can cause burns if used improperly. Replace the power cable with the corresponding wires of the new power cable.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: Neato Botvac D8000 Wheel Replacement

Lines.Text: place the vacuum on its back so the brushes are visible .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the vacuum on its back so the brushes are visible.

Lines.Text: remove the four 10 mm screws with a torx t10 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 10 mm screws with a Torx T10 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the rotary brush simply by grabbing it firmly and pulling it off .
once you have removed your rotary brush and 4 bolts , you can easy remove the brush guard .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the rotary brush simply by grabbing it firmly and pulling it off. Once you have removed your rotary brush and 4 bolts, you can easy remove the brush guard.

Lines.Text: remove the brush by simply pulling it out .
from there you can clean it or replace the brush with a new one .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the brush by simply pulling it out. From there you can clean it or replace the brush with a new one.

Lines.Text: grab the rear bumper with both hands on either side .

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the rear bumper with both hands on either side.

Lines.Text: firmly pull the bumper forward at a steady pace .
when pulling the bumper forward avoid being too rough because the bumper might break .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the bumper forward at a steady pace. When pulling the bumper forward avoid being too rough because the bumper might break.

Lines.Text: looking from above , remove the two 11 mm screws with a torx t10 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Looking from above, remove the two 11mm screws with a Torx T10 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: place the robot on its back and remove the six 11 mm screws using a torx t10 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the robot on its back and remove the six 11mm screws using a Torx T10 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: push the clips , located in the back side , inward .
gently lift up the top cover until you can see the wires . then gently un-clip all the wires .
when you lift the top cover be careful because the wires are thin and fragile .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the clips, located in the back side, inward. Gently lift up the top cover until you can see the wires.  Then gently  un-clip all the wires. When you lift the top cover be careful because the wires are thin and fragile.

Lines.Text: once you have carefully removed the wire clip ; you can fully remove the top cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have carefully removed the wire clip; you can fully remove the top cover.

Lines.Text: locate the screws that mount the wheel extension to the robot .
unscrew the four 11 mm screws indicated with a torx t10 screwdriver to remove the frame .
make sure to remove the metallic weight . however , this does not require the removal of any screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws that mount the wheel extension to the Robot. Unscrew the four 11mm screws indicated with a Torx T10 screwdriver to remove the frame. Make sure to remove the metallic weight. However, this does not require the removal of any screws.

Lines.Text: delicately lift up the frame holding the laser . this will access the wheels .
detach the wheel wires that are connected to the motherboard .
once the wires are detached , the wheel are free from their casing .

Steps.Text_raw: Delicately lift up the frame holding the laser. This will access the wheels. Detach the wheel wires that are connected to the motherboard. Once the wires are detached, the wheel are free from their casing.

Lines.Text: use a torx t15 screwdriver to remove the 32.5 mm screw .
finally , just hold and separate the wheel from its axle .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Torx T15 screwdriver to remove the 32.5mm screw. Finally, just hold and separate the wheel from its axle.

Subject: Wheel

Title: Neato Botvac D8000 Battery Replacement

Lines.Text: turn the robot upside down to locate the battery cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Turn the robot upside down to locate the battery cover.

Lines.Text: use a phillips 1 screwdriver to unscrew both of the 20 mm screws .
gently lift the battery cover .
remove the battery cover to reveal the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a Phillips #1 screwdriver to unscrew both of the 20mm screws. Gently lift the battery cover. Remove the battery cover to reveal the battery.

Lines.Text: use a flathead screwdriver to push down on the latch of the battery clip .
simultaneously , pull on the battery while pushing down on the latch to detach the battery from the clip .
do not pull on the wires that are connected to the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Use a flathead screwdriver to push down on the latch of the battery clip. Simultaneously, pull on the battery while pushing down on the latch to detach the battery from the clip. Do not pull on the wires that are connected to the battery.

Subject: Battery

Steps.Text_raw: Grab the rear bumper with both hands on either side.

Lines.Text: firmly pull the bumper forward at a steady pace .
when pulling the bumper forward avoid being too rough because the bumper might break .

Steps.Text_raw: Firmly pull the bumper forward at a steady pace. When pulling the bumper forward avoid being too rough because the bumper might break.

Steps.Text_raw: Looking from above, remove the two 11mm screws with a Torx T10 screwdriver.

Steps.Text_raw: Place the robot on its back and remove the six 11mm screws using a Torx T10 screwdriver.

gently lift up the top cover until you can see the wires . then gently un-clip all the wires .
when you lift the top cover be careful because the wires are thin and fragile .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the clips, located in the back side, inward. Gently lift up the top cover until you can see the wires.  Then gently  un-clip all the wires. When you lift the top cover be careful because the wires are thin and fragile.

Steps.Text_raw: Once you have carefully removed the wire clip; you can fully remove the top cover.

Title: Cuisinart CHW-12 Heating Coil Replacement

Lines.Text: unplug the coffee-maker from the power source .
use a phillips head screwdriver to remove the four 7 mm screws from the back and the three 8 mm screws from the bottom . this will release the bottom cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the coffee-maker from the power source. Use a Phillips head screwdriver to remove the four 7mm screws from the back and the three 8mm screws from the bottom. This will release the bottom cover.

Lines.Text: use tweezers to remove the two rubber feet marked within the provided pictures .
remove both 8 mm phillips head screws found within the holes where the feet were just removed .

Steps.Text_raw: Use tweezers to remove the two rubber feet marked within the provided pictures. Remove both 8mm Phillips head screws found within the holes where the feet were just removed.

Lines.Text: carefully pull the cover off the bottom of the coffee maker . this will give you access to the inside of the coffee maker .
pull the gray ribbon cable strait out of the black containment box .

Steps.Text_raw: Carefully pull the cover off the bottom of the coffee maker. This will give you access to the inside of the coffee maker. Pull the gray ribbon cable strait out of the black containment box.

Lines.Text: locate the phillips head screws holding the highlighted plastic shield in place .
remove the two 14 mm screws with a phillips head screwdriver .
carefully slide the shield out of place along the power cord and set it aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the Phillips head screws holding the highlighted plastic shield in place. Remove the two 14mm screws with a Phillips head screwdriver. Carefully slide the shield out of place along the power cord and set it aside.

Lines.Text: remove the two 14 mm phillips head screws securing the plastic containment box .
pull the plastic containment box straight out of the coffee maker .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 14mm Phillips head screws securing the plastic containment box. Pull the plastic containment box straight out of the coffee maker.

Lines.Text: remove the four 11 mm phillips head screws in each corner of the plastic containment box .
pull the top from the plastic housing .
lift the circuit board out of the plastic housing and set it aside until a latter step .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 11mm Phillips head screws in each corner of the plastic containment box. Pull the top from the plastic housing. Lift the circuit board out of the plastic housing and set it aside until a latter step.

Lines.Text: remove the two 14 mm phillips head screws that hold the heating coil in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 14mm Phillips head screws that hold the heating coil in place.

Lines.Text: pull back each hose clamp so that it no longer holds the hose on the heating coil .
after the clamps are released pull both hoses off the ends of the heating coil .
set the coil aside .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull back each hose clamp so that it no longer holds the hose on the heating coil. After the clamps are released pull both hoses off the ends of the heating coil. Set the coil aside.

Lines.Text: de-solder each of the four wires connecting the coil to the circuit board .
solder iron can cause burns if used improperly .
when soldering the new wires in place make sure they are placed in the same holes the corresponding wires were taken out of .

Steps.Text_raw: De-solder each of the four wires connecting the coil to the circuit board. Solder iron can cause burns if used improperly. When soldering the new wires in place make sure they are placed in the same holes the corresponding wires were taken out of.

Title: Wolf Gourmet WGBL100S Blades Replacement

Lines.Text: flip over the pitcher to expose the base of the blade assembly .
using the h4.0 allen key from the 54 bit driver kit , attached to an impact driver , remove the socket head cap screw from the drive coupling .
apply a solvent to remove adhesive if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the pitcher to expose the base of the blade assembly. Using the H4.0 Allen key from the 54 bit driver kit, attached to an impact driver, remove the socket head cap screw from the drive coupling. Apply a solvent to remove adhesive if necessary.

Lines.Text: using a pair of pliers , pull of the drive shaft coupling .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a pair of pliers, pull of the drive shaft coupling.

Lines.Text: using a flat head screwdriver and a mallet , bend down the two tabs holding the large nut .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a flat head screwdriver and a mallet, bend down the two tabs holding the large nut.

Lines.Text: remove the nut using a crescent wrench .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nut using a crescent wrench.

Lines.Text: push the blade assembly into the jar .
remove the blades from the device .
be careful not to cut yourself when handling the blades .

Steps.Text_raw: Push the blade assembly into the jar. Remove the blades from the device. Be careful not to cut yourself when handling the blades.

Subject: Blender Blades

using the h4.0 allen key from the 54 bit driver kit , attached to an impact driver , remove the socket head cap screw from the drive coupling .
apply a solvent to remove adhesive if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip over the pitcher to expose the base of the blade assembly. Using the H4.0 Allen key from the 54 bit driver kit, attached to an impact driver, remove the socket head cap screw from the drive coupling. Apply a solvent to remove adhesive if necessary.

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the nut using a crescent wrench.

Lines.Text: push the blade assembly into the jar .
remove the blades from the device .
be careful not to cut yourself when handling the blades .

be careful not to cut yourself while handling the blender blades .

Title: Wolf Gourmet WGTR102S Outer Shell Replacement

Lines.Text: using a wedge , pry off the rubber pieces on the bottom of each foot of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a wedge, pry off the rubber pieces on the bottom of each foot of the toaster.

Lines.Text: remove the eight 8 mm screws on each toaster foot using a tri-point y1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the eight 8mm screws on each toaster foot using a Tri-point Y1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the crumb collector located on the bottom of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the crumb collector located on the bottom of the toaster.

Lines.Text: remove the three 8 mm screws using the tri-point y1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 8mm screws using the Tri-point Y1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the two 8 mm screws on the bottom of the slide lever using a tri-point y1 screwdriver .
once the screws are removed , detach the black plastic cover on the bottom of the slide lever .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 8mm screws on the bottom of the slide lever using a Tri-point Y1 screwdriver. Once the screws are removed,  detach the black plastic cover on the bottom of the slide lever.

Lines.Text: remove the final 8 mm screw in the slide lever .
the lever can now pull away from the entire unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the final 8mm screw in the slide lever. The lever can now pull away from the entire unit.

Lines.Text: remove toaster's outer shell by lifting straight up .
slowly remove the outer shell . disconnect ground wire before fully separating the shell and inner components .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove toaster's outer shell by lifting straight up. Slowly remove the outer shell. Disconnect ground wire before fully separating the shell and inner components.

Lines.Text: disconnect the wire cluster that connects the lights and circuit board by pulling apart the two plastic connectors .
remove the outer shell from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the wire cluster that connects the lights and circuit board by pulling apart the two plastic connectors. Remove the outer shell from the device.

Subject: Outer Shell

Title: Keurig 2.0-400 LCD Screen Replacement

Lines.Text: open the k-cup chamber housing lid by lifting up the silver handle below the lcd screen .
this is the part of the brewer you open to place a k-cup inside .

Steps.Text_raw: Open the K-Cup Chamber Housing Lid by lifting up the silver handle below the LCD screen. This is the part of the brewer you open to place a K-Cup inside.

Lines.Text: place the keurig on its side .
remove the two 140 mm screws located on the underside of the chamber lid using the phillips 1 screwdriver .
remove the top black housing that surrounds the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the Keurig on its side. Remove the two 140mm screws located on the underside of the Chamber Lid using the Phillips #1 screwdriver. Remove the top black housing that surrounds the screen.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the two 140 mm screws connecting the silver handle to the top of the keurig .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the two 140mm screws connecting the silver handle to the top of the Keurig.

Lines.Text: pull out the front silver handle from the top of the brewer .
this will further expose the lcd screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull out the front silver handle from the top of the brewer. This will further expose the LCD screen.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , pry off the snaps holding the lcd screen panel to the brewer .
warning : these snaps are very delicate and can easily be broken . practice caution as you perform this step .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, pry off the snaps holding the LCD screen panel to the brewer. Warning: These snaps are very delicate and can easily be broken. Practice caution as you perform this step.

Lines.Text: remove the top black housing by lifting it up .
this will expose the frame of the keurig connecting to the lcd screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top black housing by lifting it up. This will expose the frame of the Keurig connecting to the LCD screen.

Lines.Text: remove the black latch with the black wire connecting the front end of the panel to the frame .
the front end of the panel will now be free .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the black latch with the black wire connecting the front end of the panel to the frame. The front end of the panel will now be free.

Lines.Text: on the bottom of the panel , remove the white tab that connects the wires of the circuit board to the lcd screen
to remove the tab , squeeze in on the sides of it as you pull it out .
remove the touch screen panel from your device .

Steps.Text_raw: On the bottom of the panel, remove the white tab that connects the wires of the circuit board to the LCD screen To remove the tab, squeeze in on the sides of it as you pull it out. Remove the touch screen panel from your device.

Subject: LCD Screen

Title: Keurig 2.0-400 Circuit Board Replacement

Lines.Text: locate and grab the water reservoir with your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate and grab the Water Reservoir with your hands.

Lines.Text: lift the water reservoir up . it should be easy to separate it from the main part of the brewer .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the Water Reservoir up.  It should be easy to separate it from the main part of the brewer.

Lines.Text: remove the drip tray by pulling it out of the device .
this drip tray is the detachable bottom part of the keurig machine where you place a cup or mug .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the Drip Tray by pulling it out of the device. This Drip Tray is the detachable bottom part of the Keurig machine where you place a cup or mug.

Lines.Text: using the phillips 1 screwdriver , remove the six 140 mm screws from the bottom of the keurig machine .
if it is hard to unscrew using only the phillips 1 screw head , insert the 60 mm shaft extension into the back end of the screwdriver to help you .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the Phillips #1 screwdriver, remove the six 140mm screws from the bottom of the Keurig machine. If it is hard to unscrew using only the Phillips #1 screw head, insert the 60mm Shaft Extension into the back end of the screwdriver to help you.

Lines.Text: use the metal spudger to separate the silver panel on the right side of the keurig machine .
tilt the brewer upside down and grab the bottom of the silver panel
using your hands , peel off the silver panel from the keurig machine .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the metal spudger to separate the silver panel on the right side of the Keurig machine. Tilt the brewer upside down and grab the bottom of the silver panel Using your hands, peel off the silver panel from the Keurig machine.

Lines.Text: with one hand , place one finger inside the frame where the silver panel was attached and hold the base .
with the other hand , pull down to pop out the front housing of the keurig machine .
you should now be able to see the components inside the keurig machine .

Steps.Text_raw: With one hand, place one finger inside the frame where the silver panel was attached and hold the base. With the other hand, pull down to pop out the front housing of the Keurig machine. You should now be able to see the components inside the Keurig machine.

Lines.Text: using your hands , pry the back exterior of the brewer from the right side of the keurig .
use the blue opening tool to separate the top right silver panel from the back exterior .

Steps.Text_raw: Using your hands, pry the back exterior of the brewer from the right side of the Keurig. Use the blue opening tool to separate the top right silver panel from the back exterior.

Lines.Text: use the phillips 1 screwdriver to remove the 120 mm screw located on the top left corner from the side of the brewer where the water reservoir was .
use the phillips 1 screwdriver to remove another 120 mm screw located under the end of the empty slot running across the left side of the keurig .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to remove the 120mm screw located on the top left corner from the side of the brewer where the water reservoir was. Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to remove another 120mm screw located under the end of the empty slot running across the left side of the Keurig.

Lines.Text: separate the side panel from the top frame of the brewer , using the blue opening tool for help if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the side panel from the top frame of the brewer, using the blue opening tool for help if necessary.

Lines.Text: place the brewer on its side as shown in the picture
using the metal spudger , pry away the housing surrounding the sides of the keurig machine from the bottom .
work your way around the perimeter of the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the brewer on its side as shown in the picture Using the metal spudger, pry away the housing surrounding the sides of the Keurig machine from the bottom. Work your way around the perimeter of the base.

Lines.Text: remove the entire back exterior surrounding the keurig by removing the latches connecting the back exterior to the silver frame on top . to do this , use the metal spudger to lift the latches up and out .
the inside of the keurig should now be exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the entire back exterior surrounding the Keurig by removing the latches connecting the back exterior to the silver frame on top. To do this, use the metal spudger to lift the latches up and out. The inside of the Keurig should now be exposed.

Lines.Text: reorient the brewer as shown in the picture .
locate the four 140 mm screws holding the top frame of the keurig in place . remove these screws using the phillips 1 screwdriver .
two of the screws are on the inside of the frame close to the water heater .
you may need to decrease the size of the screwdriver in order for it to fit inside the frame . do this by taking out the bit extender .
the other two screws are located on the outside of the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Reorient the brewer as shown in the picture. Locate the four 140mm screws holding the top frame of the Keurig in place. Remove these screws using the Phillips #1 screwdriver. Two of the screws are on the inside of the frame close to the water heater. You may need to decrease the size of the screwdriver in order for it to fit inside the frame. Do this by taking out the bit extender. The other two screws are located on the outside of the frame.

Lines.Text: remove the top of the framing that encases the circuit board .
remove the wires that are connected to the top of the circuit board .
pull out the multicolored wires by their bases .
the bundle with black wires and one red wire is connected to the very top of the circuit board . to remove these wires , squeeze in the white tabs as you pull them out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top of the framing that encases the circuit board. Remove the wires that are connected to the top of the circuit board. Pull out the multicolored wires by their bases. The bundle with black wires and one red wire is connected to the very top of the circuit board. To remove these wires, squeeze in the white tabs as you pull them out.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , snap the circuit board out of the latches on the bottom of the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, snap the circuit board out of the latches on the bottom of the board.

Lines.Text: unplug the rest of the wires connecting to the circuit board by pulling them out by their bases .

in order to free the circuit board completely , you have to desolder the connections that restrain it . use our to solder and desolder connections guide to properly and safely conduct this procedure .
remove the circuit board from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the rest of the wires connecting to the circuit board by pulling them out by their bases. In order to free the circuit board completely, you have to desolder the connections that restrain it. Use our [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|How to Solder and Desolder Connections Guide] to properly and safely conduct this procedure. Remove the circuit board from the device.

Subject: Circuit Board

using your hands , peel off the silver panel from the keurig machine .

use the phillips 1 screwdriver to remove another 120 mm screw located under the end of the empty slot running across the left side of the keurig .

Steps.Text_raw: Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to remove the 120mm screw located on the top left corner from the side of the brewer where the water reservoir was. Use the Phillips #1 screwdriver to remove another 120mm screw located under the end of the empty slot running across the left side of the Keurig.

Lines.Text: separate the side panel from the top frame of the brewer , using the blue opening tool for help if necessary .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the side panel from the top frame of the brewer, using the blue opening tool for help if necessary.

Lines.Text: place the brewer on its side as shown in the picture
using the metal spudger , pry away the housing surrounding the sides of the keurig machine from the bottom .
work your way around the perimeter of the base .

Steps.Text_raw: Place the brewer on its side as shown in the picture Using the metal spudger, pry away the housing surrounding the sides of the Keurig machine from the bottom. Work your way around the perimeter of the base.

Lines.Text: remove the entire back exterior surrounding the keurig by removing the latches connecting the back exterior to the silver frame on top . to do this , use the metal spudger to lift the latches up and out .
the inside of the keurig should now be exposed .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the entire back exterior surrounding the Keurig by removing the latches connecting the back exterior to the silver frame on top. To do this, use the metal spudger to lift the latches up and out. The inside of the Keurig should now be exposed.

Lines.Text: reorient the brewer as shown in the picture .
locate the four 140 mm screws holding the top frame of the keurig in place . remove these screws using the phillips 1 screwdriver .
two of the screws are on the inside of the frame close to the water heater .
you may need to decrease the size of the screwdriver in order for it to fit inside the frame . do this by taking out the bit extender .
the other two screws are located on the outside of the frame .

Steps.Text_raw: Reorient the brewer as shown in the picture. Locate the four 140mm screws holding the top frame of the Keurig in place. Remove these screws using the Phillips #1 screwdriver. Two of the screws are on the inside of the frame close to the water heater. You may need to decrease the size of the screwdriver in order for it to fit inside the frame. Do this by taking out the bit extender. The other two screws are located on the outside of the frame.

Lines.Text: remove the top of the framing that encases the circuit board .
remove the wires that are connected to the top of the circuit board .
pull out the multicolored wires by their bases .
the bundle with black wires and one red wire is connected to the very top of the circuit board . to remove these wires , squeeze in the white tabs as you pull them out .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the top of the framing that encases the circuit board. Remove the wires that are connected to the top of the circuit board. Pull out the multicolored wires by their bases. The bundle with black wires and one red wire is connected to the very top of the circuit board. To remove these wires, squeeze in the white tabs as you pull them out.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , snap the circuit board out of the latches on the bottom of the board .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger, snap the circuit board out of the latches on the bottom of the board.

Lines.Text: unplug the rest of the wires connecting to the circuit board by pulling them out by their bases .

in order to free the circuit board completely , you have to desolder the connections that restrain it . use our to solder and desolder connections guide to properly and safely conduct this procedure .
remove the circuit board from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the rest of the wires connecting to the circuit board by pulling them out by their bases. In order to free the circuit board completely, you have to desolder the connections that restrain it. Use our [https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/How+To+Solder+and+Desolder+Connections/750|How to Solder and Desolder Connections Guide] to properly and safely conduct this procedure. Remove the circuit board from the device.

Lines.Text: pry it out from the frame by using the metal spudger .

Steps.Text_raw: Pry it out from the frame by using the metal spudger.

Lines.Text: lift the mini pump up and out of the frame using your hands .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift the Mini Pump up and out of the frame using your hands.

Lines.Text: remove the wires connecting the mini pump to the keurig , including the air tube .
the mini pump is should now be free from the brewer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the wires connecting the Mini Pump to the Keurig, including the air tube. The Mini Pump is should now be free from the brewer.

with the other hand , pull down to pop out the front housing of the keurig machine .
you should now be able to see the components inside the keurig machine .

Title: Wolf Gourmet WGBL100S Control Board Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the base of the blender upside-down .
remove the four 1 /2 long screws in the corners of the base using a phillips 2 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the base of the blender upside-down. Remove the four 1/2" long screws in the corners of the base using a Phillips #2 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: using the metal spudger , pry off one half of each rubber foot .
note that one side of the foot is glued down ; pry off the other side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the metal spudger,  pry off one half of each rubber foot. Note that one side of the foot is glued down; pry off the other side.

Lines.Text: using the same screwdriver , remove the next four 1 /2 long screws in the holes under the feet .
pull the base off of the blender .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the same screwdriver, remove the next four 1/2" long screws in the holes under the feet. Pull the base off of the blender.

Lines.Text: pull off the plastic housing .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off the plastic housing.

Lines.Text: using the same phillips 2 screwdriver , remove the two 3 /4 long screws holding the control board in place .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the same Phillips #2 screwdriver, remove the two 3/4" long screws holding the control board in place.

Lines.Text: using pliers , pull off all the connectors on the top .

Steps.Text_raw: Using pliers, pull off all the connectors on the top.

Lines.Text: pull or pry off the last connector block , then remove the control board .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull or pry off the last connector block, then remove the control board.

Subject: Control Board

Title: Wolf Gourmet WGBL100S Power Cord Replacement

Lines.Text: with the bottom of the blender facing up , use a phillips 2 screwdriver to remove the 4 , 1 /2 inch long screws in the corners of the device .
ensure the blender is off and unplugged before starting .

Steps.Text_raw: With the bottom of the blender facing up, use a Phillips #2 screwdriver to remove the 4, 1/2 inch long screws in the corners of the device. Ensure the blender is off and unplugged before starting.

Lines.Text: using a metal spudger , pry up one side of each of the rubber feet .
note that one side of each foot is glued down ; pry up the non-glued side .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a metal spudger, pry up one side of each of the rubber feet. Note that one side of each foot is glued down; pry up the non-glued side.

Lines.Text: using the same phillips 2 screwdriver , unscrew the 1 /2 inch long screw under each of the feet .

Steps.Text_raw: Using the same Phillips #2 screwdriver, unscrew the 1/2 inch long screw under each of the feet.

Lines.Text: pull off the base and remove the plastic housing underneath .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull off the base and remove the plastic housing underneath.

Lines.Text: on the underside of the base , unscrew the three 3 /8 long screws on the plastic piece holding the power cord in place using a phillips 1 screwdriver .
pull the plastic cover off .

Steps.Text_raw: On the underside of the base, unscrew the three 3/8" long screws on the plastic piece holding the power cord in place using a Phillips #1 screwdriver. Pull the plastic cover off.

Lines.Text: using a wire cutter , cut the three wires of the power cord .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a wire cutter, cut the three wires of the power cord.

Lines.Text: pull the cut power cord through the base .
then thread the replacement cord back through and re-attach the plastic cover .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull the cut power cord through the base. Then thread the replacement cord back through and re-attach the plastic cover.

Lines.Text: strip about an inch of insulation off of the snipped power cord and your replacement cord .
twist each strand of wires together to keep them neat .

Steps.Text_raw: Strip about  an inch of insulation off of the snipped power cord and your replacement cord. Twist each strand of wires together to keep them neat.

Lines.Text: twist together the wires from the replacement cord to the wires still attached to the blender .
solder the connection if possible .

Steps.Text_raw: Twist together the wires from the replacement cord to the wires still attached to the  blender. Solder the connection if possible.

Lines.Text: wrap all the connections in electrical tape or heat shrink tubing .

Steps.Text_raw: Wrap all the connections in electrical tape or heat shrink tubing.

Subject: Power Cord

Title: Wolf Gourmet WGTR102S Heat Dial Replacement

Lines.Text: using a wedge , pry off the rubber pieces on the bottom of each foot of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Using a wedge, pry off the rubber pieces on the bottom of each foot of the toaster.

Lines.Text: remove the eight 8 mm screws on each toaster foot using a tri-point y1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the eight 8mm screws on each toaster foot using a Tri-point Y1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the crumb collector located on the bottom of the toaster .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the crumb collector located on the bottom of the toaster.

Lines.Text: remove the three 8 mm screws using the tri-point y1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three 8mm screws using the Tri-point Y1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the two 8 mm screws on the bottom of the slide lever using a tri-point y1 screwdriver .
once the screws are removed , detach the black plastic cover on the bottom of the slide lever .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 8mm screws on the bottom of the slide lever using a Tri-point Y1 screwdriver. Once the screws are removed,  detach the black plastic cover on the bottom of the slide lever.

Lines.Text: remove the final 8 mm screw in the slide lever .
the lever can now pull away from the entire unit .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the final 8mm screw in the slide lever. The lever can now pull away from the entire unit.

Lines.Text: remove toaster's outer shell by lifting straight up .
slowly remove the outer shell . disconnect ground wire before fully separating the shell and inner components .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove toaster's outer shell by lifting straight up. Slowly remove the outer shell. Disconnect ground wire before fully separating the shell and inner components.

remove the outer shell from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Disconnect the wire cluster that connects the lights and circuit board by pulling apart the two plastic connectors. Remove the outer shell from the device.

Lines.Text: remove the two 4 mm screws found on each side of the circuit board using a tri-point y1 screwdriver .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the two 4mm screws found on each side of the circuit board using a Tri-point Y1 screwdriver.

Lines.Text: remove the circuit board from the device .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the circuit board from the device.

Title: How to Fit Your Keurig Elite Under Low Cabinets

Lines.Text: is this what's preventing you from happiness in the morning ? the k-cup cannot fit in the reservoir because the handle hits the low lying cabinets .

Steps.Text_raw: Is this what's preventing you from happiness in the morning? The K-Cup cannot fit in the reservoir because the handle hits the low lying cabinets.

Lines.Text: pull your keurig forward until you can extend the handle completely vertical .
push the whole keurig backwards until the now vertical handle is flush with the front of the cabinet .
use a sharpie to draw a line on the keurig handle about an inch below the bottom of the cabinet .

Steps.Text_raw: Pull your Keurig forward until you can extend the handle completely vertical. Push the whole Keurig backwards until the now vertical handle is flush with the front of the cabinet. Use a sharpie to draw a line on the Keurig handle about  an inch below the bottom of the cabinet.

Lines.Text: now use a t20 torx screwdriver to remove the screws holding both sides of the handle to the pivot of the keurig k-cup reservoir .
remove the 2 torx screws , 2 washers , and 1 handle . place the screws and the washers somewhere safe .

Steps.Text_raw: Now use a T20 Torx screwdriver to remove the screws holding both sides of the handle to the pivot of the Keurig K-Cup reservoir. Remove the 2 torx screws, 2 washers, and 1 handle. Place the screws and the washers somewhere safe.

Lines.Text: find a way to separate the handle like a turkey wishbone . i used just my hands . i wrapped a piece of paper around the break area to protect the skin on my thumbs .

with the paper in place , pull the handle apart with sufficient force to snap the handle into two pieces . it doesn't matter where the break is , just as long as it is in-between the two lines you drew .

Steps.Text_raw: Find a way to separate the handle like a turkey wishbone. I used just my hands. I wrapped a piece of paper around the break area to protect the skin on my thumbs. With the paper in place, pull the handle apart with sufficient force to snap the handle into two pieces. It doesn't matter where the break is, just as long as it is in-between the two lines you drew.

Lines.Text: use sandpaper or other means to sand the broken ends of the handle down to the lines you marked on them . this is by far the most time consuming step .
reassemble the handles with the screws and the washers . remember , the curve of the handle will wrap nicely around the k-cup reservoir and the smooth finished side will face up . refer to step 3.

Steps.Text_raw: Use sandpaper or other means to sand the broken ends of the handle down to the lines you marked on them. This is by far the most time consuming step. Reassemble the handles with the screws and the washers. Remember, the curve of the handle will wrap nicely around the K-Cup reservoir and the smooth finished side will face up. Refer to step 3.

Lines.Text: there , you're done ! enjoy your coffee in your new place !

Steps.Text_raw: There, You're done! Enjoy your coffee in your new place!
